evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

PLOT: A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.

PLOT: A team of commandos on a mission in a Central American jungle find themselves hunted by an extraterrestrial warrior.

PLOT: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.

PLOT: Maverick teacher John Keating returns in 1959 to the prestigious New England boys' boarding school where he was once a star student, using poetry to embolden his pupils to new heights of self-expression.

PLOT: A mild-mannered chemist and an ex-con must lead the counterstrike when a rogue group of military men, led by a renegade general, threaten a nerve gas attack from Alcatraz against San Francisco.

PLOT: With his wife's disappearance having become the focus of an intense media circus, a man sees the spotlight turned on him when it's suspected that he may not be innocent.

PLOT: A soldier fighting aliens gets to relive the same day over and over again, the day restarting every time he dies.

PLOT: A young, reformed gambler must return to playing high stakes poker to help a friend pay off loan sharks, while balancing his relationship with his girlfriend and his commitments to law school.

PLOT: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon a drug deal gone wrong and more than two million dollars in cash near the Rio Grande.


List B:
PLOT: The Dark Knight of Gotham City begins his war on crime with his first major enemy being Jack Napier, a criminal who becomes the clownishly homicidal Joker.

PLOT: After Homer pollutes the town's water supply, Springfield is encased in a gigantic dome by the EPA and the Simpsons are declared fugitives.

PLOT: James Bond's loyalty to M is tested when her past comes back to haunt her. When MI6 comes under attack, 007 must track down and destroy the threat, no matter how personal the cost.

PLOT: Violence ensues after an extraterrestrial race forced to live in slum-like conditions on Earth finds a kindred spirit in a government agent exposed to their biotechnology.

PLOT: In the year 2154, the very wealthy live on a man-made space station while the rest of the population resides on a ruined Earth. A man takes on a mission that could bring equality to the polarized worlds.

PLOT: A grizzled tank commander makes tough decisions as he and his crew fight their way across Germany in April, 1945.

PLOT: In the distant future, a small waste-collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.

PLOT: The story of King George VI, his unexpected ascension to the throne of the British Empire in 1936, and the speech therapist who helped the unsure monarch overcome his stammer.

PLOT: An undercover cop and a mole in the police attempt to identify each other while infiltrating an Irish gang in South Boston.

PLOT: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.


List C:
PLOT: A family determined to get their young daughter into the finals of a beauty pageant take a cross-country trip in their VW bus.

PLOT: The solitary life of an artificial man - who was incompletely constructed and has scissors for hands - is upended when he is taken in by a suburban family.

PLOT: A FedEx executive undergoes a physical and emotional transformation after crash landing on a deserted island.

PLOT: In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters.

PLOT: Shrek and Fiona travel to the Kingdom of Far Far Away, where Fiona's parents are King and Queen, to celebrate their marriage. When they arrive, they find they are not as welcome as they thought they would be.

PLOT: Armed with a super-suit with the astonishing ability to shrink in scale but increase in strength, cat burglar Scott Lang must embrace his inner hero and help his mentor, Dr. Hank Pym, pull off a plan that will save the world.

PLOT: A skilled London police officer, after irritating superiors with his embarrassing effectiveness, is transferred to a village where the easygoing officers object to his fervor for regulations, as a string of grisly murders strikes the town.

PLOT: A young woman with a mysterious past lands in Southport, North Carolina where her bond with a widower forces her to confront the dark secret that haunts her.

PLOT: An arms dealer confronts the morality of his work as he is being chased by an INTERPOL Agent.

PLOT: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.


List D:
PLOT: As Steve Rogers struggles to embrace his role in the modern world, he teams up with a fellow Avenger and S.H.I.E.L.D agent, Black Widow, to battle a new threat from history: an assassin known as the Winter Soldier.

PLOT: Danny Ocean and his ten accomplices plan to rob three Las Vegas casinos simultaneously.

PLOT: A writer and wall street trader, Nick, finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor, Jay Gatsby.

PLOT: The discovery of a massive river of ectoplasm and a resurgence of spectral activity allows the staff of Ghostbusters to revive the business.

PLOT: A narcissistic, self-centered weatherman finds himself in a time loop on Groundhog Day.

PLOT: Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship.

PLOT: Satirical comedy follows the machinations of Big Tobacco's chief spokesman, Nick Naylor, who spins on behalf of cigarettes while trying to remain a role model for his 12-year old son.

PLOT: A teenager believes that the newcomer in his neighborhood is a vampire. He turns to an actor in a television horror show for help to deal with the undead.

PLOT: I.R.S. auditor Harold Crick suddenly finds his mundane Chicago life to be the subject of narration only he can hear: narration that begins to affect his entire existence, from his work to his love life to his death.

PLOT: A look at the relationship between the famous physicist Stephen Hawking and his wife.


List E:
PLOT: During Prohibition, Treasury agent Eliot Ness sets out to stop ruthless Chicago gangster Al Capone, and assembles a small, incorruptible team to help him.

PLOT: Katniss Everdeen voluntarily takes her younger sister's place in the Hunger Games: a televised competition in which two teenagers from each of the twelve Districts of Panem are chosen at random to fight to the death.

PLOT: Babe, a pig raised by sheepdogs on a rural English farm, learns to herd sheep with a little help from Farmer Hoggett.

PLOT: Imprisoned on the planet Sakaar, Thor must race against time to return to Asgard and stop Ragnarök, the destruction of his world, at the hands of the powerful and ruthless villain Hela.

PLOT: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.

PLOT: Evan Treborn suffers blackouts during significant events of his life. As he grows up, he finds a way to remember these lost memories and a supernatural way to alter his life by reading his journal.

PLOT: A pragmatic paleontologist touring an almost complete theme park on an island in Central America is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the park's cloned dinosaurs to run loose.

PLOT: In the deep south during the 1930s, three escaped convicts search for hidden treasure while a relentless lawman pursues them.

PLOT: Three friends conspire to murder their awful bosses when they realize they are standing in the way of their happiness.

PLOT: The merciless 1970s rivalry between Formula One rivals James Hunt and Niki Lauda.


List F:
PLOT: As a math savant uncooks the books for a new client, the Treasury Department closes in on his activities, and the body count starts to rise.

PLOT: Foul-mouthed mutant mercenary Wade Wilson (a.k.a. Deadpool) assembles a team of fellow mutant rogues to protect a young boy with supernatural abilities from the brutal, time-traveling cyborg Cable.

PLOT: Two slacker friends try to promote their public-access cable show.

PLOT: Minnesota car salesman Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson.

PLOT: Decades after surviving the Nostromo incident, Ellen Ripley is sent out to re-establish contact with a terraforming colony but finds herself battling the Alien Queen and her offspring.

PLOT: Rich Mr. Dashwood dies, leaving his second wife and her three daughters poor by the rules of inheritance. The two eldest daughters are the title opposites.

PLOT: A Manhattan doctor embarks on a bizarre, night-long odyssey after his wife's admission of unfulfilled longing.

PLOT: Los Angeles police officer Brian O'Conner must decide where his loyalty really lies when he becomes enamored with the street racing world he has been sent undercover to destroy.

PLOT: A smart but sensible new graduate lands a job as an assistant to Miranda Priestly, the demanding editor-in-chief of a high fashion magazine.

PLOT: PROT is a patient at a mental hospital who claims to be from a faraway planet named K-PAX. His psychiatrist tries to help him, only to begin to doubt his own explanations.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, covering genres like crime, action, drama, music, and sci-fi, but with a noticeable concentration on crime and action themes.  There's a mix of settings and character types, but some overlap in the themes of vengeance and crime.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a broader range of genres, including superhero, animation, action, sci-fi, war, and historical drama. The settings and character types are diverse, spanning different time periods and worlds.  However, there's a slight leaning towards action and crime-related plots.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a more diverse range of genres, including comedy, drama, action, fantasy, and thriller. The settings and character types are varied, with a good mix of family-oriented stories and more adult-themed narratives. The plots are less focused on crime or violence compared to lists A and B.
response.list_D_description: List D showcases a mix of genres, including superhero, crime, drama, comedy, and romance. The settings and character types are diverse, but there's a noticeable presence of stories set in contemporary times. The plots are a blend of action, character-driven narratives, and some fantastical elements.
response.list_E_description: List E demonstrates a good variety of genres, including crime, action, adventure, fantasy, and biographical drama. The settings and character types are diverse, spanning different time periods and locations. The plots are a mix of action-packed adventures and more character-focused stories.
response.list_F_description: List F offers a diverse range of genres, including crime, superhero, comedy, drama, sci-fi, and romance. The settings and character types are varied, with a mix of contemporary and fantastical elements. The plots are a blend of action, character-driven narratives, and some comedic elements.
response.diversity_summarization: Overall, the six lists demonstrate a reasonable level of diversity in terms of genre, setting, and character types. While some lists lean more towards action and crime themes, others offer a broader range of stories, including comedy, fantasy, and historical dramas. The diversity is not uniform across all lists, but there's sufficient variety to suggest a reasonably diverse collection of movies.

The settings and time periods are diverse, ranging from 1930s Mississippi to Vietnam to modern-day San Francisco.  The plots explore themes of family, friendship, war, technology, and personal struggles.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a variety of genres, including historical dramas (World War II), thrillers, fantasy, romantic dramas, and crime.  The settings and time periods are diverse, spanning from German-occupied Poland to 1990s East Germany to modern-day Tokyo.  The plots explore themes of war, identity, relationships, and the supernatural.
response.list_F_description: List F offers a mix of genres, including legal thrillers, financial dramas, historical dramas (slavery, World War II), superhero films, crime, and romantic comedies.  The settings and time periods are varied, ranging from modern-day courtrooms to 19th-century Mississippi to Nazi-occupied France.  The plots explore themes of justice, finance, race, and relationships.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there is a significant diversity in genres, settings, time periods, and themes.  While some lists show a concentration on certain types of stories (e.g., romantic relationships), the overall collection demonstrates a broad range of cinematic experiences.  However, a few common themes emerge, such as family relationships, crime, and struggles against adversity.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, two monsters realize things may not be what they think.

PLOT: A family determined to get their young daughter into the finals of a beauty pageant take a cross-country trip in their VW bus.

PLOT: A man with short-term memory loss attempts to track down his wife's murderer.

PLOT: Shrek and Fiona travel to the Kingdom of Far Far Away, where Fiona's parents are King and Queen, to celebrate their marriage. When they arrive, they find they are not as welcome as they thought they would be.

PLOT: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the shocking truth--the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence.

PLOT: Blacksmith Will Turner teams up with eccentric pirate "Captain" Jack Sparrow to save his love, the governor's daughter, from Jack's former pirate allies, who are now undead.

PLOT: A Mumbai teenager reflects on his life after being accused of cheating on the Indian version of "Who Wants to be a Millionaire?"

PLOT: Nina is a talented but unstable ballerina on the verge of stardom. Pushed to the breaking point by her artistic director and a seductive rival, Nina's grip on reality slips, plunging her into a waking nightmare.

PLOT: A mother personally challenges the local authorities to solve her daughter's murder when they fail to catch the culprit.

PLOT: The drug-induced utopias of four Coney Island people are shattered when their addictions run deep.


List B:
PLOT: Renton, deeply immersed in the Edinburgh drug scene, tries to clean up and get out, despite the allure of the drugs and influence of friends.

PLOT: When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories for ever.

PLOT: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Commonwealth and Empire, and France are surrounded by the German Army and evacuated during a fierce battle in World War II.

PLOT: A sexually frustrated suburban father has a mid-life crisis after becoming infatuated with his daughter's best friend.

PLOT: Over the course of several years, two convicts form a friendship, seeking consolation and, eventually, redemption through basic compassion.

PLOT: Teddy Daniels and Chuck Aule, two US marshals, are sent to an asylum on a remote island in order to investigate the disappearance of a patient, where Teddy uncovers a shocking truth about the place.

PLOT: After a stint in a mental institution, former teacher Pat Solitano moves back in with his parents and tries to reconcile with his ex-wife. Things get more challenging when Pat meets Tiffany, a mysterious girl with problems of her own.

PLOT: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.

PLOT: Aspiring musician Miguel, confronted with his family's ancestral ban on music, enters the Land of the Dead to find his great-great-grandfather, a legendary singer.

PLOT: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.


List C:
PLOT: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soap maker form an underground fight club that evolves into much more.

PLOT: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

PLOT: Living a life marked by violence, neo-Nazi Derek finally goes to prison after killing two black youths. Upon his release, Derek vows to change; he hopes to prevent his brother, Danny, who idolizes Derek, from following in his footsteps.

PLOT: Malcolm Crowe, a child psychologist, starts treating a young boy, Cole, who encounters dead people and convinces him to help them. In turn, Cole helps Malcolm reconcile with his estranged wife.

PLOT: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.

PLOT: The Avengers and their allies must be willing to sacrifice all in an attempt to defeat the powerful Thanos before his blitz of devastation and ruin puts an end to the universe.

PLOT: A faded movie star and a neglected young woman form an unlikely bond after crossing paths in Tokyo.

PLOT: Foul-mouthed mutant mercenary Wade Wilson (a.k.a. Deadpool) assembles a team of fellow mutant rogues to protect a young boy with supernatural abilities from the brutal, time-traveling cyborg Cable.

PLOT: Violence ensues after an extraterrestrial race forced to live in slum-like conditions on Earth finds a kindred spirit in a government agent exposed to their biotechnology.

PLOT: A puppeteer discovers a portal that leads literally into the head of movie star John Malkovich.


List D:
PLOT: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

PLOT: A tale set on death row in a Southern jail, where gentle giant John possesses the mysterious power to heal people's ailments. When the lead guard, Paul, recognizes John's gift, he tries to help stave off the condemned man's execution.

PLOT: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

PLOT: Four weeks after a mysterious, incurable virus spreads throughout the UK, a handful of survivors try to find sanctuary.

PLOT: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon a drug deal gone wrong and more than two million dollars in cash near the Rio Grande.

PLOT: Will Hunting, a janitor at M.I.T., has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.

PLOT: After awakening from a four-year coma, a former assassin wreaks vengeance on the team of assassins who betrayed her.

PLOT: A paraplegic Marine dispatched to the moon Pandora on a unique mission becomes torn between following his orders and protecting the world he feels is his home.

PLOT: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.

PLOT: In 2027, in a chaotic world in which women have somehow become infertile, a former activist agrees to help transport a miraculously pregnant woman to a sanctuary at sea.


List E:
PLOT: The Bride continues her quest of vengeance against her former boss and lover Bill, the reclusive bouncer Budd, and the treacherous, one-eyed Elle.

PLOT: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

PLOT: A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.

PLOT: A story of family, religion, hatred, oil and madness, focusing on a turn-of-the-century prospector in the early days of the business.

PLOT: When a simple jewelry heist goes horribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.


List F:
PLOT: An exploration of the dark and miserable Basin City and three of its residents, all of whom are caught up in violent corruption.

PLOT: Minnesota car salesman Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson.

PLOT: An insurance salesman discovers his whole life is actually a reality TV show.

PLOT: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.

PLOT: A stubborn teenager enlists the help of a tough U.S. Marshal to track down her father's murderer.

PLOT: In a future British dystopian society, a shadowy freedom fighter, known only by the alias of "V", plots to overthrow the tyrannical government - with the help of a young woman.

PLOT: A mysterious Hollywood action film stuntman gets in trouble with gangsters when he tries to help his neighbor's husband rob a pawn shop while serving as his getaway driver.

PLOT: Astronaut Sam Bell has a quintessentially personal encounter toward the end of his three-year stint on the Moon, where he, working alongside his computer, GERTY, sends back to Earth parcels of a resource that has helped diminish our planet's power problems.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, touching upon fantasy (Shrek, cyber-intelligence), thriller (memory loss, ballerina), crime (murder, drug addiction), and family drama (beauty pageant).  However, there's a noticeable lack of diversity in terms of cultural representation and historical settings.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a more balanced representation with genres including drama (drug addiction, convicts), thriller (asylum, mathematician), war (Dunkirk), and dark comedy (mid-life crisis). The settings and cultural contexts are more diverse than List A.
response.list_C_description: List C is a mix of action (fight club, Avengers), war (Schindler's List), crime (serial killer, heist), and fantasy (Malkovich). While it has some variety, the focus on crime and violence is more prominent than other themes.
response.list_D_description: List D presents a blend of war (Normandy, Warsaw Ghetto), drama (death row, coma), crime (boxing, diamond heist), and science fiction (Avatar, infertile world). The inclusion of historical and futuristic settings adds to the diversity, but the themes are somewhat similar.
response.list_E_description: List E features a mix of action (The Bride, Roman General), comedy (The Dude), war (Nazi-occupied France, Vietnam), and thriller (kidnapping, Gran Torino). The settings and cultural contexts are diverse, but the themes are less varied than some other lists.
response.list_F_description: List F showcases a range of genres, including crime (Fargo, heist), dystopian fiction (V for Vendetta), drama (music conservatory, L.A. crime journalism), and science fiction (Moon). The settings and themes are relatively diverse, but the overall tone leans towards darker themes.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists exhibit varying degrees of diversity in terms of genre, setting, and cultural representation. Some lists focus more on specific genres (e.g., crime, war), while others offer a broader range of themes and contexts.  Overall, there's a good representation of different genres, but the cultural and historical diversity could be improved.

PLOT: The scene is set during the French Restoration at the beginning of the 19th century. Jean Valjean, a galley slave who was sent to prison for stealing food, is now released after serving nineteen years. At first he only encounter mistrust and closed doors; only the saintly Bishop Bienvenu treats him kindly and takes him in. The bishop's truly Christian compassion and humanity not only restores Jean Valjean's faith in the good, but also smoothes his way back to an orderly life. As Monsieur Madeleine, Valjean is soon a wealthy industrialist and popular citizen, even becoming the mayor of a small provincial town. His good fortune departs, however, when he meets Fantine, one of his workers, an unmarried mother who tragically dies of consumption. The well-intentioned Valjean frees Fantine's illegitimate daughter Cosette from the clutches of her insidious foster parents, and looks after her like a father. When Valjean reveals his true identity in order to prevent an innocent man who closely resembles him from being sold into a life of slavery as a result of a police error, he is convicted yet again. Valjean soon succeeds in escaping yet again, however, and manages to live under a false name in Paris for a few years. When Cosette, now a young lady, falls in love with the young attorney Marius Pontmercy, Valjean forbids the match - because he has fallen in love with the young girl himself... At this point, however, Marius finds out about Valjean's disreputable past and about Valjean's love for her and has no choice but to keep him away from Cosette. Valjean, thinking of his former benefactor Bishop Bienvenu, now makes the ultimate sacrifice - he decides to do without Cosette. A short while later Valjean falls seriously ill, but in the face of death he leaves a message of love to the young couple: "There is only one thing in the world that is important - and that is to love each other."—Anonymous

PLOT: After making a killing, Fen returns to China a rich man. After seeking a wife on internet, he meets many women but only likes air hostess Liang/Shu Qi, who's in love with a married man and only wants friendship.

PLOT: Labeled an outcast by his brainy family, a bouncer overcomes long odds to lead a team of under performing misfits to semi-pro hockey glory, beating the crap out of everything that stands in his way.

PLOT: A writer impulsively buys a villa in Tuscany in order to change her life.

PLOT: The Man of Steel crusades for nuclear disarmament and meets Lex Luthor's latest creation, Nuclear Man.

PLOT: On the eve of their high-school graduation, two academic superstars and best friends realize they should have worked less and played more. Determined not to fall short of their peers, the girls try to cram four years of fun into one night.

PLOT: A mom looks for another source of income, when her husband leaves with the money meant for the new mobile home. A nearby Indian territory stretches across the border to Canada with a drivable frozen river between. Smuggling?

PLOT: A Christmastime drama centered around the Whitfield family's first holiday together in four years.

PLOT: On the night of the discovery of a duplicate Earth in the Solar system, an ambitious young student and an accomplished composer cross paths in a tragic accident.

The list is well-balanced, with a good representation of action, drama, and sci-fi elements.

The list is diverse, covering various tones and styles.
response.diversity_summarization: All six lists demonstrate a good level of diversity in terms of genre, tone, and themes.  While some lists lean slightly more towards certain genres (e.g., List A has more dramas), overall, the collection of lists showcases a broad spectrum of cinematic experiences.  There's a good balance between action, drama, comedy, sci-fi, fantasy, and other genres.

PLOT: The drug-induced utopias of four Coney Island people are shattered when their addictions run deep.


List B:
PLOT: When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories for ever.

PLOT: Over the course of several years, two convicts form a friendship, seeking consolation and, eventually, redemption through basic compassion.

PLOT: A sexually frustrated suburban father has a mid-life crisis after becoming infatuated with his daughter's best friend.

PLOT: A mobster travels to Hollywood to collect a debt, and discovers that the movie business is much the same as his current job.

PLOT: Teddy Daniels and Chuck Aule, two US marshals, are sent to an asylum on a remote island in order to investigate the disappearance of a patient, where Teddy uncovers a shocking truth about the place.

PLOT: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.

PLOT: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.

PLOT: Living a life marked by violence, neo-Nazi Derek finally goes to prison after killing two black youths. Upon his release, Derek vows to change; he hopes to prevent his brother, Danny, who idolizes Derek, from following in his footsteps.

PLOT: The story of King George VI, his unexpected ascension to the throne of the British Empire in 1936, and the speech therapist who helped the unsure monarch overcome his stammer.

PLOT: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soap maker form an underground fight club that evolves into much more.


List C:
PLOT: Deadpool sees an opportunity to save the day, but it doesn't go entirely as planned.

PLOT: The sole survivor of a pier shoot-out tells the story of how a notorious criminal influenced the events that began with five criminals meeting in a seemingly random police lineup.

PLOT: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

PLOT: Renton, deeply immersed in the Edinburgh drug scene, tries to clean up and get out, despite the allure of the drugs and influence of friends.

PLOT: A tale set on death row in a Southern jail, where gentle giant John possesses the mysterious power to heal people's ailments. When the lead guard, Paul, recognizes John's gift, he tries to help stave off the condemned man's execution.

PLOT: Shrek and Fiona travel to the Kingdom of Far Far Away, where Fiona's parents are King and Queen, to celebrate their marriage. When they arrive, they find they are not as welcome as they thought they would be.

PLOT: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

PLOT: Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England.

PLOT: Will Hunting, a janitor at M.I.T., has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.

PLOT: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.


List D:
PLOT: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

PLOT: The history of the United States from the 1950s to the '70s unfolds from the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75, who yearns to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart.

PLOT: A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.

PLOT: Minnesota car salesman Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson.

PLOT: Eddy persuades his three pals to pool money for a vital poker game against a powerful local mobster, Hatchet Harry. Eddy loses, after which Harry gives him a week to pay back 500,000 pounds.

PLOT: With the help of a German bounty-hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal plantation owner in Mississippi.

PLOT: When a simple jewelry heist goes horribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.

PLOT: Malcolm Crowe, a child psychologist, starts treating a young boy, Cole, who encounters dead people and convinces him to help them. In turn, Cole helps Malcolm reconcile with his estranged wife.

PLOT: After awakening from a four-year coma, a former assassin wreaks vengeance on the team of assassins who betrayed her.

PLOT: Based on the events of the brutal Ugandan dictator Idi Amin's regime as seen by his personal physician during the 1970s.


List E:
PLOT: The Bride continues her quest of vengeance against her former boss and lover Bill, the reclusive bouncer Budd, and the treacherous, one-eyed Elle.

PLOT: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

PLOT: Jeff "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire of the same name, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.

PLOT: A pragmatic U.S. Marine observes the dehumanizing effects the Vietnam War has on his fellow recruits from their brutal boot camp training to the bloody street fighting in Hue.

PLOT: Barely 21 yet, Frank is a skilled forger who has passed as a doctor, lawyer and pilot. FBI agent Carl becomes obsessed with tracking down the con man, who only revels in the pursuit.

PLOT: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mafia, covering his relationship with his wife Karen and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito.

PLOT: A faded movie star and a neglected young woman form an unlikely bond after crossing paths in Tokyo.

PLOT: Paul Rusesabagina, a hotel manager, houses over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda, Africa.

PLOT: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

PLOT: Rudyard Kipling's classic tale of Mowgli, the orphaned jungle boy raised by wild animals, and how he becomes king of the jungle.


List F:
PLOT: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.

PLOT: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon a drug deal gone wrong and more than two million dollars in cash near the Rio Grande.

PLOT: After being kidnapped and imprisoned for fifteen years, Oh Dae-Su is released, only to find that he must find his captor in five days.

PLOT: A puppeteer discovers a portal that leads literally into the head of movie star John Malkovich.

PLOT: In a future British dystopian society, a shadowy freedom fighter, known only by the alias of "V", plots to overthrow the tyrannical government - with the help of a young woman.

PLOT: In 2027, in a chaotic world in which women have somehow become infertile, a former activist agrees to help transport a miraculously pregnant woman to a sanctuary at sea.

PLOT: A writer encounters the owner of an aging high-class hotel, who tells him of his early years serving as a lobby boy in the hotel's glorious years under an exceptional concierge.

PLOT: After the death of one of his friends, a writer recounts a childhood journey with his friends to find the body of a missing boy.

PLOT: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Commonwealth and Empire, and France are surrounded by the German Army and evacuated during a fierce battle in World War II.

PLOT: Fanny, born into a poor family, is sent away to live with wealthy uncle Sir Thomas, his wife and their four children, where she'll be brought up for a proper introduction to society.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, touching upon fantasy (monsters powering a city), family drama (beauty pageant trip), thriller (memory loss and murder), historical fiction (King George III), science fiction (cyber-intelligence), adventure (pirates), coming-of-age (teenager and quiz show), psychological thriller (ballerina), crime (mother seeking justice), and social drama (drug addiction).
response.list_B_description: List B offers a mix of genres, including science fiction (memory erasure), drama (convict friendship), dark comedy (suburban father's infatuation), crime (mobster in Hollywood), thriller (asylum investigation), psychological thriller (mathematician's life), science fiction (dream-sharing technology), crime drama (neo-Nazi's redemption), historical drama (King George VI), and dark thriller (fight club).
response.list_C_description: List C presents a blend of action (Deadpool), crime (pier shoot-out), comedy (boxing promoters), drama (drug addiction), fantasy (death row inmate with healing powers), animation (Shrek), crime (intertwined mob hitmen and others), historical drama (William Wallace), drama (janitor with mathematical gift), and thriller (F.B.I. cadet and cannibal killer).
response.list_D_description: List D showcases historical drama (Schindler's List), biographical drama (Alabama man's life), historical action (Roman general's revenge), dark comedy (car salesman's crime), crime (poker game debt), historical drama (freed slave's rescue), crime thriller (jewelry heist), drama (child psychologist and boy), action thriller (former assassin's revenge), and historical drama (Idi Amin's regime).
response.list_E_description: List E features action (The Bride's revenge), war (soldiers behind enemy lines), comedy (The Dude's quest), war drama (Vietnam War), crime (con man and F.B.I. agent), crime drama (Henry Hill's life), drama (movie star and young woman), historical drama (hotel manager and refugees), superhero (Batman vs. Joker), and adventure (Mowgli).
response.list_F_description: List F includes historical drama (Polish Jewish musician), crime (hunter and drug deal), thriller (kidnapped man's revenge), surrealism (portal into Malkovich's head), dystopian fiction (freedom fighter's plot), science fiction (infertile world and pregnant woman), drama (writer and hotel owner), drama (writer's childhood journey), war drama (Dunkirk evacuation), and period drama (Fanny's upbringing).
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a wide range of genres represented, including action, adventure, animation, biographical, comedy, crime, dark comedy, drama, dystopian fiction, fantasy, historical drama, historical fiction, psychological thriller, science fiction, social drama, surrealism, thriller, and war drama.  The lists demonstrate a good balance between different themes and styles, although some genres are more prevalent than others.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: The owner of a slaughterhouse facing foreclosure instructs his obese and mentally disabled son to go on a killing spree against the people who want to buy his property.

PLOT: A look at the story behind Marvel Studios and the Marvel Cinematic Universe, featuring interviews and behind-the-scenes footage from all of the Marvel films, the Marvel One-Shots and "Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D."

PLOT: A documentary that follows top bodybuilders as they train to compete in the Mr. Olympia competition.

PLOT: A group of Marines must protect a US Embassy in the Middle East when it suddenly comes under attack from enemy forces.

PLOT: Idiocy strikes when a woman and her daughter get separated from their family during the holidays.

PLOT: A kid from middle America, desperate to move to Chicago, joins the volleyball team to get a scholarship - the only catch is that his high school only has a girls team.

PLOT: Michelle, an assassin to a new breed of killers (DNA Hackers), finds she has greater obstacles in her life... Family.

PLOT: A rockumentary about the Canadian rock band Barenaked Ladies's life, in a nutshell.

PLOT: Listening to the sweet sound of the song "You are the only one" Eugene can't choose which shore to join - America or Russia.

PLOT: A computer programmer becomes fascinated with the digital currency Bitcoin, and through his involvement in the Bitcoin community, we learn about the impending global impact of this amazing new technology.


List B:
PLOT: Mussolini reappears in Rome 72 years after his death, finding a Country still full of problems like racism and hate for politicians. Misguised for an actor, he sides with a young filmmaker and starts traveling along Italy to reconquer it.

PLOT: Uprooted by his parents' separation, teenager Kyle Moore is unable to fit into his new hometown until he stumbles upon a magical app that makes his social-media updates come true, changing his entire life.

PLOT: Looking forward to spending time with Grandma Roberts, Barbie, her sisters, and four cute puppies embark on an exciting treasure-hunt in their hometown of Willows. All that they need to do is to follow the clues. What could the prize be?

PLOT: Jake Carter is assigned to protect a "high-value package," a beautiful whistleblower trying to expose a corrupt army defense contractor.

PLOT: Immature, cheap douchebag Fábio Clóvis marries pseudo-intellectual Miá and they take a honeymoon cruise to Europe aboard a fancy passenger vessel. Fabio and Miá are invited to have dinner with the wealthy Beto Assunção and his gorgeous wife Laura in a VIP restaurant on the ship. Soon Fábio discovers that Beto was Miá's boyfriend and Miá learns that Fábio had a crush on Laura when they were classmates. Meanwhile, cynical chambermaid Suzana Mello and her estranged husband, entertainer Wilson, make a bet that Fábio and Miá will split before the end of the trip, then try to poison their relationship. When the ship arrives in Casablanca, Fábio meets his bothersome childhood friend Cabeça; this affects their honeymoon.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

PLOT: Gene Handsome is an LA homicide detective who tries to make sense of his life as he solves crime. Handsome's knack for solving mysteries is matched only by his inability to make sense of his own problems.

PLOT: A close look at the life of Cristiano Ronaldo.

PLOT: Robotic Officer Tactical Operation Research. A prototype robot intended for crime combat escapes from the development lab and goes on a killing rampage.—Anonymous

PLOT: A megalodon battles with a crocosaurus causing massive destruction. The US Army has to try and destroy the havoc creating monsters.

PLOT: Giacomo meets Giovanni, his former best friend with whom he quarreled three years before. Giovanni persuades him to go visit their third friend Aldo, who is dying in Sicily; flashbacks tell their story: Aldo was the phantom in operas, Giacomo was dubbing films in which he only made noises, and Giovanni worked as a living department-store mannequin. Unsatisfied with their careers, they try to stage their own show but women troubles separate them.


List C:
PLOT: Only a short time after the first raid, Rama goes undercover with the thugs of Jakarta and plans to bring down the syndicate and uncover the corruption within his police force.

PLOT: In 1898, Spain sends a military squad to the town of Baler, the Philippines, to protect one of the last colonies of the Spanish Empire, to prevent rebellious natives from recovering their ancient territories. Lead by Captain Enrique de las Morenas and Lieutenant Cerezo, proud military men, the soldiers are stalked at night by the rebels, and are forced to seek refuge in the church run by Fray Carmelo, Baler's priest. Turning the church into a military fort, the unrelenting heat and malaria starts to sweep across the men. After the Captain's death by a disease called beriberi, Cerezo steps in as the new leader of the squad, faced with a constant power struggle with Jimeno, a soldier from the previous squad annihilated by the rebels. Becoming more and more paranoid and obsessive with the victory and the glory of the Spanish Empire, the rebels close to Cerezo explain that Spain has already sold the Philippine Islands to the United States, ceding all the colonies of the Spanish Empire, and that the war is over. But Cerezo does not believe in the newspapers given by the rebels and is still obsessed to win at all cost. He makes a last stand in the church with his men, prolonging the battle for several months where one of the soldiers, Carlos, falling victim to opium use, searches a way to end the conflict, suspecting that all is lost, and wanting to prevent the death of his comrades.—Chockys

PLOT: Canterlot High and a rival school face off in a series of sporting events.

PLOT: Henry,his daughter Magda,his girlfriend Katharina and their newborn son live together happily,but everything starts to change when Katherina decides to live separately for a while.

PLOT: Ex-jailbirds Eddie and Paul are on parole and working in a New York diner. Their lives are a dead end. That is, until English lawyer Katherine Rookwood walks into the diner with an offer they can't refuse.

PLOT: The story of a father and son on a South-to-North road trip.

PLOT: The story of Alex, who, with the help of his charismatic grandfather, Bai Dan, embarks on a journey in search of his real self.

PLOT: A reporter is assigned to write a story about a woman who has left a string of fiancés at the altar.

PLOT: Subhash Nagre runs a parallel government in the city where he has a cult following. When his enemies plot to murder him, his son takes charge and stands up against them.

PLOT: The unenviable life of a government-agency clerk takes a horrific turn with the arrival of a new co-worker who is both his exact physical double and his opposite otherwise--he's a confident, charismatic ladies' man.


List D:
PLOT: Erika has it all: a good job, lots of friends and a secure relationship. Until the day it all falls apart. Suddenly this perfect life means nothing, and the feelings she once was able to control are no longer within reach. She starts going to group therapy and meets other people suffering from various forms of trauma. One day Erika and this eclectic group of four people decide to take matters into their own hands and heads off together in search of a way out. They start checking into hotels - a place of complete anonymity where one can wake up as a different person.—Polly_Kat

PLOT: A psychoanalyst deals with three patients who are going through various difficulties in their love life. Unfortunately, these three patients are his beloved daughters.

PLOT: A young kid is forced to live out the lies he told to become popular.

PLOT: Hannibal's a Chicago native, currently living in New York City where he regularly performs and lives alone with no pets. His credits include writing for 30 Rock, SNL and performing in several basements of bars in NYC and Chicago.

PLOT: Ash meets five residents who come together to save the day when a series of threats endanger the annual Wind Festival and the entire population of their home, Fula City

PLOT: Various analysts propose a psychological examination of the Dark Knight.

PLOT: Four friends decide to participate in the game organized by extravagant billionaire. The winner will be the one who seduces most girls during the competition.

PLOT: Two sisters are trapped under the fiberglass cover of an Olympic sized public pool and must brave the cold and each other to survive the harrowing night.

PLOT: A ski shop owner reluctantly moves himself, his wife, and their daughter into an estate as live-in help for an elderly widow. While struggling to balance his career and family life, he has recurring dreams about an angel.

PLOT: With Earth in ruins, humanity no longer takes corporeal form and exists in a virtual society known as 'DEVA'. When a hacker infiltrates the cyber universe, Officer Angela Balzac is dispatched to the surface to track him down.


List E:
PLOT: Based on the New York Times bestseller, this movie tells the incredibly inspiring and heartwarming story of August Pullman, a boy with facial differences who enters the fifth grade, attending a mainstream elementary school for the first time.

PLOT: A large, claustrophobic apartment is the setting for this intense chamber drama. In this dense setting, the inhabitants of the apartment reveal their darkest secrets, fears, obsessions and hostilities.

PLOT: Bruce Lee is universally recognized as the pioneer who elevated martial arts in film to an art form, and this documentary will reveal why Bruce Lee's flame burns brighter now than the day he died over three decades ago.

PLOT: Darr is a girl's (Kiran) story caught between one man's (Sunil) love and another man's (Rahul) obsession.

PLOT: A century after the fateful voyage of the original, modern luxury liner Titanic II sets sail. Will this ship suffer the same fate as her namesake?

PLOT: A grounded, soulful, celebratory comedy about three mothers and their adult sons. The film explores the stage after motherhood, Otherhood, when you have to redefine your relationship with your children, friends, spouse, and most importantly, yourself.

PLOT: A dramatization of George Washington's perilous gamble of crossing the Delaware River and attacking the Hessian forces at Trenton.

PLOT: A documentary chronicling the making of all three films in the Godfather trilogy.

PLOT: In the back country of Louisiana, a group of friends unearth a terrible secret that unleashes a monster from the depths of the swamp.

PLOT: A Finnish man has dreamed of becoming a Swede since childhood.


List F:
PLOT: An underdog lawyer takes on a fraudulent insurance company.

PLOT: A couple on their three-year anniversary need to decide whether to stay together or call it quits.

PLOT: On the edge of the 30th anniversary of punk rock, Punk's Not Dead takes you into the sweaty underground clubs, backyard parties, recording studios, and yes, shopping malls and stadium shows where punk rock music and culture continue to thrive. Thirty years after bands like the Ramones and the Sex Pistols infamously shocked the system with their hard, fast, status-quo-killing rock, the longest-running punk band in history is drawing bigger crowds than ever, "pop-punk" bands have found success on MTV, and kids too young to drive are forming bands that carry the torch for punk's raw, immediate sound. Meanwhile, "punk" has become a marketing concept to sell everything from cars to vodka, and dyed hair and piercings mark a rite of passage for thousands of kids. Can the true, nonconformist punk spirit still exist in today's corporatized culture? Featuring interviews, performances, and behind-the-scenes journeys with the bands, labels, fans, and press who keep punk alive, Punk's Not Dead dares to juxtapose pop-punk's music and lifestyle against the roots in the 70s and 80s, resulting in unexpected revelations. A DIY search for the soul of a subculture and a celebration of all things loud, fast, and spiked, Punk's Not Dead shows punk is stronger and more relevant today than it's ever been.—Anonymous

PLOT: Set in the small-town of Bareilly, Bitti is a free-spirited young girl who lives life on her own terms and refuses to be pressured into getting married. Her life takes a shift when she meets Chirag Dubey and Pritam Vidrohi.

PLOT: When Emily Woodrow and her friends happen on a treasure chest full of gold coins, they fail to heed the warnings of a wise old psychic, who had foretold that they would encounter trouble with a very nasty and protective Leprechaun.

PLOT: Tom (Speedman) and Dan's (Marsden) one-night stand turns into an intense power-play between captor and captive.

PLOT: Welcome to The Great Happiness Space: Rakkyo Café. The club's owner, Issei (22), has a staff of twenty boys all under his training to become the top escorts of Osaka's underground love scene. During their training, they learn how to dress, how to talk, how to walk, and most importantly, how to fake relationships with the girls who become their source of income. Join us as Osaka's number one host boy takes us on a journey through the complex and heartrenching world of love for sale in the Japanese underground.—Iris Jyoung

PLOT: Seven teenagers retreat to a country house for the weekend to make their epic, an impossibly ambitious Celtic fantasy. As the making of the video drifts from playful hilarity to argument, frustrated ambition and accusation, intimate details seep into the script and the gap between fact and fiction closes, foreshadowing later events. When the group decides to lift the mood with an Acid-inspired initiation, secret dreams and fears are revealed, and pent-up emotions released, with all their youthful intensity and passion.—L.H. Wong <as9401k56@ntuvax.ntu.ac.sg>

PLOT: In the 1880s western "Traded", a father must leave his ranch for Dodge City to save his daughter from an old enemy, putting his reputation as the fastest draw in the west to the test.

PLOT: A family man's encounter with a beautiful woman develops into a mutual fascination.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a diverse range of genres, including crime thriller, documentary, action, comedy, sports, and drama.  There's a mix of serious and lighthearted themes, and the settings vary widely.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a blend of genres, from political satire and fantasy to romance and dark comedy.  The settings are primarily in Italy and on a cruise ship, with a focus on character-driven narratives.
response.list_C_description: List C features action, war, sports, drama, and crime. The settings are diverse, ranging from Jakarta to the Philippines and New York. The themes explore corruption, war, and personal struggles.
response.list_D_description: List D presents a mix of drama, psychological thriller, comedy, and science fiction. The settings are varied, including therapy groups, New York City, and a virtual society. The themes explore mental health, identity, and societal issues.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a variety of genres, including heartwarming drama, psychological thriller, documentary, romance, disaster, comedy, historical drama, and horror. The settings and themes are diverse, reflecting a broad spectrum of human experiences.
response.list_F_description: List F includes legal drama, romantic comedy, documentary, coming-of-age story, fantasy, erotic thriller, drama, and western. The settings and themes are varied, offering a mix of serious and lighthearted content.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a significant variety of genres, settings, and themes.  While some lists lean towards specific genres (e.g., List A's mix of action and drama), the overall collection demonstrates a broad range of cinematic styles and storytelling approaches.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: A process server and his marijuana dealer wind up on the run from hitmen and a corrupt police officer after he witnesses his dealer's boss murder a competitor while trying to serve papers on him.

PLOT: At a top secret research facility in the 1960s, a lonely janitor forms a unique relationship with an amphibious creature that is being held in captivity.

PLOT: A tale of war and romance mixed in with history. The story follows two lifelong friends and a beautiful nurse who are caught up in the horror of an infamous Sunday morning in 1941.

PLOT: The comic "Bluntman and Chronic" is based on real-life stoners Jay and Silent Bob, so when they get no profit from a big-screen adaptation, they set out to wreck the movie.

PLOT: In a dystopian future, Joseph Dredd, the most famous Judge (a police officer with instant field judiciary powers), is convicted for a crime he did not commit and must face his murderous counterpart.

PLOT: The Addams Family try to rescue their beloved Uncle Fester from his gold-digging new love, a black widow named Debbie.

PLOT: A high school teacher meets his match in an over-achieving student politician.

PLOT: PROT is a patient at a mental hospital who claims to be from a faraway planet named K-PAX. His psychiatrist tries to help him, only to begin to doubt his own explanations.

PLOT: A young and parentless girl adopts a 'dog' from the local pound, completely unaware that it's supposedly a dangerous scientific experiment that's taken refuge on Earth and is now hiding from its creator and those who see it as a menace.

PLOT: A man living in a futuristic sterile colony begins to question his circumscribed existence when his friend is chosen to go to the Island, the last uncontaminated place on earth.


List B:
PLOT: A documentary that follows former U.S. Labor Secretary Robert Reich as he looks to raise awareness of the country's widening economic gap.

PLOT: Set in colonial India against Gandhi's rise to power, it's the story of 8-year-old Chuyia, who is widowed and sent to a home to live in penitence; once there, Chuyia's feisty presence deeply affects the lives of the other residents.

PLOT: A detective in post-Katrina New Orleans has a series of surreal encounters with a troop of ghostly Confederate soldiers while investigating serial killings of local prostitutes, a 1965 lynching, and corrupt local businessmen.

PLOT: An institutionalized young woman becomes terrorized by a ghost.

PLOT: American and British journalists Flynn and Michael Henderson, along with their respective news teams, meet at the beginning of the Bosnian war in Sarajevo. During their reports, the group find an orphanage run by the devoted Mrs. Savic near the frontline. Feeling sympathy, Henderson decides to take one of the children, Emira, illegally back to England.

PLOT: A chef with a mysterious past spends the day with a waitress who needs a friend.

PLOT: After a deadly plague kills most of the world's population, the remaining survivors split into two groups - one led by a benevolent elder and the other by a malevolent being - to face each other in a final battle between good and evil.

PLOT: After discovering a video showing what he believes to be his vanished sister Heather, James and a group of friends head to the forest believed to be inhabited by the Blair Witch.

PLOT: A scientist and a teacher living in a dystopian future embark on a journey of survival with a special young girl named Melanie.

PLOT: The story of the discovery of the AIDS epidemic, and the political infighting of the scientific community hampering the early fight with it.


List C:
PLOT: Three generations of women share the same problem--marriage woes--and want to put an end to it.

PLOT: A father struggling with bipolar disorder tries to win back his wife by attempting to take full responsibility of their two young, spirited daughters, who don't make the overwhelming task any easier.

PLOT: When a sudden illness and an unexpected reunion threaten dutiful housewife Elena's potential inheritance, she must hatch a desperate plan ...

PLOT: As a woman struggles to come to grips with her past in the wake of her mother's death and the disappearance of her sister, an unsettling presence emerges in her childhood home.

PLOT: In late 1800s England, Jude plans to go to the city and attend university but marries early and becomes a stonemason. When his wife leaves, he moves to the city, where he befriends his liberal cousin Sue.

PLOT: Katja's life collapses after the deaths of her husband and son in a bomb attack. After a time of mourning and injustice, Katja seeks revenge.

PLOT: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland in 1997, a comic book fan adopts the persona of his favourite hero to save his enthusiastic friend and fight a tyrannical overlord.

PLOT: A young gene researcher, Ilona, is kidnapped in a future Paris. Police Captain Karas and his team are in charge of finding her.

PLOT: Three of the most popular girls at Reagan High accidentally kill the prom queen with a jawbreaker when a kidnapping goes horribly wrong.

PLOT: Emma, a blind violinist who had recently undergone a revolutionary surgery, joins with a police detective to track a serial killer after she was an inadvertent witness to his latest crime.


List D:
PLOT: A little girl lives in a very grown-up world with her mother, who tries to prepare her for it. Her neighbor, the Aviator, introduces the girl to an extraordinary world where anything is possible, the world of the Little Prince.

PLOT: A prestigious Stockholm museum's chief art curator finds himself in times of both professional and personal crisis as he attempts to set up a controversial new exhibit.

PLOT: An English professor falls for a minor, and has to face the consequences of his actions.

PLOT: After a night of partying with a woman he picked up, a man wakes up to find her stabbed to death and is charged with her murder.

PLOT: Identical twin gangsters Ronald and Reginald Kray terrorize London during the 1960s.

PLOT: A humble businessman with a buried past seeks justice when his daughter is killed in an act of terrorism. A cat-and-mouse conflict ensues with a government official, whose past may hold clues to the killers' identities.

PLOT: A man and woman are drawn together, entangled in the life cycle of an ageless organism. Identity becomes an illusion as they struggle to assemble the loose fragments of wrecked lives.

PLOT: A dying real estate mogul transfers his consciousness into a healthy young body, but soon finds that neither the procedure nor the company that performed it are quite what they seem.

PLOT: When their new next-door neighbors turn out to be a sorority even more debaucherous than the fraternity that lived there before, Mac and Kelly team with their former enemy, Teddy, to bring the girls down.

PLOT: Orbiting a planet on the brink of war, scientists test a device to solve an energy crisis, and end up face-to-face with a dark alternate reality.


List E:
PLOT: Picking up where the first one leaves off, Light joins the task force searching for Kira in an effort to avert suspicion from himself---and get rid of L.

PLOT: A shy teenager falls for a spirit who wakes up in the body of a different person every morning.

PLOT: A Catholic teacher meets an atheist journalist, whom a group of Catholics and Priests believes has been chosen by the devil to be the Antichrist.

PLOT: An exploration of the intersection between religion and homosexuality in the U.S. and how the religious right has used its interpretation of the Bible to stigmatize the gay community.

PLOT: A teenager (Moore), disillusioned by too many examples of love gone wrong, refuses to believe that true love exists. Then this new guy (Ford) comes along...

PLOT: A U.S. actor gets a gig in South American Parador. When the dictator dies, he's forced to play him for real and gets his mistress. Can they change Parador?

PLOT: Al Pacino's deeply-felt rumination on Shakespeare's significance and relevance to the modern world through interviews and an in-depth analysis of "Richard III."

PLOT: The early career of legendary lawman Wild Bill Hickock is telescoped and culminates in his relocation in Deadwood and a reunion with Calamity Jane.

PLOT: After losing his arm in a car accident, a criminal psychologist has it replaced with a limb that belonged to a serial killer.

PLOT: A young man tries to deal with the childhood terror that has never stopped haunting him.


List F:
PLOT: Four men take time from their personal problems to reunite as a curling team and compete in a bonspiel that will restore their honour.

PLOT: Returned home to his long-estranged mother upon a request from her deathbed, a man raised by his parents in an orphanage has to confront the childhood memories that have long haunted him.

PLOT: An undercover agent relies on the support of an unstable therapy group while working a sting operation.

PLOT: An upbeat, oddball, after-hours comedy about the ups and downs of sex and shelf-stacking in the 21st century.

PLOT: A woman, named Chell, wakes up in a testing facility with no memory of how she got there. The one thing on her mind, escape.

PLOT: In the 1950s, a young boy living with his troublesome family in rural USA fantasizes that a neighboring widow is actually a vampire, responsible for a number of disappearances in the area.

PLOT: Teresa, a fifty-year-old Austrian mother, travels to the paradise of the beaches of Kenya, seeking out love from African boys. But she must confront the hard truth that on the beaches of Kenya, love is a business.

PLOT: Renata Bella feels like a failure at life and career. But when Renata attends a seminar on selling real estate, she finally finds True Love. Sam Sharpe, while a top-notch, successful salesman, is much older than Renata. She is swept away by his excessively flamboyant style and irrepressible nature. The very traits she finds romantic, however, lead to repeated conflict with her family, especially her beloved father Joe, leaving Renata trapped in the middle.—Reid Gagle

PLOT: A small financial institution called Abacus becomes the only company criminally indicted in the wake of the United States' 2008 mortgage crisis.

PLOT: Troublemaking duo Andy Bichlbaum and Mike Bonanno, posing as their industrious alter-egos, expose the people profiting from Hurricane Katrina, the faces behind the environmental disaster in Bhopal, and other shocking events.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a diverse range of genres and themes, including crime, sci-fi, war, comedy, dystopian fiction, family, romance, psychological thriller, and adventure.  The settings also vary widely, from present-day locations to futuristic and fantastical worlds.
response.list_B_description: List B focuses on more serious and socially conscious themes, including economic inequality, social injustice, war, and the AIDS epidemic.  The genres are a mix of documentary, historical drama, crime, horror, and post-apocalyptic fiction.  The settings are diverse, spanning different countries and time periods.
response.list_C_description: List C primarily deals with themes of family relationships, personal struggles, and crime, with a focus on female characters. The genres include drama, thriller, mystery, and crime fiction. The settings are varied, ranging from contemporary settings to historical England and a futuristic Paris.
response.list_D_description: List D presents a mix of genres, including children's literature, art world drama, crime, thriller, gangster films, action, romance, science fiction, and comedy. The settings and time periods are diverse, ranging from contemporary to historical.
response.list_E_description: List E explores themes of mystery, romance, religion, social commentary, and personal struggles. The genres include thriller, fantasy, drama, documentary, and romance. The settings are varied, including contemporary and historical settings.
response.list_F_description: List F offers a mix of genres, including sports, drama, thriller, comedy, science fiction, horror, and documentary. The settings and time periods are diverse, ranging from contemporary to historical.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists demonstrate a broad range of genres, themes, and settings. While some lists lean towards specific themes (e.g., social issues in List B, family relationships in List C), others showcase a wider variety. Overall, the collection of lists presents a diverse representation of cinematic storytelling.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: A cyborg, identical to the one who failed to kill Sarah Connor, must now protect her ten year old son John from an even more advanced and powerful cyborg.

PLOT: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

PLOT: A mysterious pill that enables the user to access 100% of his brain's abilities transforms a struggling writer into a financial wizard, but it also puts him in a new world with many dangers.

PLOT: A writer encounters the owner of an aging high-class hotel, who tells him of his early years serving as a lobby boy in the hotel's glorious years under an exceptional concierge.

PLOT: In a future where a special police unit is able to arrest murderers before they commit their crimes, an officer from that unit is himself accused of a future murder.

PLOT: A story of family, religion, hatred, oil and madness, focusing on a turn-of-the-century prospector in the early days of the business.

PLOT: After being bitten by a genetically-modified spider, a shy teenager gains spider-like abilities that he uses to fight injustice as a masked superhero and face a vengeful enemy.

PLOT: Eight years after the Joker's reign of chaos, Batman is coerced out of exile with the assistance of the mysterious Selina Kyle in order to defend Gotham City from the vicious guerrilla terrorist Bane.

PLOT: A seventeen-year-old aristocrat falls in love with a kind but poor artist aboard the luxurious, ill-fated R.M.S. Titanic.

PLOT: After earning 00 status and a licence to kill, secret agent James Bond sets out on his first mission as 007. Bond must defeat a private banker funding terrorists in a high-stakes game of poker at Casino Royale, Montenegro.


List B:
PLOT: Daniel Ocean recruits one more team member so he can pull off three major European heists in this sequel to Ocean's Eleven (2001).

PLOT: A mean lord exiles fairytale creatures to the swamp of a grumpy ogre, who must go on a quest and rescue a princess for the lord in order to get his land back.

PLOT: The fragile peace between apes and humans is threatened as mistrust and betrayal threaten to plunge both tribes into a war for dominance over the Earth.

PLOT: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.

PLOT: The Avengers and their allies must be willing to sacrifice all in an attempt to defeat the powerful Thanos before his blitz of devastation and ruin puts an end to the universe.

PLOT: An F.B.I. Agent and an Interpol Detective track a team of illusionists who pull off bank heists during their performances, and reward their audiences with the money.

PLOT: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

PLOT: Oakland A's general manager Billy Beane's successful attempt to assemble a baseball team on a lean budget by employing computer-generated analysis to acquire new players.

PLOT: The story revolves around sub-zero heroes: a woolly mammoth, a saber-toothed tiger, a sloth and a prehistoric combination of a squirrel and rat, known as Scrat.

PLOT: Supernatural exorcist and demonologist John Constantine helps a policewoman prove her sister's death was not a suicide, but something more.


List C:
PLOT: In a magically realistic version of Toronto, a young man must defeat his new girlfriend's seven evil exes one by one in order to win her heart.

PLOT: A faded professional wrestler must retire, but finds his quest for a new life outside the ring a dispiriting struggle.

PLOT: A new theme park, built on the original site of Jurassic Park, creates a genetically modified hybrid dinosaur, the Indominus Rex, which escapes containment and goes on a killing spree.

PLOT: In the 1960s, superpowered humans Charles Xavier and Erik Lensherr work together to find others like them, but Erik's vengeful pursuit of an ambitious mutant who ruined his life causes a schism to divide them.

PLOT: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Commonwealth and Empire, and France are surrounded by the German Army and evacuated during a fierce battle in World War II.

PLOT: A pathological liar-lawyer finds his career turned upside down when he inexplicably cannot physically lie for 24 whole hours.

PLOT: Will, who attends single parent meetings to woo women, meets Marcus, a troubled 12-year-old boy. As they become friends, Will learns to be responsible while he helps Marcus with his studies.

PLOT: Humans in a fascist, militaristic future wage war with giant alien bugs.

List D:
PLOT: Rob, a record store owner and compulsive list maker, recounts his top five breakups, including the one in progress.

PLOT: For his final assignment, a top temporal agent must pursue the one criminal that has eluded him throughout time. The chase turns into a unique, surprising and mind-bending exploration of love, fate, identity and time travel taboos.

PLOT: In the deep south during the 1930s, three escaped convicts search for hidden treasure while a relentless lawman pursues them.

PLOT: A mob enforcer's son in 1930s Illinois witnesses a murder, forcing him and his father to take to the road, and his father down a path of redemption and revenge.

PLOT: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.

PLOT: While examining the influence of the fast food industry, Morgan Spurlock personally explores the consequences on his health of a diet of solely McDonald's food for one month.

PLOT: A police detective, a bank robber, and a high-power broker enter high-stakes negotiations after the criminal's brilliant heist spirals into a hostage situation.

PLOT: A post-apocalyptic tale, in which a lone man fights his way across America in order to protect a sacred book that holds the secrets to saving humankind.


List E:
PLOT: Two astronauts work together to survive after an accident leaves them stranded in space.

PLOT: In a future where a failed climate change experiment has killed all life except for the survivors who boarded the Snowpiercer (a train that travels around the globe), a new class system emerges.

PLOT: As Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the social networking site that would become known as Facebook, he is sued by the twins who claimed he stole their idea and by the co-founder who was later squeezed out of the business.

PLOT: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, billionaire engineer Tony Stark creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.

PLOT: Thomas is deposited in a community of boys after his memory is erased, soon learning they're all trapped in a maze that will require him to join forces with fellow "runners" for a shot at escape.

PLOT: An ex-hitman comes out of retirement to track down the gangsters who killed his dog and stole his car.

PLOT: Faced with an unplanned pregnancy, an offbeat young woman makes a selfless decision regarding the unborn child.

PLOT: When Earth becomes uninhabitable in the future, a farmer and ex-NASA pilot, Joseph Cooper, is tasked to pilot a spacecraft, along with a team of researchers, to find a new planet for humans.

PLOT: Henry Roth is a man afraid of commitment until he meets the beautiful Lucy. They hit it off and Henry think he's finally found the girl of his dreams until discovering she has short-term memory loss and forgets him the next day.

PLOT: Friendless Peter Klaven goes on a series of man-dates to find a Best Man for his wedding. But, when his insta-bond with his new B.F.F. puts a strain on his relationship with his fiancée, can the trio learn to live happily ever after?


List F:
PLOT: After narrowly escaping a bizarre accident, a troubled teenager is plagued by visions of a man in a large rabbit suit who manipulates him to commit a series of crimes.

PLOT: A soldier wakes up in someone else's body and discovers he's part of an experimental government program to find the bomber of a commuter train within 8 minutes.

PLOT: Three company workers who hate their jobs decide to rebel against their greedy boss.

PLOT: Nina is a talented but unstable ballerina on the verge of stardom. Pushed to the breaking point by her artistic director and a seductive rival, Nina's grip on reality slips, plunging her into a waking nightmare.

PLOT: An attorney intending on climbing the career ladder toward success finds an unlikely opponent in a manipulative criminal he is trying to prosecute.

PLOT: In 2006-2007 a group of investors bet against the United States mortgage market. In their research, they discover how flawed and corrupt the market is.

PLOT: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.

PLOT: An idealistic FBI agent is enlisted by a government task force to aid in the escalating war against drugs at the border area between the U.S. and Mexico.

PLOT: A world-class playboy and part-time secret agent from the 1960s emerges after thirty years in a cryogenic state to battle with his nemesis Dr. Evil.

PLOT: A kind-hearted street urchin and a power-hungry Grand Vizier vie for a magic lamp that has the power to make their deepest wishes come true.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, covering genres like science fiction, crime, thriller, drama, and romance, but with a focus on action and adventure.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a mix of genres including heist, fantasy, science fiction, biographical, superhero, and crime, showcasing some diversity but with less thematic cohesion.
