evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: Two Jedi escape a hostile blockade to find allies and come across a young boy who may bring balance to the Force, but the long dormant Sith resurface to claim their original glory.

PLOT: A popular high-school cheerleader becomes pregnant by the star quarterback and turns to crime to support her desired lifestyle.

PLOT: Harry Potter, Ron and Hermione return to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for their third year of study, where they delve into the mystery surrounding an escaped prisoner who poses a dangerous threat to the young wizard.

PLOT: A mean lord exiles fairytale creatures to the swamp of a grumpy ogre, who must go on a quest and rescue a princess for the lord in order to get his land back.

PLOT: An insurance salesman discovers his whole life is actually a reality TV show.

PLOT: A FedEx executive undergoes a physical and emotional transformation after crash landing on a deserted island.

PLOT: A soldier fighting aliens gets to relive the same day over and over again, the day restarting every time he dies.

PLOT: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the shocking truth--the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence.

PLOT: Cady Heron is a hit with The Plastics, the A-list girl clique at her new school, until she makes the mistake of falling for Aaron Samuels, the ex-boyfriend of alpha Plastic Regina George.

PLOT: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.


List B:
PLOT: In the late 1980s, a low level gangster named Jackie DiNorscio defends himself in court in what became the longest criminal trial in American judicial history.

PLOT: Desmond's wife leaves him and their 3 kids after Christmas 1953. As he's unemployed in Dublin, the authorities place the kids in orphanages; when he finds a job, he tries to get his kids back.

PLOT: Pianist David Helfgott, driven by his father and teachers, has a breakdown. Years later he returns to the piano, to popular if not critical acclaim.

PLOT: The life of Buddy Young, a comic legend in flashbacks but an old man looking for work in the present.

PLOT: A well-to-do French family deals with a series of setbacks and crises.

PLOT: James Bond is sent to investigate a KGB policy to kill all enemy spies and uncovers an arms deal that potentially has major global ramifications.

PLOT: A Puerto Rican former convict, just released from prison, pledges to stay away from drugs and violence despite the pressure around him and lead on to a better life outside of N.Y.C.

PLOT: A socially inept fourteen-year-old experiences heartbreak for the first time when his two best friends - Cappie, an older-brother figure, and Maggie, the new girl with whom he is in love - fall for each other.

PLOT: Survivors of the Raccoon City catastrophe travel across the Nevada desert, hoping to make it to Alaska. Alice joins the caravan and their fight against the evil Umbrella Corp.

PLOT: Filmmaker Alex Gibney investigates the fact that the 400 richest Americans control more wealth than the 150 million people in the bottom 50 percent of the population.


List C:
PLOT: After his girlfriend ditches him for a boorish ski jock, Lane decides that suicide is the only answer. However, his increasingly inept attempts bring him only more agony and embarrassment. Filled with the wildest teen nightmares.

PLOT: An old man makes a long journey by lawnmower to mend his relationship with an ill brother.

PLOT: When a sexy, high-end escort holds the key evidence to a scandalous government cover-up, two bumbling young detectives become her unlikely protectors from a ruthless assassin hired to silence her.

PLOT: The true story of an American town in the wake of the murder of Matthew Shepard.

PLOT: American soldiers of the 2/3 Field Artillery, a group known as the "Gunners," tell of their experiences in Baghdad during the Iraq War. Holed up in a bombed out pleasure palace built by Sadaam Hussein, the soldiers endured hostile situations some four months after President George W. Bush declared the end of major combat operations in the country.

PLOT: An injured hitman befriends his kidnapped daughter's imaginary friend; a perky blue flying unicorn.

PLOT: A mysterious stranger and a random act of violence drag a town of misfits and nitwits into the bloody crosshairs of revenge.

PLOT: Beary Barrington goes on an adventure to save Country Bear Hall by getting the Country Bears back together for a reunion concert.

PLOT: Santa, a.k.a. Scott Calvin, is faced with double-duty: how to keep his new family happy and how to stop Jack Frost from taking over Christmas.

PLOT: After his wife meets a grisly end, Jamie Ashen returns to his hometown of Ravens Fair to find answers. His investigation leads him to the ghost of a ventriloquist named Mary Shaw who seems to have ties to his entire family tree


List D:
PLOT: Two tabloid reporters checking out a report of the Archangel Michael living with an old woman find that it's true. But that's not the only surprise.

PLOT: Laurie Strode struggles to come to terms with her brother Michael's deadly return to Haddonfield, Illinois; meanwhile, Michael prepares for another reunion with his sister.

PLOT: Based on the true story, two homicide detectives track Martha Beck and Raymond Martinez Fernandez, a murderous pair known as the "Lonely Hearts Killers" who lured their victims through the personals.

PLOT: Adventurer Lara Croft goes on a quest to save the mythical Pandora's Box, before an evil scientist finds it, and recruits a former Marine turned mercenary to assist her.

PLOT: In turn-of-the-century Mexico, two very different women become a bank-robbing duo in an effort to combat a ruthless enforcer terrorizing their town.

PLOT: After Davey's father is killed in a hold-up, she and her mother and younger brother visit relatives in New Mexico. Here Davey is befriended by a young man who helps her find the strength to carry on and conquer her fears.

PLOT: A rich but troubled family find their lives altered by the arrival of a vagrant who tries to drown himself in their swimming pool.

PLOT: A young breakdancer hits his head during a talent show and slips into a coma for twenty years. Waking up in 2006, he looks to revive his and his team's career with the help of his girlfriend and his parents.

PLOT: The remake of the 1970 Neil Simon comedy follows the adventures of married couple Henry and Nancy Clark as they are vexed by misfortune while in New York City for a job interview.

PLOT: While on a grand world tour, The Muppets find themselves wrapped into an European jewel-heist caper headed by a Kermit the Frog look-alike and his dastardly sidekick.


List E:
PLOT: Romance blooms between two soldiers (Knoller, Levi) stationed in an Israeli outpost on the Lebanese border.

PLOT: A German submarine is boarded by disguised American submariners trying to capture their Enigma cipher machine.

PLOT: A tale of the mysterious, but necessary, mating ritual between men and women of today and everything they think about sex but are afraid to say.

PLOT: High school senior Katey moves to Havana in November 1958, when her dad gets a promotion at Ford. She meets a local waiter, who introduces her to sensual Cuban music/dance. They enter a big dance contest for the prize when he gets fired.

PLOT: Recorded live in 2007, the Jimmy Carr: Comedian (Live) DVD sees funnyman Jimmy Carr sharing his cynical, but always hilarious, take on life's little absurdities.

PLOT: The life and career of the hailed Hollywood movie star and underappreciated genius inventor, Hedy Lamarr.

PLOT: Nancy becomes increasingly convinced she was kidnapped as a child. When she meets a couple whose daughter went missing thirty years ago, reasonable doubts give way to willful belief.

PLOT: A neurotic, twice-divorced sci-fi writer moves back in with his mother to solve his personal problems.

PLOT: A blind teacher breaks the rules to help a female student rediscover the pleasures of life.

PLOT: With his wife doing a book tour, a father of twelve must handle a new job and his unstable brood.


List F:
PLOT: After enjoying a summer romance, high school students Danny and Sandy are unexpectedly reunited when she transfers to Rydell High. There Sandy must contend with cynical Rizzo and the Pink Ladies in attempt to win Danny's heart again.

PLOT: During the 1800s, paroled Brazilian bandit Cobra Verde is sent to West Africa with a few troops to man an old Portuguese fort and to convince the local African ruler to resume the slave trade with Brazil.

PLOT: Centers on a young girl who has been murdered and watches over her family - and her killer - from purgatory. She must weigh her desire for vengeance against her desire for her family to heal.

PLOT: When the unburied dead return to life and seek human victims, seven refugees shelter in a house in the Pennsylvanian countryside.

PLOT: Eggs of the small but voracious alien creatures called Crites are left behind on earth and, after hatching, set their appetites on the small farm town of Grover's Bend.

PLOT: A humorous take on Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's classic mysteries featuring Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson.

PLOT: A soon to be divorced Beverly Hills socialite is determined to prove to her husband and herself that she can finish what she starts out to do, by becoming a den mother to a troop of Beverly Hills Girl Scouts.

PLOT: The true story of Herb Brooks, the player-turned-coach who led the 1980 U.S. Olympic hockey team to victory over the seemingly invincible Soviet squad.

PLOT: After a Soviet space station crashes into a New York City subway tunnel, a species of venomous spiders is discovered, and soon they mutate to gigantic proportions and wreak havoc on the city.

PLOT: A tough cop is dispatched to take down a serial killer who has been targeting police officers.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes, including science fiction, teen drama, fantasy, animation, and reality TV.  There's a mix of high-concept ideas and more grounded stories, resulting in moderate diversity.
response.list_B_description: List B focuses heavily on biographical and dramatic narratives, with a few exceptions. While there's some geographical and temporal variation, the overall thematic consistency limits the diversity.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a blend of dark comedy, drama, and action, with some unique elements like an imaginary friend and a Christmas-themed story. The diversity is moderate, with a slightly darker tone.
response.list_D_description: List D offers a mix of genres, including supernatural, horror, action, and comedy. The settings and time periods vary, contributing to a relatively diverse list.
response.list_E_description: List E is a more eclectic mix, encompassing romance, war, comedy, drama, and biographical elements. The diversity is noticeable, with a range of tones and styles.
response.list_F_description: List F features a mix of teen romance, historical drama, horror, and comedy. The inclusion of a true story adds some diversity, but the overall range is less broad than some other lists.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists exhibit varying degrees of diversity. Lists A, D, and E stand out for their broader range of genres, themes, and tones. Lists B and F are more thematically consistent, while List C occupies a middle ground. Overall, there's a reasonable level of diversity across the entire batch, although some lists are more diverse than others.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes, including science fiction, coming-of-age stories, fantasy, and comedy.  There's a mix of high-concept narratives and more grounded, relatable stories. The diversity is noticeable but not exceptionally high.
response.list_B_description: List B presents a more focused selection of films. While there's some genre variety (comedy, drama, action), many of the plots center on personal struggles and relationships. The diversity is moderate.

response.list_F_description: List F contains a mix of fantasy, science fiction, and coming-of-age stories.  The inclusion of films with diverse settings and characters adds to the diversity, but the overall range isn't exceptionally wide. The diversity is moderate.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a decent level of diversity in terms of genre and themes. Some lists showcase a broader range of stories than others.  While there are instances of films from diverse cultural backgrounds and focusing on underrepresented groups, a more consistent representation across all lists would elevate the overall diversity score.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes, including action (Con Air), mystery (Mulholland Drive), science fiction (War for the Planet of the Apes), biographical (Walk the Line), fantasy (The Dog), dramedy (The Man Who Wasn't There), superhero (Megamind), science fiction (13 Going on 30), crime (Traffic), and biographical (Finding Neverland).  This variety suggests a good level of diversity.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a mix of genres, featuring adventure (Lion), fantasy (Underworld: Evolution), documentary (The Wrecking Crew), horror (The Quiet Ones), romance (A Walk to Remember), historical drama (Michael Collins), family (Paddington 2), dystopian fiction (Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials), romantic comedy (Knocked Up), and neo-western (The Ballad of Lefty Brown). The inclusion of diverse genres and settings contributes to its diversity.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a more uneven distribution of genres. While it includes fantasy (The Brothers Grimsby), horror (The Ring), science fiction (Species), adventure (The Cave), thriller (Don Champagne), mystery (The Lincoln Lawyer), romance (The Half of It), musical (The Phantom of the Opera), documentary (Rumsfeld), and horror (The Rehearsal), the concentration in horror and thriller elements reduces the overall diversity compared to other lists.
response.list_D_description: List D showcases a blend of genres, including medical drama (Contagion), historical drama (Lincoln), legal thriller (The Rainmaker), comedy (The Sure Thing), thriller (The Girl Next Door), science fiction (The Cell), crime (Traffic), biographical (Girl, Interrupted), comedy (Shakespeare in Love), and science fiction (Galaxy Quest). The variety in themes and settings contributes to a relatively diverse list.
response.list_E_description: List E displays a good mix of genres, encompassing mystery (And Then There Were None), drama (The Report), musical (The Phantom of the Opera), biographical (Seven Years in Tibet), thriller (Lake House), comedy (The First Time), romantic comedy (Disco Inferno), animation (The Good Dinosaur), drama (Wonder), and science fiction (Repo Men). The combination of different genres and storytelling styles indicates a diverse selection.
response.list_F_description: List F presents a varied selection of genres, including war (Hacksaw Ridge), romantic comedy (Bridget Jones's Diary), drama (The Dinner Party), action (The Sum of All Fears), fantasy (Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief), dramedy (Superbad), thriller (The Americans), romantic comedy (Pride and Prejudice), animation (Ice Age: Continental Drift), and drama (Good Bye, Lenin!). The range of genres and settings contributes to its diversity.
response.diversity_summarization: Lists A, B, E, and F demonstrate a high degree of diversity in genre and thematic content, showcasing a wide range of storytelling styles and settings. Lists C and D, while containing diverse elements, show less overall diversity due to a concentration in certain genres (thriller/horror in C and legal/medical drama in D).  Overall, the collection of lists shows a decent level of diversity, but some lists are more diverse than others.

A group of soldiers is sent to the hospital to eliminate the infected staff and interns but private DeLuca steals a test tube with the virus and hides it inside a vacuum flask. He is transformed into a zombie and killed but the vacuum flask falls in the grass. In the present days, a group of patients in the mental institution Ravenside Memorial Hospital finds the vacuum flask and later when one of them opens the vessel, the culture tube drops on the floor of a bathroom contaminating the group and their Dr. Donwynn.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

PLOT: A group of Italian friends is preparing for their final exams.

List F:

However, their efforts are more than headache-inducing, and when they are given one last chance to protect the boss's aunt, she is accidentally killed and the three men are sentenced to death. They come up with a plan to sell the boss to the police and the FBI. However, Al suffers from short-term memory loss and has to be told the story by John and Jack.—SWEEVO

PLOT: Documentary film exploring the rise of Club Kid legend Michael Alig and his fall in 1996 when he murdered his drug dealer/roommate Angel Melendez.

PLOT: As a string of mysterious killings grips Seattle, Bella, whose high school graduation is fast approaching, is forced to choose between her love for vampire Edward and her friendship with werewolf Jacob.

PLOT: In the near future, Major Mira Killian is the first of her kind: A human saved from a terrible crash, who is cyber-enhanced to be a perfect soldier devoted to stopping the world's most dangerous criminals.

PLOT: The story of a young geisha who falls madly in love with an american captain that travels all around the world collecting hearts.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes, including war, comedy, biography, coming-of-age, science fiction, animation, horror, action, fantasy, and Western.  The settings vary widely, from Guantanamo Bay to outer space to a small Western town. This list demonstrates significant diversity.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a mix of genres, including crime thriller, superhero, historical drama, action, romance, superhero, historical drama, psychological thriller, comedy, and coming-of-age. While there's variety, the focus on crime, drama, and personal struggles creates less diversity than List A.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a blend of romance, heist, comedy, thriller, romantic comedy, coming-of-age, political satire, espionage, documentary, and comedy. The settings and themes are diverse, but the overall tone feels less varied than List A.
response.list_D_description: List D includes fantasy, biographical documentary, religious drama, crime, drama, animation, children's animation, horror, coming-of-age, and stand-up comedy. The diversity is present but less pronounced than in List A, with a noticeable cluster around drama and coming-of-age themes.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a mix of drama, documentary, romance, documentary, stand-up comedy, science fiction, romance, science fiction, drama, and drama.  The list leans heavily towards drama and romance, limiting its overall diversity compared to List A.
response.list_F_description: List F features war drama, romantic comedy, animation, science fiction, animation, crime, documentary, teen vampire romance, science fiction, and romance. The genres are varied, but the thematic consistency is less diverse than List A.
response.diversity_summarization: Lists A and C exhibit the highest levels of diversity in terms of genre, theme, and setting. Lists B, D, E, and F show a good degree of diversity, but their thematic consistency or genre clustering reduces their overall diversity scores compared to A and C.  List A stands out for its wide-ranging representation across various genres and cultural contexts.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety of genres and themes, including crime thrillers, action, historical dramas, and character studies.  There's a mix of serious and lighter plots, though it leans towards the dramatic.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a blend of coming-of-age stories, romances, action adventures, and dark comedies.  The inclusion of a post-apocalyptic tale and a biographical drama adds some diversity, but the overall tone is relatively consistent.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a mix of genres, including financial thrillers, science fiction, comedies, and horror.  The historical and fantasy elements add further diversity, creating a more eclectic collection than lists A or B.
response.list_D_description: List D features a mix of mystery, drama, and fantasy.  The inclusion of biographical and psychological elements adds some variety, but the overall tone is more serious and less diverse than some of the other lists.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a range of genres, including war dramas, comedies, science fiction, and crime thrillers.  The inclusion of a coming-of-age story and a Western-inspired animation adds further diversity.
response.list_F_description: List F presents a diverse range of genres, including fantasy, historical dramas, comedies, and crime thrillers. The inclusion of science fiction and a story about addiction adds further variety, creating a well-rounded list.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists demonstrate varying degrees of diversity in genre and theme. Some lists, like C and F, show a wider range of genres and tones, while others, like A and D, are more focused.  Overall, there's a good representation of different storytelling styles and subject matter across all six lists.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: Flint Lockwood now works at The Live Corp Company for his idol Chester V. But he's forced to leave his post when he learns that his most infamous machine is still operational, and is churning out menacing food-animal hybrids.

PLOT: Two Irish Catholic brothers become vigilantes and wipe out Boston's criminal underworld in the name of God.

PLOT: A high school student discovers one of his classmates, Sakura Yamauchi, is suffering from a terminal illness. This secret brings the two together, as she lives out her final moments.

PLOT: A prep school student needing money agrees to "babysit" a blind man, but the job is not at all what he anticipated.

PLOT: A colorful and foul-mouthed feature musical comedy. A film about a frizzy-haired, pink-cheeked outcast named Spork who is trying to navigate her way through the annals of junior high. When a school dance show provides a chance for Spork to show up a mean girls gang, her trailer-park neighbor steps up to coach her with some "booty-poppin" moves. Featuring a vintage '90s soundtrack (that includes 2-Live Crew, JJ Fad's "SuperSonic," Dimples T's "Get It Girl"), a score by Casey James and the Staypuft Kid; and extended school hall dance sequences, Spork is a film about standing out and fitting in.—Spork

PLOT: The canine star of a fictional sci-fi/action show that believes his powers are real embarks on a cross country trek to save his co-star from a threat he believes is just as real.

PLOT: Young Blade Runner K's discovery of a long-buried secret leads him to track down former Blade Runner Rick Deckard, who's been missing for thirty years.

PLOT: When Bella Swan moves to a small town in the Pacific Northwest, she falls in love with Edward Cullen, a mysterious classmate who reveals himself to be a 108-year-old vampire.

PLOT: Rocky Balboa proudly holds the world heavyweight boxing championship, but a new challenger has stepped forward: Drago, a six-foot-four, 261-pound fighter who has the backing of the Soviet Union.

PLOT: When the evil spirit Pitch launches an assault on Earth, the Immortal Guardians team up to protect the innocence of children all around the world.


List B:
PLOT: Intrepid reporter Tintin and Captain Haddock set off on a treasure hunt for a sunken ship commanded by Haddock's ancestor.

PLOT: David Attenborough returns with a new wildlife documentary that shows life in a variety of habitats.

PLOT: Seventy-year-old widower Ben Whittaker has discovered that retirement isn't all it's cracked up to be. Seizing an opportunity to get back in the game, he becomes a senior intern at an online fashion site, founded and run by Jules Ostin.

PLOT: A woman with a troubled past sets out to find her missing brother.

PLOT: After a famous author is rescued from a car crash by a fan of his novels, he comes to realize that the care he is receiving is only the beginning of a nightmare of captivity and abuse.

PLOT: Three girls are kidnapped by a man with a diagnosed 23 distinct personalities. They must try to escape before the apparent emergence of a frightful new 24th.

PLOT: The story of a team of female African-American mathematicians who served a vital role in NASA during the early years of the U.S. space program.

PLOT: Thirty years after the ring of the first bell, Rocky Balboa comes out of retirement and dons his gloves for his final fight against the reigning heavyweight champ Mason 'The Line' Dixon.

PLOT: Pyotr Drozdov, a high-ranking government official from Moscow, is summoned by the local governor to a provincial museum of a half-forgotten classical writer.

PLOT: Aliens and their Guardians are hiding on Earth from intergalactic bounty hunters. They can only be killed in numerical order, and Number Four is next on the list. This is his story.


List C:
PLOT: A pushy boss forces her young assistant to marry her in order to keep her visa status in the U.S. and avoid deportation to Canada.

PLOT: A S.W.A.T. team becomes trapped in a tenement run by a ruthless mobster and his army of killers and thugs.

PLOT: A five-year-old Indian boy is adopted by an Australian couple after getting lost hundreds of kilometers from home. 25 years later, he sets out to find his lost family.

PLOT: Rambo returns to the jungles of Vietnam on a mission to infiltrate an enemy base-camp and rescue the American POWs still held captive there.

PLOT: Two teenagers share a profound, magical connection upon discovering they are swapping bodies. Things manage to become even more complicated when the boy and girl decide to meet in person.

PLOT: A man who believes he has put his mysterious past behind him cannot stand idly by when he meets a young girl under the control of ultra-violent Russian gangsters.


List D:
PLOT: Strange things begin to happen when a group of friends gather for a dinner party on an evening when a comet is passing overhead.

PLOT: Set in 1930s Ukraine, as Stalin advances the ambitions of communists in the Kremlin, young artist Yuri battles to save his lover Natalka from the Holodomor, the death-by-starvation program that ultimately killed millions of Ukrainians.

PLOT: A detective tries to remain loyal to his partner, and his best friend - a mobster.

PLOT: Barbie's modern adventure takes her to Paris, where she makes new friends and meets magical characters that discover their true designer talents and use their inner sparkle to save the day!

PLOT: In occupied France, Maurice and Joseph, two young Jewish brothers left to their own devices demonstrate an incredible amount of cleverness, courage, and ingenuity to escape the enemy invasion and to try to reunite their family once again.

PLOT: On Christmas Eve, a regretful husband admits to his high-spirited wife that he has hired a contract killer to take her out. She immediately flees. A nice couple offers her shelter, but everyone have dark secrets in this wacky movie.

PLOT: Seven teenagers retreat to a country house for the weekend to make their epic, an impossibly ambitious Celtic fantasy. As the making of the video drifts from playful hilarity to argument, frustrated ambition and accusation, intimate details seep into the script and the gap between fact and fiction closes, foreshadowing later events. When the group decides to lift the mood with an Acid-inspired initiation, secret dreams and fears are revealed, and pent-up emotions released, with all their youthful intensity and passion.—L.H. Wong <as9401k56@ntuvax.ntu.ac.sg>

PLOT: In order to prevent a recent high school graduate from getting engaged, two friends intervene by taking him on a cross-country road trip.


List E:
PLOT: A college grad lands a job as a financial journalist in New York City to support where she nurtures her shopping addiction and falls for a wealthy entrepreneur.

PLOT: Baaria is Sicilian slang for Bagheria where Tornatore was born and this is an autobiographic epic of three generations in the Sicilian village where he was born.

PLOT: A collection of nine short films featuring stories related to The Matrix (1999).

PLOT: A spin-off of the Get Smart movie, centered on Bruce, a techie at CONTROL, and his nerdy analyst cohort, Lloyd.

PLOT: Another planet in the period of medieval times. An employee of the institute of experimental history from Earth, who is send under the name of noble don Rumata of Estor as a spy with a mission to contact the local resident of the institute, arrives in the city of Arkanar. But the resident perishes under an unlucky attempt to make a palace coup, and Rumata have to take his place as the resident. Soon he meets all the horrors of the medieval society - a peasant war, palace coups, mass executions. To continue to be an indifferent watcher of all these horrors turns out to be simply impossible...—Toth-Amon

PLOT: A talented teenage singer-songwriter living amid domestic abuse becomes a YouTube sensation after a video in which she hides her identity goes viral.

PLOT: Discover the special bond -- and uncommon competitive spirit -- shared by the world's Rubik's Cube-solving record breakers in this documentary.

PLOT: After dying from a strange illness that she suffered for 3 years, a mother returns home to pick up her children.

PLOT: Lives of residents in a small, Anatolian village change when television is introduced to them.

PLOT: Dublin, 1904, James Joyce chats up Nora Barnacle, a hotel maid recently come from Galway. She enchants him with her frank, uninhibited manner, and before long, he's convinced her to come with him to Trieste.


List F:
PLOT: After a sudden attack on MI5, Johnny English, Britain's most confident, yet unintelligent spy, becomes Britain's only spy.

PLOT: Paranormal investigator Zak Bagans documents the most authenticated case of possession in American history.

PLOT: In the aftermath of a tragedy a woman, Magda, reacts with a surge of newfound life that engulfs her circle of family and friends.

PLOT: Fearless gunslinger Lucky Luke is ordered by the President to bring peace to Daisy Town.

PLOT: A large, claustrophobic apartment is the setting for this intense chamber drama. In this dense setting, the inhabitants of the apartment reveal their darkest secrets, fears, obsessions and hostilities.

response.list_B_description: List B offers a blend of adventure, documentary, drama, and thriller elements.  The inclusion of a documentary and diverse character-driven narratives contributes to its diversity, although some themes overlap.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: As Harry, Ron and Hermione race against time and evil to destroy the Horcruxes, they uncover the existence of the three most powerful objects in the wizarding world: the Deathly Hallows.

PLOT: A popular high school student, admired by his peers, decides to take a day off from school and goes to extreme lengths to pull it off, to the chagrin of his Principal, who'll do anything to stop him.

PLOT: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

PLOT: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.

PLOT: As a new threat to the galaxy rises, Rey, a desert scavenger, and Finn, an ex-stormtrooper, must join Han Solo and Chewbacca to search for the one hope of restoring peace.

PLOT: An astronaut becomes stranded on Mars after his team assume him dead, and must rely on his ingenuity to find a way to signal to Earth that he is alive and can survive until a potential rescue.

PLOT: With his wife's disappearance having become the focus of an intense media circus, a man sees the spotlight turned on him when it's suspected that he may not be innocent.

PLOT: To everyone's surprise, including his own, Po, an overweight, clumsy panda, is chosen as protector of the Valley of Peace. His suitability will soon be tested as the valley's arch-enemy is on his way.

PLOT: After a stint in a mental institution, former teacher Pat Solitano moves back in with his parents and tries to reconcile with his ex-wife. Things get more challenging when Pat meets Tiffany, a mysterious girl with problems of her own.

PLOT: In 2074, when the mob wants to get rid of someone, the target is sent into the past, where a hired gun awaits - someone like Joe - who one day learns the mob wants to 'close the loop' by sending back Joe's future self for assassination.


List B:
PLOT: As Harry Potter begins his sixth year at Hogwarts, he discovers an old book marked as "the property of the Half-Blood Prince" and begins to learn more about Lord Voldemort's dark past.

PLOT: When Earth becomes uninhabitable in the future, a farmer and ex-NASA pilot, Joseph Cooper, is tasked to pilot a spacecraft, along with a team of researchers, to find a new planet for humans.

PLOT: A linguist works with the military to communicate with alien lifeforms after twelve mysterious spacecraft appear around the world.

PLOT: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a woman rebels against a tyrannical ruler in search for her homeland with the aid of a group of female prisoners, a psychotic worshiper and a drifter named Max.

PLOT: Harry Potter, Ron and Hermione return to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for their third year of study, where they delve into the mystery surrounding an escaped prisoner who poses a dangerous threat to the young wizard.

PLOT: Harry Potter finds himself competing in a hazardous tournament between rival schools of magic, but he is distracted by recurring nightmares.

PLOT: Teddy Daniels and Chuck Aule, two US marshals, are sent to an asylum on a remote island in order to investigate the disappearance of a patient, where Teddy uncovers a shocking truth about the place.

PLOT: Eight years after the Joker's reign of chaos, Batman is coerced out of exile with the assistance of the mysterious Selina Kyle in order to defend Gotham City from the vicious guerrilla terrorist Bane.

PLOT: A paraplegic Marine dispatched to the moon Pandora on a unique mission becomes torn between following his orders and protecting the world he feels is his home.

PLOT: The sole survivor of a pier shoot-out tells the story of how a notorious criminal influenced the events that began with five criminals meeting in a seemingly random police lineup.


List C:
PLOT: With their warning about Lord Voldemort's return scoffed at, Harry and Dumbledore are targeted by the Wizard authorities as an authoritarian bureaucrat slowly seizes power at Hogwarts.

PLOT: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

PLOT: During World War II, the English mathematical genius Alan Turing tries to crack the German Enigma code with help from fellow mathematicians while attempting to come to terms with his troubled private life.

PLOT: An ancient prophecy seems to be coming true when a mysterious presence begins stalking the corridors of a school of magic and leaving its victims paralyzed.

PLOT: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.

PLOT: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.

PLOT: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the shocking truth--the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence.

PLOT: With the help of a German bounty-hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal plantation owner in Mississippi.

PLOT: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.

PLOT: The history of the United States from the 1950s to the '70s unfolds from the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75, who yearns to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart.


List D:
PLOT: Over the course of several years, two convicts form a friendship, seeking consolation and, eventually, redemption through basic compassion.

PLOT: In the distant future, a small waste-collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.

PLOT: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

PLOT: After witnessing his parents' death, Bruce learns the art of fighting to confront injustice. When he returns to Gotham as Batman, he must stop a secret society that intends to destroy the city.

PLOT: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.

PLOT: A wisecracking mercenary gets experimented on and becomes immortal yet hideously scarred, and sets out to track down the man who ruined his looks.

PLOT: Marty McFly, a 17-year-old high school student, is accidentally sent 30 years into the past in a time-traveling DeLorean invented by his close friend, the maverick scientist Doc Brown.

PLOT: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.

PLOT: The adventures of writer Newt Scamander in New York's secret community of witches and wizards seventy years before Harry Potter reads his book in school.

PLOT: After young Riley is uprooted from her Midwest life and moved to San Francisco, her emotions - Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust, and Sadness - conflict on how best to navigate a new city, house, and school.


List E:
PLOT: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, billionaire engineer Tony Stark creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.

PLOT: A group of intergalactic criminals must pull together to stop a fanatical warrior with plans to purge the universe.

PLOT: A writer encounters the owner of an aging high-class hotel, who tells him of his early years serving as a lobby boy in the hotel's glorious years under an exceptional concierge.

PLOT: A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a highly advanced humanoid A.I.

PLOT: In a city of anthropomorphic animals, a rookie bunny cop and a cynical con artist fox must work together to uncover a conspiracy.

PLOT: Will Hunting, a janitor at M.I.T., has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.

PLOT: A tale set on death row in a Southern jail, where gentle giant John possesses the mysterious power to heal people's ailments. When the lead guard, Paul, recognizes John's gift, he tries to help stave off the condemned man's execution.

PLOT: A special bond develops between plus-sized inflatable robot Baymax and prodigy Hiro Hamada, who together team up with a group of friends to form a band of high-tech heroes.

PLOT: In a future British dystopian society, a shadowy freedom fighter, known only by the alias of "V", plots to overthrow the tyrannical government - with the help of a young woman.

PLOT: A spy organisation recruits a promising street kid into the agency's training program, while a global threat emerges from a twisted tech genius.


List F:
PLOT: A soldier fighting aliens gets to relive the same day over and over again, the day restarting every time he dies.

PLOT: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are going to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.

PLOT: In a future where mutants are nearly extinct, an elderly and weary Logan leads a quiet life. But when Laura, a mutant child pursued by scientists, comes to him for help, he must get her to safety.

PLOT: While on a journey of physical and spiritual healing, a brilliant neurosurgeon is drawn into the world of the mystic arts.

PLOT: A rat who can cook makes an unusual alliance with a young kitchen worker at a famous Paris restaurant.

PLOT: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, two monsters realize things may not be what they think.

PLOT: Blacksmith Will Turner teams up with eccentric pirate "Captain" Jack Sparrow to save his love, the governor's daughter, from Jack's former pirate allies, who are now undead.

PLOT: A bedridden boy's grandfather reads him the story of a farmboy-turned-pirate who encounters numerous obstacles, enemies and allies in his quest to be reunited with his true love.

PLOT: While trying to lead a quiet suburban life, a family of undercover superheroes are forced into action to save the world.

PLOT: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, covering genres like fantasy, teen comedy, crime, sci-fi, action, thriller, and romantic drama.  There's a mix of high-concept plots and more grounded narratives.
response.list_B_description: List B is heavily weighted towards fantasy and science fiction, with a few thrillers mixed in.  While there's some variation in subgenres, the overall thematic consistency limits the diversity score.
response.list_C_description: List C offers a more diverse range of genres and tones, including historical drama, superhero, biographical, animation, crime, and science fiction. The inclusion of diverse settings and time periods adds to the list's diversity.
response.list_D_description: List D presents a blend of genres, including drama, science fiction, historical drama, superhero, musical, action, and animation. The inclusion of different time periods and settings contributes to the diversity.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a mix of superhero, sci-fi, drama, thriller, and animation. The plots vary in tone and setting, contributing to a reasonably diverse list.
response.list_F_description: List F includes action, superhero, drama, fantasy, and animation. The plots are diverse, but the overall thematic consistency slightly limits the diversity score.
response.diversity_summarization: Lists A, C, D, and E demonstrate a good level of diversity in terms of genre, tone, and setting. Lists B and F, while not lacking in variety, show a stronger thematic consistency, particularly in their focus on fantasy and science fiction elements. Overall, the collection of lists exhibits a moderate level of diversity.

PLOT: Two Jedi escape a hostile blockade to find allies and come across a young boy who may bring balance to the Force, but the long dormant Sith resurface to claim their original glory.

PLOT: A grizzled tank commander makes tough decisions as he and his crew fight their way across Germany in April, 1945.

PLOT: Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship.

PLOT: A woman, accidentally caught in a dark deal, turns the tables on her captors and transforms into a merciless warrior evolved beyond human logic.

PLOT: When Bella Swan moves to a small town in the Pacific Northwest, she falls in love with Edward Cullen, a mysterious classmate who reveals himself to be a 108-year-old vampire.

PLOT: A teenager at Rushmore Academy falls for a much older teacher and befriends a middle-aged industrialist. Later, he finds out that his love interest and his friend are having an affair, which prompts him to begin a vendetta.


List C:
PLOT: A film of Margaret Cho's one-woman stand-up show, in which she presents her take on modern sexual topics and minority issues.

PLOT: Scrat comes across a time machine and is transported to various times all in pursuit of his beloved acorn.

PLOT: A documentary that focuses on a dangerously legendary water park and its slew of injuries and crimes along with child safety concerns.

PLOT: 7 guys from Paris' suburbs like challenges like climbing tall buildings and doing parkour - especially with cops/flics chasing them. When a kid fan urgently needs a heart the Yamakasis try to find a way.

PLOT: Chris is young idealistic cop who falls in love and gets married to Pam, a beautiful but emotionally unstable woman who suffers from alcoholism and drug addiction. While Chris is trying hard to have a normal life and some money, Pam is big spender and their marriage is constantly troublesome with the financial situation getting worse and worse. The biggest blow comes after Chris loses his job. In the desperate situation Chris decides to use his police skills to rob banks.—Dragan Antulov <dragan.antulov@altbbs.fido.hr>

PLOT: In a post-nuclear hellscape, a master of the deadly martial art "Hokuto Shinken" allies with two kids and an expert in "Nanto Suicho-Ken" to battle the tyrants who kidnapped his lover.

PLOT: Jaq and Gus create a storybook based on three events that happened after the first film. The stories include Cinderella's opposition to the court's strict etiquette, Jaq's becoming human for a day, and Anastasia's redemption through love.

PLOT: After the Chicago Cubs blow an opportunity to reach the World Series in 2003, Cubs fans blame the team's misfortune on fellow fan Steve Bartman, who interfered with a foul ball and prevented Moises Alou from making a catch.

PLOT: A year after helping Richard get to the throne, Amber is about to become his wife. But is she really made to be queen?

PLOT: James owes his life to his older brother, Frankie after taking the rap for a crime they committed together. While Frankie served time, James worked to turn his life around, got a steady job and began courting his former girlfriend Emily. Now, Frankie is released and back on the streets with no money and no place to go.


List D:
PLOT: A stage magician's rabbit gets into a magical onstage brawl against his neglectful guardian with two magic hats.

PLOT: A comedy set in a world where no one has ever lied, until a writer seizes the opportunity for personal gain.

PLOT: Horton the Elephant struggles to protect a microscopic community from his neighbors who refuse to believe it exists.

PLOT: A young orphaned boy raised by underground cave-dwelling trash collectors tries to save his friends from an evil exterminator.

PLOT: A protege of the magician Merlin must train his teacher's successor - an introverted but resourceful physics prodigy - in the art of sorcery to prevent the return of Morgana le Fay.

PLOT: As his kingdom is being threatened by the Turks, young prince Vlad Tepes must become a monster feared by his own people in order to obtain the power needed to protect his own family, and the families of his kingdom.

PLOT: Retired CIA agent Frank Moses reunites his unlikely team of elite operatives for a global quest to track down a missing portable nuclear device.

PLOT: The Parrs' baby Jack-Jack is thought to be normal, not having any super-powers like his parents or siblings. But when an outsider is hired to watch him, Jack-Jack shows his true potential.

PLOT: Two buskers engage in a petty feud over a child's donation.

PLOT: An air marshal springs into action during a transatlantic flight after receiving a series of text messages demanding $150 million into an off-shore account, or someone will die every 20 minutes.

PLOT: In Mexico City, a former CIA operative swears vengeance on those who committed an unspeakable act against the family he was hired to protect.

PLOT: Charlie, a 15-year-old introvert, enters high school and is nervous about his new life. When he befriends his seniors, he learns to cope with his friend's suicide and his tumultuous past.

PLOT: A secret government agency recruits some of the most dangerous incarcerated super-villains to form a defensive task force. Their first mission: save the world from the apocalypse.

PLOT: In 2074, when the mob wants to get rid of someone, the target is sent into the past, where a hired gun awaits - someone like Joe - who one day learns the mob wants to 'close the loop' by sending back Joe's future self for assassination.

PLOT: A substance designed to help the brain repair itself gives advanced intelligence to a chimpanzee who leads an ape uprising.

PLOT: When a criminal mastermind uses a trio of orphan girls as pawns for a grand scheme, he finds their love is profoundly changing him for the better.

PLOT: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.

PLOT: After a stint in a mental institution, former teacher Pat Solitano moves back in with his parents and tries to reconcile with his ex-wife. Things get more challenging when Pat meets Tiffany, a mysterious girl with problems of her own.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, covering genres like science fiction, drama, animation, comedy, action, and thriller.  There's a mix of character-driven stories and plot-driven ones, with some focusing on personal struggles and others on larger conflicts.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a blend of animation, adventure, romance, war, and fantasy.  The settings range from ancient Polynesia to modern-day Manhattan, showcasing diversity in time and place. However, the character archetypes are somewhat conventional.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a more eclectic mix, including stand-up comedy, animation, documentaries, action, crime, and post-apocalyptic fiction.  The diversity is notable, but the overall quality and coherence might be questioned.
response.list_D_description: List D features animation, comedy, fantasy, adventure, and action.  The plots are generally light-hearted, with a focus on whimsical adventures and fantastical elements. The diversity is moderate, leaning towards family-friendly themes.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases psychological thriller, superhero, heist, adventure, dystopian fiction, animation, drama, action, and coming-of-age stories. The range of genres and themes is quite broad, demonstrating good diversity.
response.list_F_description: List F includes superhero, science fiction, crime, animation, science fiction, action, drama, and adventure. The list has a good balance of genres, but some plots share similarities in terms of character archetypes or themes.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists exhibit varying degrees of diversity in terms of genre, setting, and themes. Some lists, like C and E, stand out for their eclectic mix of movies, while others, like D, show a more focused selection. Overall, there's a reasonable amount of diversity across the entire batch, although the depth of exploration within each genre varies.

PLOT: Two astronauts work together to survive after an accident leaves them stranded in space.

PLOT: The victims of an encephalitis epidemic many years ago have been catatonic ever since, but now a new drug offers the prospect of reviving them.

PLOT: Harry, Ron, and Hermione search for Voldemort's remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.

PLOT: The toys are mistakenly delivered to a day-care center instead of the attic right before Andy leaves for college, and it's up to Woody to convince the other toys that they weren't abandoned and to return home.

PLOT: A transport ship crashes and leaves its crew stranded on a desert planet inhabited by bloodthirsty creatures that come out during an eclipse.

PLOT: King Leonidas of Sparta and a force of 300 men fight the Persians at Thermopylae in 480 B.C.

PLOT: A young police officer must prevent a bomb exploding aboard a city bus by keeping its speed above 50 mph.

PLOT: A reluctant Hobbit, Bilbo Baggins, sets out to the Lonely Mountain with a spirited group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home, and the gold within it from the dragon Smaug.

PLOT: A paraplegic Marine dispatched to the moon Pandora on a unique mission becomes torn between following his orders and protecting the world he feels is his home.


List D:
PLOT: When Woody is stolen by a toy collector, Buzz and his friends set out on a rescue mission to save Woody before he becomes a museum toy property with his roundup gang Jessie, Prospector, and Bullseye.

PLOT: An ancient prophecy seems to be coming true when a mysterious presence begins stalking the corridors of a school of magic and leaving its victims paralyzed.

PLOT: In a twisted social experiment, eighty Americans are locked in their high-rise corporate office in Bogotá, Colombia, and ordered by an unknown voice coming from the company's intercom system to participate in a deadly game of kill or be killed.

PLOT: Young lovers, and soon to wed, Hero and Claudio conspire to get verbal sparring partners and confirmed singles, Benedick and Beatrice, to wed as well.

PLOT: With their warning about Lord Voldemort's return scoffed at, Harry and Dumbledore are targeted by the Wizard authorities as an authoritarian bureaucrat slowly seizes power at Hogwarts.

PLOT: Four teenage boys enter a pact to lose their virginity by prom night.

PLOT: A hapless young Viking who aspires to hunt dragons becomes the unlikely friend of a young dragon himself, and learns there may be more to the creatures than he assumed.

PLOT: Jeff "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire of the same name, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.

PLOT: After a stint in a mental institution, former teacher Pat Solitano moves back in with his parents and tries to reconcile with his ex-wife. Things get more challenging when Pat meets Tiffany, a mysterious girl with problems of her own.

PLOT: The spirits of a deceased couple are harassed by an unbearable family that has moved into their home, and hire a malicious spirit to drive them out.


List E:
PLOT: A man with short-term memory loss attempts to track down his wife's murderer.

PLOT: During the 1980s, a failed stand-up comedian is driven insane and turns to a life of crime and chaos in Gotham City while becoming an infamous psychopathic crime figure.

PLOT: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.

PLOT: In 1988, young sisters Katie and Kristi befriend an invisible entity called Toby, who resides in their home.

PLOT: Two strangers awaken in a room with no recollection of how they got there, and soon discover they're pawns in a deadly game perpetrated by a notorious serial killer.

PLOT: Hoping to walk away with a massive fortune, a trio of thieves break into the house of a blind man who isn't as helpless as he seems.

PLOT: While trying to lead a quiet suburban life, a family of undercover superheroes are forced into action to save the world.

PLOT: Living a life marked by violence, neo-Nazi Derek finally goes to prison after killing two black youths. Upon his release, Derek vows to change; he hopes to prevent his brother, Danny, who idolizes Derek, from following in his footsteps.

PLOT: David Attenborough returns to the world's oceans in this sequel to the acclaimed documentary filming rare and unusual creatures of the deep, as well as documenting the problems our oceans face.

PLOT: After the death of one of his friends, a writer recounts a childhood journey with his friends to find the body of a missing boy.


List F:
PLOT: A group of scientists have developed the Resonator, a machine which allows whoever is within range to see beyond normal perceptible reality. But when the experiment succeeds, they are immediately attacked by terrible life forms.

PLOT: A young African-American visits his White girlfriend's parents for the weekend, where his simmering uneasiness about their reception of him eventually reaches a boiling point.

PLOT: The Avengers and their allies must be willing to sacrifice all in an attempt to defeat the powerful Thanos before his blitz of devastation and ruin puts an end to the universe.

PLOT: A series of events tests the beliefs of a small isolated countryside village.

PLOT: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.

PLOT: Two siblings become increasingly frightened by their grandparents' disturbing behavior while visiting them on vacation.

PLOT: A young woman is followed by an unknown supernatural force after a sexual encounter.

PLOT: In a near future, a lonely writer develops an unlikely relationship with an operating system designed to meet his every need.

PLOT: A smart but sensible new graduate lands a job as an assistant to Miranda Priestly, the demanding editor-in-chief of a high fashion magazine.

PLOT: Frankie, an ill-tempered old coach, reluctantly agrees to train aspiring boxer Maggie. Impressed with her determination and talent, he helps her become the best and the two soon form a close bond.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, covering genres like fantasy, sci-fi, action, animation, and crime.  There's a mix of fantastical elements and grounded reality, with some plots focusing on character development and others on high-stakes action.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a blend of thriller, sci-fi, drama, and war genres.  The plots explore diverse themes such as crime, artificial intelligence, and social issues, but the overall tone leans towards darker and more intense narratives.
response.list_C_description: List C is heavily weighted towards fantasy and adventure, particularly within the Harry Potter universe. While it includes some sci-fi and action elements, the lack of diversity in themes and genres is noticeable.
response.list_D_description: List D presents a more eclectic mix, including comedy, fantasy, thriller, romance, and drama. The plots range from absurd humor to serious explorations of mental health and social issues, creating a more varied collection.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a mix of thriller, crime, horror, and documentary styles. The plots explore diverse themes such as memory loss, mental illness, and the dark side of human nature, with a touch of supernatural elements.
response.list_F_description: List F offers a blend of sci-fi, drama, action, and comedy. The plots explore themes of relationships, family dynamics, and supernatural encounters, with a mix of serious and lighthearted tones.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists exhibit varying degrees of diversity. Some lists, like A and D, show a good spread of genres and themes, while others, like C, are more focused.  Overall, there's a representation of various genres including fantasy, sci-fi, action, thriller, drama, comedy, horror, and animation, but the thematic depth and originality vary across the lists.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: Jim explores multiple aspects of life including religion, marriage and his own sanity.

PLOT: Harry, Ron, and Hermione search for Voldemort's remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.

PLOT: A soldier fighting aliens gets to relive the same day over and over again, the day restarting every time he dies.

PLOT: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, two monsters realize things may not be what they think.

PLOT: A wisecracking mercenary gets experimented on and becomes immortal yet hideously scarred, and sets out to track down the man who ruined his looks.

PLOT: A linguist works with the military to communicate with alien lifeforms after twelve mysterious spacecraft appear around the world.

PLOT: Blacksmith Will Turner teams up with eccentric pirate "Captain" Jack Sparrow to save his love, the governor's daughter, from Jack's former pirate allies, who are now undead.

PLOT: A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a highly advanced humanoid A.I.

PLOT: After young Riley is uprooted from her Midwest life and moved to San Francisco, her emotions - Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust, and Sadness - conflict on how best to navigate a new city, house, and school.

PLOT: Barely 21 yet, Frank is a skilled forger who has passed as a doctor, lawyer and pilot. FBI agent Carl becomes obsessed with tracking down the con man, who only revels in the pursuit.


List B:
PLOT: As Harry Potter begins his sixth year at Hogwarts, he discovers an old book marked as "the property of the Half-Blood Prince" and begins to learn more about Lord Voldemort's dark past.

PLOT: A documentary of the Bill Clinton 1992 presidential campaign and the organization who ran it.

PLOT: In a city of anthropomorphic animals, a rookie bunny cop and a cynical con artist fox must work together to uncover a conspiracy.

PLOT: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.

PLOT: Harry Potter, Ron and Hermione return to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for their third year of study, where they delve into the mystery surrounding an escaped prisoner who poses a dangerous threat to the young wizard.

PLOT: During World War II, the English mathematical genius Alan Turing tries to crack the German Enigma code with help from fellow mathematicians while attempting to come to terms with his troubled private life.

PLOT: With his wife's disappearance having become the focus of an intense media circus, a man sees the spotlight turned on him when it's suspected that he may not be innocent.

PLOT: A special bond develops between plus-sized inflatable robot Baymax and prodigy Hiro Hamada, who together team up with a group of friends to form a band of high-tech heroes.

PLOT: An insurance salesman discovers his whole life is actually a reality TV show.

PLOT: A rat who can cook makes an unusual alliance with a young kitchen worker at a famous Paris restaurant.


List C:
PLOT: Continuing the story of Aurora Greenway in her latter years. After the death of her daughter, Aurora struggled to keep her family together, but has one grandson in jail, a rebellious granddaughter, and another grandson living just above the poverty line.—R. John Berggren <jberg@nina.pagesz.net>

PLOT: Sam Witwicky leaves the Autobots behind for a normal life. But when his mind is filled with cryptic symbols, the Decepticons target him and he is dragged back into the Transformers' war.

PLOT: Back when sex was safe, pleasure was a business and business was booming, an idealistic porn producer aspires to elevate his craft to an art when he discovers a hot young talent.

PLOT: A comedy set in a world where no one has ever lied, until a writer seizes the opportunity for personal gain.

PLOT: In an old school Las Vegas casino, its top gambling jinx breaks his curse when he falls in love, much to his boss' consternation.

PLOT: Five friends go for a break at a remote cabin, where they get more than they bargained for, discovering the truth behind the cabin in the woods.

PLOT: A retired spy is called back into action, and to bond with her new step-children, she invites them along for the adventure to stop the evil Timekeeper from taking over the world.

PLOT: In a desperate attempt to prove his innocence, a skilled police negotiator accused of corruption and murder takes hostages in a government office to gain the time he needs to find the truth.

PLOT: The Mystery Inc. gang must save Coolsville from an attack of their past monsters brought to life by an evil masked figure trying to take down the gang.

PLOT: Revolves around Frank, an American tourist visiting Italy to mend a broken heart. Elise is an extraordinary woman who deliberately crosses his path.


List D:
PLOT: When a hotelier attempts to fill the chronic vacancies at his castle by launching an advertising campaign that falsely portrays the property as haunted, two actual ghosts show up and end up falling for two guests.

PLOT: Harry Potter finds himself competing in a hazardous tournament between rival schools of magic, but he is distracted by recurring nightmares.

PLOT: An ancient prophecy seems to be coming true when a mysterious presence begins stalking the corridors of a school of magic and leaving its victims paralyzed.

PLOT: Teddy Daniels and Chuck Aule, two US marshals, are sent to an asylum on a remote island in order to investigate the disappearance of a patient, where Teddy uncovers a shocking truth about the place.

PLOT: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a woman rebels against a tyrannical ruler in search for her homeland with the aid of a group of female prisoners, a psychotic worshiper and a drifter named Max.

PLOT: A young African-American visits his White girlfriend's parents for the weekend, where his simmering uneasiness about their reception of him eventually reaches a boiling point.

PLOT: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.

PLOT: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the shocking truth--the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence.

PLOT: With their warning about Lord Voldemort's return scoffed at, Harry and Dumbledore are targeted by the Wizard authorities as an authoritarian bureaucrat slowly seizes power at Hogwarts.

PLOT: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.


List E:
PLOT: The autobiographical story of Howard Stern, the radio rebel who is now also a TV personality, an author and a movie star.

PLOT: It's time for change in America--but not without a few parting words from former President George W Bush. Here's your chance to discover the man behind the myth as HBO presents Will Ferrell in a performance of his heralded one-man Broadway show.—Anonymous

PLOT: A marksman living in exile is coaxed back into action after hearing of a plot to kill the President. After being-double crossed for the attempt and on the run, he sets out for the real killer and the truth.

PLOT: Mia Thermopolis has just found out that she is the heir apparent to the throne of Genovia. With her friends Lilly and Michael Moscovitz in tow, she tries to navigate through the rest of her sixteenth year.

PLOT: In this never-before-seen Director's Cut, the doors of the world's imagination are thrown wide open and the boys of South Park are transported to a magical realm in their greatest odyssey ever.

PLOT: A high-profile terrorism case unexpectedly binds together two ex-lovers on the defense team - testing the limits of their loyalties and placing their lives in jeopardy.

PLOT: Documentary that looks at the concept of the corporation throughout recent history up to its present-day dominance.

PLOT: John and Max resolve to save their beloved bait shop from turning into an Italian restaurant, just as its new female owner catches Max's attention.

PLOT: Literature professor and gambler Jim Bennett's debt causes him to borrow money from his mother and a loan shark. Further complicating his situation, is his relationship with one of his students. Will Bennett risk his life for a second chance?

PLOT: Shakespeare's famous play is updated to the hip modern suburb of Verona still retaining its original dialogue.


List F:
PLOT: In the late 1980s, a low level gangster named Jackie DiNorscio defends himself in court in what became the longest criminal trial in American judicial history.

PLOT: The patriarch of a wealthy and powerful family suddenly passes away, leaving his daughter with a shocking secret inheritance that threatens to unravel and destroy the family.

PLOT: The story of controversial pornography publisher Larry Flynt, and how he became a defender of free speech.

PLOT: While seeking answers to the death of the twin brother he never knew he had, a French cop and his sibling's fiancee find themselves pursued by corrupt FBI agents and the Russian mafia.

PLOT: When the unburied dead return to life and seek human victims, seven refugees shelter in a house in the Pennsylvanian countryside.

PLOT: A traveling mariachi is mistaken for a murderous criminal and must hide from a gang bent on killing him.

PLOT: Two sisters find their already strained relationship challenged as a mysterious new planet threatens to collide with Earth.

PLOT: Having thought that monogamy was never possible, a commitment-phobic career woman may have to face her fears when she meets a good guy.

PLOT: An elderly Charlie Chaplin discusses his autobiography with his editor, recounting his amazing journey from his poverty-stricken childhood to world-wide success after the ingenious invention of the Little Tramp.

PLOT: In a hotel room in Paris, a doctor comes out of the shower and finds that his wife has disappeared. He soon finds himself caught up in a world of intrigue, espionage, gangsters, drugs and murder.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes, including fantasy, science fiction, action, comedy, drama, and thriller.  There's a focus on character-driven narratives with diverse settings and conflicts.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a mix of genres, from fantasy and crime to animation and documentary.  The themes are varied, touching upon political campaigns, conspiracies, and personal struggles. The inclusion of a documentary adds a unique element.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a blend of genres, including drama, science fiction, comedy, horror, and action. The themes explore family relationships, war, the entertainment industry, and the supernatural. The diversity is moderate, with some genres being more prominent than others.
response.list_D_description: List D showcases a mix of genres, including fantasy, thriller, drama, and science fiction. The themes explore magic, mental health, dystopia, and racial relations. The diversity is good, with a balance between fantastical and realistic narratives.
response.list_E_description: List E includes biographical, comedy, action, fantasy, and documentary genres.  The themes range from personal stories to political commentary and social issues. The inclusion of documentaries and biographical films adds to the diversity.
response.list_F_description: List F displays a variety of genres, including crime, drama, thriller, horror, and comedy. The themes explore crime, family secrets, free speech, and supernatural events. The diversity is moderate, with a good representation of different genres.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a considerable variety of genres and themes represented, including fantasy, science fiction, action, comedy, drama, thriller, horror, documentaries, biographical films, and crime.  While some lists lean more heavily towards specific genres, the overall collection demonstrates a good level of diversity in storytelling.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: A prince of the mythical world starts a rebellion against humanity in order to rule the Earth. Hellboy and his team must fight to stop him from locating the all-powerful Golden Army.

PLOT: A young man, falsely imprisoned by his jealous "friend", escapes and uses a hidden treasure to exact his revenge.

PLOT: In a dystopian future, Joseph Dredd, the most famous Judge (a police officer with instant field judiciary powers), is convicted for a crime he did not commit and must face his murderous counterpart.

PLOT: The true story of a newly appointed African-American coach and his high school team on their first season as a racially integrated unit.

PLOT: A mild-mannered man becomes a local hero through an act of violence, which sets off repercussions that will shake his family to its very core.

PLOT: Picking up directly from the previous movie, vampire warrior Selene and the half werewolf Michael hunt for clues to reveal the history of their races and the war between them.

PLOT: Inspired by real events and people, 21 is about six MIT students who become trained to be experts in card counting in Black Jack and subsequently took Vegas casinos for millions in winnings.

PLOT: An insurance agent is sent by her employer to track down and help capture an art thief.

PLOT: A nurse, a policeman, a young married couple, a salesman and other survivors of a worldwide plague that is producing aggressive, flesh-eating zombies, take refuge in a mega Midwestern shopping mall.

PLOT: A man who believes he has put his mysterious past behind him cannot stand idly by when he meets a young girl under the control of ultra-violent Russian gangsters.


List B:
PLOT: A boy stands on a station platform as a train is about to leave. Should he go with his mother or stay with his father? Infinite possibilities arise from this decision. As long as he doesn't choose, anything is possible.

PLOT: An aspiring supervillain must balance his career and his pursuit of a beautiful do-gooder.

PLOT: When one of their own is kidnapped by an angry gangster, the Wolf Pack must track down Mr. Chow, who has escaped from prison and is on the run.

PLOT: In the summer of 1989, a group of bullied kids band together to destroy a shape-shifting monster, which disguises itself as a clown and preys on the children of Derry, their small Maine town.

PLOT: A cover-up spanning four U.S. Presidents pushes the country's first female newspaper publisher and her editor to join an unprecedented battle between press and government.

PLOT: A man shuffles through a dream meeting various people and discussing the meanings and purposes of the universe.

List E:
