response.list_E_description: List E includes sci-fi, thriller, crime, action, and drama, with a focus on suspenseful narratives and morally ambiguous characters. The settings and themes are diverse, but the overall tone is darker and more intense than some other lists.
response.list_F_description: List F presents a mix of fantasy, crime, drama, and sci-fi, with a focus on unique characters and intriguing plots. The settings and themes are varied, offering a good balance of genres and tones.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists demonstrate varying degrees of diversity in genre, setting, and theme. Some lists, like List D, show a wider range of genres and tones, while others, like List A, are more focused on specific genres, such as fantasy. Overall, there's a good representation of different storytelling styles, but the level of diversity varies across the lists.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: While Frodo and Sam edge closer to Mordor with the help of the shifty Gollum, the divided fellowship makes a stand against Sauron's new ally, Saruman, and his hordes of Isengard.

PLOT: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the shocking truth--the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence.

PLOT: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soap maker form an underground fight club that evolves into much more.

PLOT: After witnessing his parents' death, Bruce learns the art of fighting to confront injustice. When he returns to Gotham as Batman, he must stop a secret society that intends to destroy the city.

PLOT: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

PLOT: After awakening from a four-year coma, a former assassin wreaks vengeance on the team of assassins who betrayed her.

PLOT: In the distant future, a small waste-collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.

PLOT: A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.

PLOT: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.

PLOT: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.


List B:
PLOT: The Bride continues her quest of vengeance against her former boss and lover Bill, the reclusive bouncer Budd, and the treacherous, one-eyed Elle.

PLOT: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

PLOT: Over the course of several years, two convicts form a friendship, seeking consolation and, eventually, redemption through basic compassion.

PLOT: The brash James T. Kirk tries to live up to his father's legacy with Mr. Spock keeping him in check as a vengeful Romulan from the future creates black holes to destroy the Federation one planet at a time.

PLOT: In the 1960s, superpowered humans Charles Xavier and Erik Lensherr work together to find others like them, but Erik's vengeful pursuit of an ambitious mutant who ruined his life causes a schism to divide them.

PLOT: After his son is captured in the Great Barrier Reef and taken to Sydney, a timid clownfish sets out on a journey to bring him home.

PLOT: As Harry Potter begins his sixth year at Hogwarts, he discovers an old book marked as "the property of the Half-Blood Prince" and begins to learn more about Lord Voldemort's dark past.

PLOT: Harry, Ron, and Hermione search for Voldemort's remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.

PLOT: Blacksmith Will Turner teams up with eccentric pirate "Captain" Jack Sparrow to save his love, the governor's daughter, from Jack's former pirate allies, who are now undead.

PLOT: Harry Potter finds himself competing in a hazardous tournament between rival schools of magic, but he is distracted by recurring nightmares.


List C:
PLOT: In feudal Korea, the evil King becomes aware that there is a peasant rebellion being planned in the country. He steals all the iron farming tools and cooking pots from the people so that he may make weapons to fend off the peasant army. After he returns the property to the people, an old blacksmith is imprisoned and starved to death. His last creation is a tiny figurine of a monster- Pulgasari, a Godzilla-like creature that eats iron. The blood of his daughter brings the creature to life, and fights with the poor, starving peasants to overthrow the corrupt monarchy.—Anonymous

PLOT: A horror comedy with fake news and commercials section, that was filmed on old video cameras to make it look like a real VHS recording of a commercial television station's Halloween special from 1987.

PLOT: Set in the small-town of Bareilly, Bitti is a free-spirited young girl who lives life on her own terms and refuses to be pressured into getting married. Her life takes a shift when she meets Chirag Dubey and Pritam Vidrohi.

PLOT: Pastor Park works to expose suspicious religious groups. He's hired to look into the cult group Deer Mount. Meanwhile, Police Captain Hwang investigates a murder case and the main suspect is a member of the Deer Mount cult.

PLOT: Based on a comic book series. A woman burned at the stake in 15th century Sweden actually is Satan (Lucifer)'s daughter - and plots revenge against him.

PLOT: 1st Mars mission crash lands, kills the captain and 5 survive. Help from Earth will take 2+ years. Food and electricity (recycling oxygen and water) shortage means only 2 can survive. The other 3 leave and have their last hours recorded.

PLOT: A fictional documentary about the creation of the worlds first time machine, the men who created it, and the unintended ramifications it has on world events.

PLOT: Henry II picks up where the original (Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer) left off. Henry (Neil Giuntoli) takes a thankless job at a port-o-john company where he meets husband and wife, Kai (Ken Komenich) and Cricket (Kate Walsh). They take pity on the homeless drifter and offer him a room in the home they share with their emotionally fragile teenage niece, Louisa (Carri Levinson). Henry learns that Kai has a side job as an arsonist-for-hire, setting up phony insurance scams to make money for their boss, Rooter (Daniel Allar). He agrees to join Kai and on one of their first outings, they discover two squatters in a building that's been marked for fire. It is then that Henry introduces Kai to his life's work... and the murders begin. Kai has never killed before, but he turns into a willing accomplice. Initially, the two men work well together. But as the killing sprees increase in their depravity, it's more than Kai can handle. He wants out, but he's in too deep.—Anonymous

PLOT: Fresh from hosting the Royal Variety Performance and starring in Bad Education and A League Of Their Own, this is your chance to catch Jack at his dynamic best.

PLOT: An inspirational tale about the relationship between two Sioux brothers living on the Pine Ridge reservation.


List D:
PLOT: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.

PLOT: The history of the United States from the 1950s to the '70s unfolds from the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75, who yearns to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart.

PLOT: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, two monsters realize things may not be what they think.

PLOT: A sexually frustrated suburban father has a mid-life crisis after becoming infatuated with his daughter's best friend.

PLOT: Teddy Daniels and Chuck Aule, two US marshals, are sent to an asylum on a remote island in order to investigate the disappearance of a patient, where Teddy uncovers a shocking truth about the place.

PLOT: A wisecracking mercenary gets experimented on and becomes immortal yet hideously scarred, and sets out to track down the man who ruined his looks.

PLOT: A cowboy doll is profoundly threatened and jealous when a new spaceman action figure supplants him as top toy in a boy's bedroom.

PLOT: After young Riley is uprooted from her Midwest life and moved to San Francisco, her emotions - Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust, and Sadness - conflict on how best to navigate a new city, house, and school.

PLOT: With the help of a German bounty-hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal plantation owner in Mississippi.

PLOT: In a future British dystopian society, a shadowy freedom fighter, known only by the alias of "V", plots to overthrow the tyrannical government - with the help of a young woman.


List E:
PLOT: In a future where mutants are nearly extinct, an elderly and weary Logan leads a quiet life. But when Laura, a mutant child pursued by scientists, comes to him for help, he must get her to safety.

PLOT: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.

PLOT: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

PLOT: A group of intergalactic criminals must pull together to stop a fanatical warrior with plans to purge the universe.

PLOT: A family determined to get their young daughter into the finals of a beauty pageant take a cross-country trip in their VW bus.

PLOT: Faced with an unplanned pregnancy, an offbeat young woman makes a selfless decision regarding the unborn child.

PLOT: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

PLOT: A bedridden boy's grandfather reads him the story of a farmboy-turned-pirate who encounters numerous obstacles, enemies and allies in his quest to be reunited with his true love.

PLOT: When Earth becomes uninhabitable in the future, a farmer and ex-NASA pilot, Joseph Cooper, is tasked to pilot a spacecraft, along with a team of researchers, to find a new planet for humans.

PLOT: A rat who can cook makes an unusual alliance with a young kitchen worker at a famous Paris restaurant.


List F:
PLOT: A mother personally challenges the local authorities to solve her daughter's murder when they fail to catch the culprit.

PLOT: Quentin Tarantino and Robert Rodriguez's homage to exploitation double features in the '60s and '70s with two back-to-back cult films that include previews of coming attractions between them.

PLOT: Thomas is deposited in a community of boys after his memory is erased, soon learning they're all trapped in a maze that will require him to join forces with fellow "runners" for a shot at escape.

PLOT: A middle-aged husband's life changes dramatically when his wife asks him for a divorce. He seeks to rediscover his manhood with the help of a newfound friend, Jacob, learning to pick up girls at bars.

PLOT: A dark force threatens Alpha, a vast metropolis and home to species from a thousand planets. Special operatives Valerian and Laureline must race to identify the marauding menace and safeguard not just Alpha, but the future of the universe.

PLOT: After being kidnapped and imprisoned for fifteen years, Oh Dae-Su is released, only to find that he must find his captor in five days.

PLOT: Jim and his friends are now in college, and they decide to meet up at the beach house for some fun.

PLOT: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father, the ambitious celestial being Ego.

PLOT: A desk-bound CIA analyst volunteers to go undercover to infiltrate the world of a deadly arms dealer and prevent diabolical global disaster.

PLOT: A prequel centered on the origins of the centuries-old feud between the race of aristocratic vampires and their former slaves, the Lycans.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a diverse range of genres and themes, including fantasy, science fiction, action, superhero, animation, and thriller.  There's a mix of epic adventures and more intimate character studies.
response.list_B_description: List B is predominantly focused on action and adventure, with a strong emphasis on fantasy and superhero narratives.  While there's some variety in subgenres, the overall tone and themes are quite consistent.
response.list_C_description: List C offers a highly eclectic mix, ranging from historical drama and monster movies to horror comedies, documentaries, and inspirational stories. The diversity in tone and style is striking.
response.list_D_description: List D presents a blend of science fiction, thriller, drama, and dark comedy.  The settings and themes vary, but there's a noticeable lean towards psychological and suspenseful narratives.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a mix of genres, including superhero, biographical drama, war, science fiction, comedy, and romance. The time periods and settings are diverse, offering a broader range than some other lists.
response.list_F_description: List F contains a variety of genres, including thriller, action, science fiction, and drama.  There's a mix of high-concept narratives and more grounded character studies, but the overall tone tends towards the darker side.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists exhibit varying degrees of diversity. Lists A and C stand out for their broad range of genres and themes, while lists B and F show more thematic consistency. Lists D and E fall somewhere in between, offering a good mix but with some noticeable stylistic similarities within their selections.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a diverse range of genres and themes, including fantasy, action, thriller, drama, and even a touch of dark comedy (Fight Club).  There's a mix of superhero narratives (Batman, X-Men), intense action (Oldboy, Kill Bill), and epic fantasy (Harry Potter, Lord of the Rings). The inclusion of a Tarantino/Rodriguez double feature adds an element of meta-cinema, further enhancing the diversity.
response.list_B_description: List B leans heavily towards action and adventure, particularly within the fantasy and superhero genres.  While there's some variety in tone (e.g., the dark humor of Watchmen contrasts with the swashbuckling adventure of Pirates of the Caribbean), the overall thematic consistency limits the diversity score.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a more balanced mix than List B, encompassing genres like crime, sci-fi, animation, and drama.  The inclusion of films with varying tones and settings (a prison drama, a zombie apocalypse, a futuristic robot story) contributes to a higher diversity score compared to List B.
response.list_D_description: List D offers a blend of genres, including animation (Up), crime (Goodfellas), dystopian sci-fi (Mad Max, Logan), and historical dramas (Forrest Gump, Inglourious Basterds). The inclusion of diverse settings and time periods adds to the list's diversity.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a mix of genres, including action, sci-fi, drama, and thriller.  The inclusion of films set in different time periods and locations (a historical drama set in Mississippi, a futuristic dystopia, a contemporary thriller) contributes to the list's diversity. However, the focus on action-oriented plots somewhat limits the overall diversity.
response.list_F_description: List F is dominated by superhero and action-adventure films, with a few exceptions (Ratatouille, The Wolf of Wall Street). While there's some variety in tone and setting, the thematic consistency limits the diversity score. The inclusion of a few non-action films helps to slightly improve the diversity score.
response.diversity_summarization: Lists A and C demonstrate the highest levels of diversity, encompassing a wide range of genres, tones, and settings. Lists B and F show less diversity, primarily focusing on action and adventure films. Lists D and E fall somewhere in between, offering a decent mix of genres but with some thematic consistency.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: A New York City police officer tries to save his estranged wife and several others taken hostage by terrorists during a Christmas party at the Nakatomi Plaza in Los Angeles.

PLOT: Jack Hall, paleoclimatologist, must make a daring trek from Washington, D.C. to New York City to reach his son, trapped in the cross-hairs of a sudden international storm which plunges the planet into a new Ice Age.

PLOT: After narrowly escaping a bizarre accident, a troubled teenager is plagued by visions of a man in a large rabbit suit who manipulates him to commit a series of crimes.

PLOT: An ancient struggle between two Cybertronian races, the heroic Autobots and the evil Decepticons, comes to Earth, with a clue to the ultimate power held by a teenager.

PLOT: Tells the story of Benjamin Button, a man who starts aging backwards with consequences.

PLOT: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mafia, covering his relationship with his wife Karen and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito.

PLOT: A man learns something extraordinary about himself after a devastating accident.

PLOT: Kazakh TV talking head Borat is dispatched to the United States to report on the greatest country in the world. With a documentary crew in tow, Borat becomes more interested in locating and marrying Pamela Anderson.

PLOT: An alien invasion threatens the future of humanity. The catastrophic nightmare is depicted through the eyes of one American family fighting for survival.


List B:
PLOT: Bridget Jones is determined to improve herself while she looks for love in a year in which she keeps a personal diary.

PLOT: World War II American Army Medic Desmond T. Doss, serving during the Battle of Okinawa, refuses to kill people and becomes the first man in American history to receive the Medal of Honor without firing a shot.

PLOT: Affable hillbillies Tucker and Dale are on vacation at their dilapidated mountain cabin when they are mistaken for murderers by a group of preppy college students.

PLOT: A Manhattan doctor embarks on a bizarre, night-long odyssey after his wife's admission of unfulfilled longing.

PLOT: In a world divided by factions based on virtues, Tris learns she's Divergent and won't fit in. When she discovers a plot to destroy Divergents, Tris and the mysterious Four must find out what makes Divergents dangerous before it's too late.

PLOT: Two teenagers share a profound, magical connection upon discovering they are swapping bodies. Things manage to become even more complicated when the boy and girl decide to meet in person.

PLOT: When a man inadvertently makes Santa fall off his roof on Christmas Eve, he finds himself magically recruited to take his place.

PLOT: A man with a fateful secret embarks on an extraordinary journey of redemption by forever changing the lives of seven strangers.

PLOT: With a plan to exact revenge on a mythical shark that killed his partner, Oceanographer Steve Zissou (Bill Murray) rallies a crew that includes his estranged wife, a journalist, and a man who may or may not be his son.

PLOT: Continuing his "legendary adventures of awesomeness", Po must face two hugely epic, but different threats: one supernatural and the other a little closer to home.

PLOT: After a car wreck on the winding Mulholland Drive renders a woman amnesiac, she and a perky Hollywood-hopeful search for clues and answers across Los Angeles in a twisting venture beyond dreams and reality.

PLOT: After finding love, Bridget Jones questions if she really has everything she'd ever dreamed of having.

PLOT: A family struggles for survival in a world where most humans have been killed by blind but noise-sensitive creatures. They are forced to communicate in sign language to keep the creatures at bay.

PLOT: A prequel centered on the origins of the centuries-old feud between the race of aristocratic vampires and their former slaves, the Lycans.

PLOT: The story of a team of female African-American mathematicians who served a vital role in NASA during the early years of the U.S. space program.

PLOT: The youngest son of an alcoholic former boxer returns home, where he's trained by his father for competition in a mixed martial arts tournament - a path that puts the fighter on a collision course with his estranged, older brother.

PLOT: A man raised by gorillas must decide where he really belongs when he discovers he is a human.

PLOT: After a sudden attack on MI5, Johnny English, Britain's most confident, yet unintelligent spy, becomes Britain's only spy.

PLOT: In a city of humanoid animals, a hustling theater impresario's attempt to save his theater with a singing competition becomes grander than he anticipates even as its finalists find that their lives will never be the same.


List F:
PLOT: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Commonwealth and Empire, and France are surrounded by the German Army and evacuated during a fierce battle in World War II.

PLOT: An alien on the run from his own people makes friends with a girl. He tries to help her on her quest, but can be an interference.

PLOT: The discovery of a severed human ear found in a field leads a young man on an investigation related to a beautiful, mysterious nightclub singer and a group of psychopathic criminals who have kidnapped her child.

PLOT: Two terminally ill patients escape from a hospital, steal a car and rush towards the sea.

PLOT: Robbie, a singer, and Julia, a waitress, are both engaged, but to the wrong people. Fortune intervenes to help them discover each other.

PLOT: The Incredibles family takes on a new mission which involves a change in family roles: Bob Parr (Mr. Incredible) must manage the house while his wife Helen (Elastigirl) goes out to save the world.

PLOT: A molecular biologist and his laboratory partner uncover evidence that may fundamentally change society as we know it.

PLOT: Desperate to pay the bills and come through for their loved ones, three lifelong pals risk it all by embarking on a daring bid to knock off the very bank that absconded with their money.

PLOT: In 1980s Italy, romance blossoms between a seventeen-year-old student and the older man hired as his father's research assistant.

PLOT: A scientist makes a last stand on Earth with the help of a ragtag team of soldiers against an invasion of alien phantoms.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes, including action (Die Hard, The Day After Tomorrow), psychological thriller (Donnie Darko), animation (Toy Story), science fiction (Transformers), drama (The Curious Case of Benjamin Button, Goodfellas), and comedy (Borat).  There's a mix of settings and tones, resulting in moderate diversity.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a blend of romantic comedy (Bridget Jones's Diary), war drama (Hacksaw Ridge), dark comedy (Tucker and Dale vs Evil), surreal drama (Midnight in Paris), dystopian fiction (Divergent), fantasy (Freaky Friday), Christmas-themed fantasy (The Christmas Chronicles), drama (Seven Pounds), adventure (The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou), and animation (Kung Fu Panda 2). This list demonstrates good genre variety.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a mix of thriller (The Killing of a Sacred Deer), science fiction (The Maze Runner), romantic comedy (Love, Actually), horror-comedy (Hotel Transylvania), drama (The Social Network), action (The Tourist), romance (A Star is Born), thriller (The Invitation), action (Kingsman: The Secret Service), and musical (The Hunchback of Notre Dame). The diversity is moderate, with a good representation of different genres.
response.list_D_description: List A showcases a variety of genres including teen comedy (Clueless), action-adventure (Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales), anthology (The Ballad of Buster Scruggs), animation (Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation), science fiction (Gattaca), action (Taken 3), adventure (Hunt for the Wilderpeople), romantic comedy (The Holiday), biographical drama (I, Tonya), and science fiction (Alita: Battle Angel). The list displays a decent level of diversity.
response.list_E_description: List E includes heist (Now You See Me 2), neo-noir (Mulholland Drive), romantic comedy (Bridget Jones's Baby), science fiction (A Quiet Place), fantasy (Underworld: Rise of the Lycans), biographical drama (Hidden Figures), sports drama (Warrior), adventure (Tarzan), action comedy (Johnny English Reborn), and musical (Sing). The list shows a good balance of genres and themes.
response.list_F_description: List F contains war (Dunkirk), science fiction (Earth to Echo), neo-noir (Wild at Heart), drama (The Farewell), romantic comedy (Music and Lyrics), superhero (Incredibles 2), science fiction (Annihilation), crime (The Bank Job), romance (Call Me By Your Name), and science fiction (Spectral). This list has a good variety of genres, though some overlap in themes exists.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a considerable variety of genres represented, including action, adventure, comedy, drama, romance, science fiction, fantasy, horror, thriller, animation, and biographical films.  While some genres appear more frequently than others, the overall representation is quite diverse.  The lists also showcase a range of tones, from lighthearted comedies to intense thrillers and thought-provoking dramas.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: Transforming familiar objects into fresh guacamole.

PLOT: When a band of brutal gangsters led by a crooked property developer make a play to take over a local school, Master Ip is forced to take a stand.

PLOT: When a cosmic event turns Emma's dog and cat into two perfect guys, Emma reconsiders her outlook on dating, hilariously works out her trust issues, and ultimately learns to love herself.

PLOT: The colonel's wife's tin pints need to be cleaned up, and Sergeant First Class Körmy tasks two privates to do so.

PLOT: Get ready for the bricks to fly when Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman and the rest of the Justice League face off against the world's greatest super villains!

PLOT: A father and son help each other through growing up, romance, tragedy, and adventure.

PLOT: After twenty years in prison, Foley is finished with the grifter's life. When he meets an elusive young woman named Iris, the possibility of a new start looks real. But his past is proving to be a stubborn companion.

PLOT: Jerranium 90, a "little rock" that made all the papers, is buried deep within the Amazon. And everybody wants it, including crooked importer Handscomb Draile, slimy Gondreau Slykes, cheap crook Carl Traeger and evil scientist Dr. Ellamy Royne.—Anonymous

PLOT: When Osho, the world's most controversial guru, builds an Utopian city deep in the Oregon country, conflict with the locals escalates into a national scandal.

PLOT: Alone and trapped in a locked-down hospital, an injured young woman must escape a pair of vicious killers who are after the only piece of evidence that can implicate them in a grisly murder, the bullet in her leg.


List B:
PLOT: Rapunzel and Flynn Rider have their wedding, but Pascal and Maximus must recover the rings they lose in mid-ceremony.

PLOT: A man's failed suicide attempt enables him to see ghosts, who later keep following him everywhere. It is now up to him to fulfill their wishes to make them go away.

PLOT: In the summer of 2003, a group of shepherds took a herd of sheep one final time through the Beartooth Mountains of Montana, in the extreme north-west of the United States. It was a journey of almost three hundred kilometres through expansive green valleys, by fields of snow, and across hazardous, narrow ridges - a journey brimming with challenges. The aging shepherds do their very best to keep the hundreds of sheep together; the panoramic high mountains are teeming with hungry wolves and grizzly bears.—International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam

PLOT: Hari riffs on celebrity encounters, identity politics, and why firefighters are better than cops.

PLOT: Who was the real John DeLorean? To some, he was a renegade visionary who revolutionized the automobile industry. To others, he was the ultimate con man.

PLOT: An adaptation of Alex Haley's "Roots." Chronicles the history of an African man and his descendants sold into slavery in America.

PLOT: "Hawaii, Oslo" is the story of a handful of people who cross one another's paths without necessarily knowing one another, during the hottest day of the year in Oslo. Frode and Milla are having their first child, whom they are told will not live long. Bobbie-Pop, a faded singer, tries to commit suicide. Leon, an institutionalized kleptomaniac, is waiting for the arrival of Åsa, with whom he has a 10-year deal to get married. Leon's brother Trygve fetches Leon from the institution to celebrate his birthday, but Tryge actually plans to use this leave from prison to run away. And the angel Vidar, Leon's best buddy at the institution, sees things no one else can see and just might be able to save everyone.—Anonymous

PLOT: International terrorists get a surprise when their cargo turns out to contain living dinosaurs. The army commando team now have to think fast, if they want to prevent the extinction of the human species, instead of the reptiles.

PLOT: Wealthy, impossible to please lady Polly, whom only gardener Tom's irresistibly charming, indomitably cheerful son Tim, the chauffeur-handyman, can handle, grudgingly lets her late sister's orphaned daughter Pollyanna (11) move into her grand home. The staff take to the playful child, who finds the grimly stern dignified house regime stifling, but often gets round it. The happy game Pollyanna's father taught her soon spreads friendship and joy in the village. After succeeding to adopt a stray cat and dog, she sets her mind to 'fellow orphan' Jimmy Bean. Finding recluse rich neighbour Pendleton with a broken leg and another accident starts a cascade involving his and her family's past.—KGF Vissers

PLOT: A series of uncanny déjà vu events force a man to re-examine his tragic past, memory, instinct, and future.


List C:
PLOT: Spending the summer at a Catskills resort with her family, Frances "Baby" Houseman falls in love with the camp's dance instructor, Johnny Castle.

PLOT: Mysterious things start happening when 12-year-old Naota meets a strange woman on a Vespa wielding a big guitar.

PLOT: Fanatical need for cleanliness of a raging hypochondriac is severe tested when he is mistaken for a war hero preparing for revolution.

PLOT: Nanni Moretti takes a comic look at the ebbs and flows of his life as he becomes a father for the first time. He struggles with distractions while trying to make a documentary of the Italian national elections.

PLOT: Two famous surfers, Patrick O' Connell and Robert "Wingnut" Weaver, set out for an international worldwide surfing safari adventure with documentary filmmaker Bruce Brown.

PLOT: After Davey's father is killed in a hold-up, she and her mother and younger brother visit relatives in New Mexico. Here Davey is befriended by a young man who helps her find the strength to carry on and conquer her fears.

PLOT: After a night out of partying Ava wakes up and sneaks back home only to find that somebody's already in her bed and they look exactly like her. Ava learns that a time-traveling fugitive has stolen her body and she is now a ghost and invisible to everyone.

PLOT: A mourning son makes a deal to reanimate his mother one year after her death, but things take an unexpected turn.

PLOT: George Jetson is forced to uproot his family when Mr. Spacely promotes him to take charge of a new factory on a distant planet.

PLOT: A teenage boy and his mother are further driven apart when they find out that his father's life insurance policy is to be received by his lover.


List D:
PLOT: An injured, unconscious man washes ashore in a small French town. As he recovers, it becomes quite clear, someone is trying to kill him.

PLOT: Sara Thomas is the type of woman who prefers to sit on the sidelines at work, but when her big idea for a Christmas initiative is stolen, she makes a wish to Santa that she'll finally have the courage to stand up for herself. Santa grants her wish, but only gives her 48 hours. As the clock ticks, Sara discovers how to channel the Christmas magic and speak her mind all on her own.—Hallmarkchannel.com

PLOT: The film is seen through the eyes of a ten-year-old boy, Harry (Matías del Pozo), who does not know that Argentina's 1976 coup d'état is impacting his life. After witnessing the "disappearance" of dissident friends, a human rights lawyer (Ricardo Darín) and his research scientist wife (Cecilia Roth) flee the city and hide from the military police in a vacant summer house. With them are their two kids: Harry, who is fascinated with the escape artistry of Harry Houdini, and El Enano, his little brother. (Translated as "Little Guy" in the English subtitles, played by Milton de la Canal. The actual translation is "dwarf".) The family adopts new identities and attempts to lead a normal life. Later, they are joined by a student who is using the alias Lucas (Tomás Fonzi). Their new life is difficult, but a visit with their estranged grandparents (Fernanda Mistral and Héctor Alterio) reveals that they are still a close-knit family. Subtly hinted, however, and used as a metaphor, is the mother's constant smoking and El Enano's renewed bed-wetting. Both serve to show how stressful and precarious their situation is.—http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kamchatka_(film)

PLOT: The story of Tess Durbeyfield, a low-born country girl whose family find they have noble connections.

PLOT: A talented professor is forced to come to terms with her clinical depression.

PLOT: Failed magician Iskender decides to do a tour to save his career, but has to bring his grumpy and senile father along. The tour is quite unexpectedly interrupted when a bride actually disappears from the stage.

PLOT: An American scientist creates a half-pterodactyl, half-barracuda creature, Pteracuda, which inevitably escapes, leaving the Sharktopus to stop it.

PLOT: A twisted honeymoon adventure about a young couple on their way to Niagara Falls.

PLOT: The mysterious death of Sir Charles Baskerville is blamed on a longstanding curse that has followed his family for 200 years, a supernatural hound who roams the moors. Detective Sherlock Holmes attempts to uncover the truth.

PLOT: A Kittenbus puppy, the cat-shaped bus that is one of the protagonists of My Neighbor Totoro, becomes a great friend of little Mei and with her has an incredible night adventure in the forest.


List E:
PLOT: An exploration of the life, lessons, and legacy of iconic children's television host Fred Rogers.

PLOT: An ex-enforcer for a local crime syndicate has vowed to enact retribution on his mob bosses after 19 years of wrongful imprisonment. The only thing diverting his violent plans is a new found relationship to his beloved son.

PLOT: Drawn from a never-before-seen cache of personal footage spanning decades, this is an intimate portrait of the Sri Lankan artist and musician who continues to shatter conventions.

PLOT: Fearless gunslinger Lucky Luke is ordered by the President to bring peace to Daisy Town.

PLOT: very, very strange things are happen to the new guardian of the cemetery.

PLOT: The real "battle" is the insurgence within mankind itself.

PLOT: A live stand up show featurng musical comedian Bill Bailey.

PLOT: When a container washes ashore the residents of a sleepy cul-de-sac are plunged into violence, terror and paranoia. Ring fenced by the military a single mother must overcome all the odds to save her daughter.

PLOT: A pair of star-crossed dancers in New York find themselves at the center of a bitter rivalry between their brothers' underground dance clubs.

PLOT: Buffoonish Ernest and his dimwitted pal Abner unearth a huge cannon reputed to contain the crown jewels of England.


List F:
PLOT: After their cave is destroyed, a caveman family must trek through an unfamiliar fantastical world with the help of an inventive boy.

PLOT: Seven teenagers retreat to a country house for the weekend to make their epic, an impossibly ambitious Celtic fantasy. As the making of the video drifts from playful hilarity to argument, frustrated ambition and accusation, intimate details seep into the script and the gap between fact and fiction closes, foreshadowing later events. When the group decides to lift the mood with an Acid-inspired initiation, secret dreams and fears are revealed, and pent-up emotions released, with all their youthful intensity and passion.—L.H. Wong <as9401k56@ntuvax.ntu.ac.sg>

PLOT: An alienated teenager's posturing online threat ignites a firestorm of fear in a small community.

PLOT: Lee Chung is a Prince of Joseon, but he has been taken hostage to the Qing Dynasty.

PLOT: A Southern California coed parties with her roommates and flirts with a surfer next door.

PLOT: Ernõ Blaskovich lost everything after the Hungarian Revolution of 1848. Kincsem, a magnificent horse gives a purpose of his meaningless, self-destructing life. He gets a chance to gain everything back: revenge, love and fame.

PLOT: New love convinces a struggling actor and dancer to enter a talent competition that could make him a superstar.

PLOT: Diana arrives in a town to start a new job. She's threatened into working as an exotic dancer. She's later kidnapped and let loose naked in the wilderness as prey for the psycho hunter, like many women before her. Will she survive?

PLOT: Based on a true story, this film tells the tale of the 1950 U.S. soccer team, who, against all odds, beat England 1 - 0 in the city of Belo Horizonte, Brazil. Although no U.S. team has ever won a World Cup title, this story is about the family traditions and passions which shaped the lives of the players who made up this team of underdogs.

PLOT: In this documentary, the show's emcee, Vince Vaughn, and four stand-up comedians hand-picked by Vaughn, travel the country and perform in 30 cities. This film documents the interactions on and off stage along the way.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes, from action (Justice League) and crime (gangsters taking over a school) to heartwarming stories (father and son) and quirky comedies (dog and cat turning into perfect guys).  There's also a thriller (injured woman escaping killers), a mystery (Jerranium 90), and a story about a controversial guru. The inclusion of a seemingly mundane plot about guacamole adds to the eclectic mix.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a mix of genres, including animation (Rapunzel wedding), fantasy (ghosts), documentary (shepherds in Montana), comedy (celebrity encounters), biographical (John DeLorean), historical drama (Roots), and science fiction (dinosaurs in cargo). There's also a slice-of-life story set in Oslo and a story about a man re-examining his past. The variety is significant, though some plots are more unique than others.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a blend of romance (Dirty Dancing), surrealism (12-year-old meets strange woman), dark comedy (hypochondriac mistaken for war hero), and personal narratives (Nanni Moretti's life as a new father).  It also includes a documentary-style surfing adventure, a coming-of-age story, a sci-fi thriller (body-swapping), a dark fantasy (reanimating mother), and a futuristic family story. The list is diverse but leans towards more conventional genres.
response.list_D_description: List D features a thriller (injured man in France), a Christmas-themed story about self-discovery, a historical drama set during Argentina's 1976 coup, a classic literary adaptation (Tess of the d'Urbervilles), a story about a professor with depression, a comedic tale of a magician and his father, a B-movie monster mashup (Pteracuda vs. Sharktopus), a dark honeymoon story, a classic mystery (Sherlock Holmes and Baskerville), and a heartwarming children's story. The range of genres and tones is quite wide.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a biographical documentary (Fred Rogers), a crime drama with a focus on family, an intimate portrait of a Sri Lankan artist, a Western (Lucky Luke), a supernatural story, a philosophical drama, a stand-up comedy special, a thriller about a military lockdown, a dance drama, and a slapstick comedy. The list is diverse, with a good mix of genres and tones.
response.list_F_description: List F includes a caveman family adventure, a coming-of-age story about filmmaking, a thriller about an online threat, a historical drama set in the Qing Dynasty, a coming-of-age story set in Southern California, a historical drama about a horse, a story about a talent competition, a thriller about an exotic dancer, a sports drama based on a true story, and a documentary about a stand-up comedy tour. The list is diverse, with a mix of genres and tones, but some plots are more conventional than others.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a significant variety in genres, themes, and tones.  Some lists lean more towards specific genres (e.g., List C has several romantic comedies and family dramas), while others offer a more eclectic mix (e.g., List A).  However, all lists demonstrate a reasonable level of diversity, with a mix of familiar and unique plotlines.  The overall diversity is enhanced by the inclusion of documentaries, animation, and stories from various cultural backgrounds.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: Video game adventurer Lara Croft comes to life in a movie where she races against time and villains to recover powerful ancient artifacts.

PLOT: An epic mosaic of interrelated characters in search of love, forgiveness and meaning in the San Fernando Valley.

PLOT: The crew of the USS Enterprise explores the furthest reaches of uncharted space, where they encounter a new ruthless enemy, who puts them, and everything the Federation stands for, to the test.

PLOT: Three friends attempt to recapture their glory days by opening up a fraternity near their alma mater.

PLOT: In the early 1960s, CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kuryakin participate in a joint mission against a mysterious criminal organization, which is working to proliferate nuclear weapons.

PLOT: Emperor Kuzco is turned into a llama by his ex-administrator Yzma, and must now regain his throne with the help of Pacha, the gentle llama herder.

PLOT: Six months after the rage virus was inflicted on the population of Great Britain, the US Army helps to secure a small area of London for the survivors to repopulate and start again. But not everything goes according to plan.

PLOT: An American reporter goes to the Australian outback to meet an eccentric crocodile poacher and invites him to New York City.

PLOT: When a massive fire kills their parents, three children are delivered to the custody of cousin and stage actor Count Olaf, who is secretly plotting to steal their parents' vast fortune.

PLOT: Two best friends set out on an adventure, but it soon turns around to a terrifying escape from being hunted by the police, as these two girls escape for the crimes they committed.


List B:
PLOT: Blade forms an uneasy alliance with the vampire council in order to combat the Reapers, who are feeding on vampires.

PLOT: In London, four very different people team up on a jewel heist, then try to double-cross one another for the loot, complicated by their efforts to fool a very proper barrister.

PLOT: A process server and his marijuana dealer wind up on the run from hitmen and a corrupt police officer after he witnesses his dealer's boss murder a competitor while trying to serve papers on him.

PLOT: A secret government agency recruits some of the most dangerous incarcerated super-villains to form a defensive task force. Their first mission: save the world from the apocalypse.

PLOT: In a dangerous post-apocalyptic world, an ailing father defends his son as they slowly travel to the sea.

PLOT: A family struggles for survival in a world where most humans have been killed by blind but noise-sensitive creatures. They are forced to communicate in sign language to keep the creatures at bay.

PLOT: Two rock-'n-rolling teens, on the verge of failing their class, set out on a quest to make the ultimate school history report after being presented with a time machine.

PLOT: Frank Martin, who "transports" packages for unknown clients, is asked to move a package that soon begins moving, and complications arise.

PLOT: A look at the relationship between Mike Wazowski (Billy Crystal) and James P. "Sully" Sullivan (John Goodman) during their days at Monsters University, when they weren't necessarily the best of friends.

PLOT: Stranded at a desolate Nevada motel during a nasty rain storm, ten strangers become acquainted with each other when they realize that they're being killed off one by one.


List C:
PLOT: In 1965, an unorthodox and irreverent DJ named Adrian Cronauer begins to shake up things when he is assigned to the U.S. Armed Services radio station in Vietnam.

PLOT: A homicide investigator digs deeper into a case involving a trained military sniper responsible for a mass shooting.

PLOT: Corporal Joe Bauers, a decisively average American, is selected as a guinea pig for a top-secret hibernation program but is forgotten, awakening to a future so incredibly moronic he's easily the most intelligent person alive.

PLOT: The world is beset by the appearance of monstrous creatures, but one of them may be the only one who can save humanity.

PLOT: Will, who attends single parent meetings to woo women, meets Marcus, a troubled 12-year-old boy. As they become friends, Will learns to be responsible while he helps Marcus with his studies.

PLOT: In the 1980s the X-Men must defeat an ancient all-powerful mutant, En Sabah Nur, who intends to thrive through bringing destruction to the world.

PLOT: Paul Rusesabagina, a hotel manager, houses over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda, Africa.

PLOT: The comic "Bluntman and Chronic" is based on real-life stoners Jay and Silent Bob, so when they get no profit from a big-screen adaptation, they set out to wreck the movie.

PLOT: A group of young misfits called The Goonies discover an ancient map and set out on an adventure to find a legendary pirate's long-lost treasure.

PLOT: In a future where people stop aging at 25, but are engineered to live only one more year, having the means to buy your way out of the situation is a shot at immortal youth. Here, Will Salas finds himself accused of murder and on the run with a hostage - a connection that becomes an important part of the way against the system.


List D:
PLOT: Living in exile, Dr. Hannibal Lecter tries to reconnect with now disgraced F.B.I. Agent Clarice Starling, and finds himself a target for revenge from a powerful victim.

PLOT: In 1931 Paris, an orphan living in the walls of a train station gets wrapped up in a mystery involving his late father and an automaton.

PLOT: The discovery of a massive river of ectoplasm and a resurgence of spectral activity allows the staff of Ghostbusters to revive the business.

PLOT: A clean-cut high school student relies on the school's rumor mill to advance her social and financial standing.

PLOT: A man struggles with memories of his past, which include a wife he cannot remember and a nightmarish world no one else ever seems to wake up from.

PLOT: An FBI undercover agent infiltrates the mob and finds himself identifying more with the Mafia life--at the expense of his regular one.

PLOT: The famed monster hunter is sent to Transylvania to stop Count Dracula, who is using Dr. Frankenstein's research and a werewolf for nefarious purposes.

PLOT: T'Challa, heir to the hidden but advanced kingdom of Wakanda, must step forward to lead his people into a new future and must confront a challenger from his country's past.

PLOT: A lovelorn screenwriter becomes desperate as he tries and fails to adapt 'The Orchid Thief' by Susan Orlean for the screen.

PLOT: When his peaceful life is threatened by a high-tech assassin, former black-ops agent Frank Moses reassembles his old team in a last-ditch effort to survive and uncover his assailants.


List E:
PLOT: Two victims of traumatized childhoods become lovers and psychopathic serial murderers irresponsibly glorified by the mass media.

PLOT: An airline pilot saves almost all his passengers on his malfunctioning airliner which eventually crashed, but an investigation into the accident reveals something troubling.

PLOT: Selene, a vampire warrior, is entrenched in a conflict between vampires and werewolves, while falling in love with Michael, a human who is sought by werewolves for unknown reasons.

PLOT: Iowa farmer Ray Kinsella is inspired by a voice he can't ignore to pursue a dream he can hardly believe. Supported by his wife, Ray begins the quest by turning his ordinary cornfield into a place where dreams can come true.

PLOT: A malfunction in a sleeping pod on a spacecraft traveling to a distant colony planet wakes one passenger 90 years early.

PLOT: A bureaucrat in a dystopic society becomes an enemy of the state as he pursues the woman of his dreams.

PLOT: Shakespeare's famous play is updated to the hip modern suburb of Verona still retaining its original dialogue.

PLOT: Six Los Angeles celebrities are stuck in James Franco's house after a series of devastating events just destroyed the city. Inside, the group not only have to face the apocalypse, but themselves.

PLOT: The merciless 1970s rivalry between Formula One rivals James Hunt and Niki Lauda.

PLOT: A comedy about a psychiatrist whose number-one patient is an insecure mob boss.


List F:
PLOT: Based on the story of Micky Ward, a fledgling boxer who tries to escape the shadow of his more famous but troubled older boxing brother and get his own shot at greatness.

PLOT: One year after Kevin McCallister was left home alone and had to defeat a pair of bumbling burglars, he accidentally finds himself stranded in New York City - and the same criminals are not far behind.

PLOT: Thomas is deposited in a community of boys after his memory is erased, soon learning they're all trapped in a maze that will require him to join forces with fellow "runners" for a shot at escape.

PLOT: A man meets a clone of himself and stumbles into a grand conspiracy about clones taking over the world.

PLOT: When a childless couple--an ex-con and an ex-cop--decide to help themselves to one of another family's quintuplets, their lives become more complicated than they anticipated.

PLOT: At Westerburg High where cliques rule, jocks dominate and all the popular girls are named Heather, it's going to take a Veronica and mysterious new kid to give teen angst a body count.

PLOT: Following Kick-Ass' heroics, other citizens are inspired to become masked crusaders, but Red Mist leads his own group of evil super-villains to get revenge, kill Kick-Ass, and destroy everything he stands for.

PLOT: The story of James J. Braddock, a supposedly washed-up boxer who came back to challenge for the heavyweight championship of the world.

PLOT: A little boy is held captive in a room with his mother since his birth, so he has never known the world outside.

PLOT: A young woman is followed by an unknown supernatural force after a sexual encounter.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, covering action-adventure, dramedy, sci-fi, comedy, spy thriller, animation, post-apocalyptic, and crime.  There's a mix of genres and tones, though some overlap exists.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a blend of action, crime, thriller, and sci-fi, with a touch of horror and animation. While diverse in subgenres, the overall tone remains largely dark and action-oriented.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a mix of genres including war drama, crime thriller, sci-fi comedy, monster movie, drama, superhero, historical drama, comedy, adventure, and dystopian sci-fi. The variety is quite good, with diverse tones and settings.
response.list_D_description: List D features thriller, mystery, supernatural comedy, teen drama, psychological thriller, crime drama, horror, superhero, dramedy, and action. The list is diverse in terms of genre and tone, though some themes overlap.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: After narrowly escaping a bizarre accident, a troubled teenager is plagued by visions of a man in a large rabbit suit who manipulates him to commit a series of crimes.

PLOT: In the colorful future, a cab driver unwittingly becomes the central figure in the search for a legendary cosmic weapon to keep Evil and Mr. Zorg at bay.

PLOT: Two astronauts work together to survive after an accident leaves them stranded in space.

PLOT: An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city's water supply.

PLOT: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

PLOT: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.


List B:
PLOT: In 1938, after his father goes missing while pursuing the Holy Grail, Indiana Jones finds himself up against the Nazis again to stop them from obtaining its powers.

PLOT: In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters.

PLOT: A world-class playboy and part-time secret agent from the 1960s emerges after thirty years in a cryogenic state to battle with his nemesis Dr. Evil.

PLOT: During the Cold War, an American lawyer is recruited to defend an arrested Soviet spy in court, and then help the CIA facilitate an exchange of the spy for the Soviet captured American U2 spy plane pilot, Francis Gary Powers.

PLOT: Nina is a talented but unstable ballerina on the verge of stardom. Pushed to the breaking point by her artistic director and a seductive rival, Nina's grip on reality slips, plunging her into a waking nightmare.

PLOT: A frustrated son tries to determine the fact from fiction in his dying father's life.

PLOT: A wealthy New York City investment banking executive, Patrick Bateman, hides his alternate psychopathic ego from his co-workers and friends as he delves deeper into his violent, hedonistic fantasies.

PLOT: Through a series of freak occurrences, a group of actors shooting a big-budget war movie are forced to become the soldiers they are portraying.

PLOT: A substance designed to help the brain repair itself gives advanced intelligence to a chimpanzee who leads an ape uprising.

PLOT: A paraplegic Marine dispatched to the moon Pandora on a unique mission becomes torn between following his orders and protecting the world he feels is his home.


List C:
PLOT: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.

PLOT: A New York City police officer tries to save his estranged wife and several others taken hostage by terrorists during a Christmas party at the Nakatomi Plaza in Los Angeles.

PLOT: A mysterious Hollywood action film stuntman gets in trouble with gangsters when he tries to help his neighbor's husband rob a pawn shop while serving as his getaway driver.

PLOT: A group of high-end professional thieves start to feel the heat from the LAPD when they unknowingly leave a clue at their latest heist.

PLOT: A retired master car thief must come back to the industry and steal fifty cars with his crew in one night to save his brother's life.

PLOT: A young African-American visits his White girlfriend's parents for the weekend, where his simmering uneasiness about their reception of him eventually reaches a boiling point.

PLOT: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mafia, covering his relationship with his wife Karen and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito.

PLOT: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, billionaire engineer Tony Stark creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.


List D:
PLOT: The human city of Zion defends itself against the massive invasion of the machines as Neo fights to end the war at another front while also opposing the rogue Agent Smith.

PLOT: After being kidnapped and imprisoned for fifteen years, Oh Dae-Su is released, only to find that he must find his captor in five days.

PLOT: A grizzled tank commander makes tough decisions as he and his crew fight their way across Germany in April, 1945.

PLOT: A S.W.A.T. team becomes trapped in a tenement run by a ruthless mobster and his army of killers and thugs.

PLOT: Will Hunting, a janitor at M.I.T., has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.


List E:
PLOT: Young Blade Runner K's discovery of a long-buried secret leads him to track down former Blade Runner Rick Deckard, who's been missing for thirty years.

PLOT: Eddy persuades his three pals to pool money for a vital poker game against a powerful local mobster, Hatchet Harry. Eddy loses, after which Harry gives him a week to pay back 500,000 pounds.

PLOT: A shy student trying to reach his family in Ohio, a gun-toting bruiser in search of the last Twinkie and a pair of sisters striving to get to an amusement park join forces in a trek across a zombie-filled America.

PLOT: Secret Service agent Frank Horrigan couldn't save Kennedy, but he's determined not to let a clever assassin take out this president.

PLOT: Six complete strangers with widely varying personalities are involuntarily placed in an endless maze containing deadly traps.

PLOT: A whiny news reporter is given the chance to step into God's shoes.

PLOT: In a magically realistic version of Toronto, a young man must defeat his new girlfriend's seven evil exes one by one in order to win her heart.

PLOT: Three company workers who hate their jobs decide to rebel against their greedy boss.

PLOT: A secret military project endangers Neo-Tokyo when it turns a biker gang member into a rampaging psychic psychopath who can only be stopped by a teenager, his gang of biker friends and a group of psychics.

PLOT: Ace Ventura, Pet Detective, returns from a spiritual quest to investigate the disappearance of a rare white bat, the sacred animal of a tribe in Africa.


List F:
PLOT: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

PLOT: In a future British dystopian society, a shadowy freedom fighter, known only by the alias of "V", plots to overthrow the tyrannical government - with the help of a young woman.

PLOT: A bored married couple is surprised to learn that they are both assassins hired by competing agencies to kill each other.

PLOT: A listless and alienated teenager decides to help his new friend win the class presidency in their small western high school, while he must deal with his bizarre family life back home.

PLOT: An exceptionally-adept Florida lawyer is offered a job at a high-end New York City law firm with a high-end boss--the biggest opportunity of his career to date.

PLOT: When Earth becomes uninhabitable in the future, a farmer and ex-NASA pilot, Joseph Cooper, is tasked to pilot a spacecraft, along with a team of researchers, to find a new planet for humans.

PLOT: A skilled London police officer, after irritating superiors with his embarrassing effectiveness, is transferred to a village where the easygoing officers object to his fervor for regulations, as a string of grisly murders strikes the town.

PLOT: Henry Roth is a man afraid of commitment until he meets the beautiful Lucy. They hit it off and Henry think he's finally found the girl of his dreams until discovering she has short-term memory loss and forgets him the next day.

PLOT: When a criminal mastermind uses a trio of orphan girls as pawns for a grand scheme, he finds their love is profoundly changing him for the better.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety of genres and themes, including psychological thrillers, detective mysteries, science fiction, action, and dramas.  There's a mix of futuristic and contemporary settings, and the plots cover diverse character types and conflicts.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a blend of action-adventure, thrillers, and dramas, with some science fiction elements.  The settings range from historical periods to futuristic worlds, and the plots explore themes of heroism, morality, and psychological turmoil.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a mix of crime dramas, action thrillers, and some social commentary.  The plots often involve high-stakes situations, criminal activities, and personal struggles. There is a blend of true stories and fictional narratives.
response.list_D_description: List D showcases a combination of science fiction, action, legal dramas, and psychological thrillers. The plots explore themes of war, justice, and the human condition, with settings ranging from futuristic worlds to historical periods.
response.list_E_description: List E displays a diverse range of genres, including science fiction, action, comedy, and horror. The plots feature unique settings and characters, with themes of adventure, survival, and the absurdity of life.
response.list_F_description: List F offers a mix of crime, dystopian fiction, action, comedy, and romance. The plots explore themes of rebellion, love, and personal growth, with settings ranging from futuristic societies to contemporary settings.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a broad representation of genres including science fiction, action, thrillers, dramas, crime, comedies, and even some horror and dystopian elements.  The settings vary widely, from historical periods to futuristic worlds, and the plots explore diverse themes such as heroism, morality, psychological struggles, social issues, and personal growth. While some lists lean more heavily towards specific genres, the overall collection demonstrates a good level of diversity.

evaluations.prompt:

PLOT: When Bill (Denis Leary) wakes up in the psychiatric wing at Sumer Hospital, he has trouble distinguishing his dreams from reality.

Lovecraft, He and his friend Charlie embark on an adventure to protect the relic piece from falling into the hands of the Starspawn and his minions that wish to reunite the relic and release Cthulhu back into the world.—Anonymous

Story 2: The vulgar Ivano is married to Jessica, and their wedding journey is an uncompromising tour of discos. Soon the two realize that their relationship is running dry, and after several attempts to revive their passion, they fall into depression and boredom. Story 3: Newlyweds Giovannino and Valeria are about to leave for a cruise, when Giovannino is forced to look after his elderly father, who has been abandoned by the caretaker. Meanwhile, Valeria takes care of her sister, who pretends to commit suicide to get money from her ex-boyfriend. Their honeymoon turns into a nightmare.—X

Christine, her 10-year-old son Gustave, and her husband Raoul, the Vicomte de Changy, travel to Coney Island where Christine is scheduled to sing for Hammerstein, but ends up singing for the mysterious Mister Y. They don't know what lies ahead. Christine and Erik confess about their past, Christine and Raoul reunite with old friends, and Christine sings for her mysterious masked man once more.—cwilliams-48886

These two will have fun together, but not only good times.—Zetannah

Some lists focus on specific genres or thematic elements, while others offer a broader range of cinematic experiences.  List E and F stand out for their inclusion of documentaries and unique subject matter, adding to the overall diversity of the entire batch.

response.diversity_summarization: The six lists demonstrate a reasonable level of diversity in terms of genre and setting. However, many of the plots are quite predictable and lack originality. response.diversity_summarization: Overall, the six lists exhibit a reasonable level of diversity in terms of movie genres.  Some lists lean more heavily towards action and drama, while others offer a broader spectrum including comedy, sci-fi, horror, and family films.  The representation of different genres is not perfectly even across all lists, but there's sufficient variety to avoid a sense of monotony.

response.diversity_summarization: The six lists exhibit varying degrees of diversity. Some lists, like A and E, showcase a wide range of genres, historical periods, and cultural contexts. response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes, including fantasy, superhero, dark comedy, crime, and science fiction.  There's a mix of action-adventure, character-driven stories, and some with supernatural elements. The diversity is quite high.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a mix of action, crime, sci-fi, and psychological thrillers.  While there's a variety of settings and tones, the plots lean towards action-oriented narratives with a focus on crime or conflict. The diversity is moderate.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a blend of action, crime, historical drama, and science fiction.  The settings and time periods vary, but the themes often revolve around conflict, revenge, or dystopian futures. The diversity is moderate.
response.list_D_description: List D includes science fiction, psychological thrillers, crime dramas, and biographical stories. The diversity is moderate, with a mix of genres but a concentration on darker themes and narratives.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases science fiction, drama, thriller, and action genres.  The plots explore themes of survival, artificial intelligence, and societal issues. The diversity is moderate to high.
response.list_F_description: List F features historical dramas, war films, and character studies set against various historical backdrops.  The diversity is moderate, with a focus on human stories within specific historical contexts.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a good representation of various genres, including fantasy, sci-fi, superhero, crime, thriller, historical drama, and biographical stories. However, some lists show a stronger concentration on specific themes (e.g., crime, war) than others.  Overall, the diversity is moderate to high, with a good balance of genres and themes but some thematic overlaps.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: A pragmatic U.S. Marine observes the dehumanizing effects the Vietnam War has on his fellow recruits from their brutal boot camp training to the bloody street fighting in Hue.

PLOT: When Tony Stark and Bruce Banner try to jump-start a dormant peacekeeping program called Ultron, things go horribly wrong and it's up to Earth's mightiest heroes to stop the villainous Ultron from enacting his terrible plan.

PLOT: Daniel Ocean recruits one more team member so he can pull off three major European heists in this sequel to Ocean's Eleven (2001).

PLOT: Katniss Everdeen is in District 13 after she shatters the games forever. Under the leadership of President Coin and the advice of her trusted friends, Katniss spreads her wings as she fights to save Peeta and a nation moved by her courage.

PLOT: Imprisoned on the planet Sakaar, Thor must race against time to return to Asgard and stop Ragnarök, the destruction of his world, at the hands of the powerful and ruthless villain Hela.

PLOT: A frustrated son tries to determine the fact from fiction in his dying father's life.


List B:
PLOT: Harry, Ron, and Hermione search for Voldemort's remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.

PLOT: The eccentric members of a dysfunctional family reluctantly gather under the same roof for various reasons.

PLOT: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.

PLOT: A young African-American visits his White girlfriend's parents for the weekend, where his simmering uneasiness about their reception of him eventually reaches a boiling point.

PLOT: To foil a terrorist plot, an FBI agent assumes the identity of the criminal who murdered his son through facial transplant surgery, but the crook wakes up prematurely and vows revenge.

PLOT: When a pilot crashes and tells of conflict in the outside world, Diana, an Amazonian warrior in training, leaves home to fight a war, discovering her full powers and true destiny.

PLOT: An adaptation of Homer's great epic, the film follows the assault on Troy by the united Greek forces and chronicles the fates of the men involved.

PLOT: Young Blade Runner K's discovery of a long-buried secret leads him to track down former Blade Runner Rick Deckard, who's been missing for thirty years.

PLOT: A man in a legal but hurtful business needs an escort for some social events, and hires a beautiful prostitute he meets... only to fall in love.


List C:
PLOT: In a near future, a lonely writer develops an unlikely relationship with an operating system designed to meet his every need.

PLOT: The early years of James Logan, featuring his rivalry with his brother Victor Creed, his service in the special forces team Weapon X, and his experimentation into the metal-lined mutant Wolverine.

PLOT: After the death of one of his friends, a writer recounts a childhood journey with his friends to find the body of a missing boy.

PLOT: The Avengers and their allies must be willing to sacrifice all in an attempt to defeat the powerful Thanos before his blitz of devastation and ruin puts an end to the universe.

List D:

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: A pragmatic paleontologist touring an almost complete theme park on an island in Central America is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the park's cloned dinosaurs to run loose.

PLOT: As a new threat to the galaxy rises, Rey, a desert scavenger, and Finn, an ex-stormtrooper, must join Han Solo and Chewbacca to search for the one hope of restoring peace.

PLOT: After his son is captured in the Great Barrier Reef and taken to Sydney, a timid clownfish sets out on a journey to bring him home.

PLOT: A seventeen-year-old aristocrat falls in love with a kind but poor artist aboard the luxurious, ill-fated R.M.S. Titanic.

PLOT: A rat who can cook makes an unusual alliance with a young kitchen worker at a famous Paris restaurant.

PLOT: A new street drug that sends its users across time and dimensions has one drawback: some people return no longer human. Can two college drop-outs save humanity from this silent, otherworldly invasion?

PLOT: Ten years after initially meeting, Anakin Skywalker shares a forbidden romance with Padmé Amidala, while Obi-Wan Kenobi discovers a secret clone army crafted for the Jedi.

PLOT: After being kicked out of his rock band, Dewey Finn becomes a substitute teacher of an uptight elementary private school, only to try and turn his class into a rock band.

PLOT: Shrek and Fiona travel to the Kingdom of Far Far Away, where Fiona's parents are King and Queen, to celebrate their marriage. When they arrive, they find they are not as welcome as they thought they would be.

PLOT: A working-class Italian-American bouncer becomes the driver for an African-American classical pianist on a tour of venues through the 1960s American South.


List B:
PLOT: Documentary that looks at the concept of the corporation throughout recent history up to its present-day dominance.

PLOT: A darkly satiric story about life crumbling in the midst of a seemingly idyllic suburbia.

PLOT: A group of thieves breaks into a chamber expecting to find paintings, but instead they release the count himself, who travels to New Orleans to find his nemesis' daughter, Mary Van Helsing.

PLOT: A black op has gone terribly wrong. Now, Captain Carmen Ibanez and a hardcore trooper famed as Major Henry "Hero" Varro must lead a team of battle-weary troopers to find the missing ship and discover what went wrong.

PLOT: When a foreign exchange student arrives in a small upstate New York town, she challenges the dynamics of her host family's relationships and alters their lives forever.

PLOT: In a fantasy world of opposing kingdoms, a fifteen-year-old girl must find the fabled MirrorMask in order to save the kingdom and get home.

PLOT: An idealistic prep school teacher attempts to redeem an incorrigible student.

PLOT: A teenage boy comes back from the dead because he is determined to win the most beautiful girl in school.

PLOT: When a Las Vegas performer-turned-snitch named Buddy Israel decides to turn state's evidence and testify against the mob, it seems that a whole lot of people would like to make sure he's no longer breathing.

PLOT: Conjoined twins from Martha's Vineyard move to Los Angeles so that one of them can pursue an acting career.


List C:
PLOT: Two scientists who are hopeless with the opposite sex experiment with a substance that makes them irresistible to anyone who hears them speak.

PLOT: Courtney Bates, the younger sister of Valerie, and her friends go to a condo for a weekend getaway, but Courtney can't get rid of the haunting feeling that a supernatural rockabilly driller killer is coming to murder them all.

PLOT: Six days in the violent life of a young Johannesburg gang leader.

PLOT: Oct.4 and Dec.26 the Strieber family drives from NYC to their cabin in the woods. Both nights there are some powerful lights outside and maybe aliens. The dad is mentally affected by the "bad dream", goes to the shrink and is hypnotized.

PLOT: Taking place years after The Haunting of Molly Hartley, who now, as an adult, has fallen under the possession of an evil spirit and must be exorcised by a fallen priest before the devil completely takes her.

PLOT: Depicts the final twelve hours in the life of Jesus of Nazareth, on the day of his crucifixion in Jerusalem.

PLOT: The ultimate weapon, which was meant to be safe for humanity, produces global side-effects, including time-slides and disappearances. The scientist behind the project and his car are transported from the year 2031 to 1817's Switzerland, where he finds Dr. Victor Frankenstein and his contemporaries.—Kimmo Ketolainen <kk@iki.fi>

PLOT: The story of the kidnapping of 16-year-old John Paul Getty III and the desperate attempt by his devoted mother to convince his billionaire grandfather Jean Paul Getty to pay the ransom.


List D:
PLOT: A reporter interviews a psychic, who tells her that she's going to die and her life is meaningless.

PLOT: To get royal backing on a needed drainage project, a poor French lord must learn to play the delicate games of wit at court at Versailles.

PLOT: This is the story of companies who engineered their products to fail.

PLOT: A documentary crew follows an elite unit of soldiers in the wake of an alien invasion.

PLOT: Sex and love. Some seek it, some need it, some spurn it, and some pay for it, but we're all involved in it. Set on one afternoon on Hampstead Heath, London, this movie investigates the minutiae of seven couples. What makes us tick?

List E:
PLOT: In the riveting conclusion of the landmark Skywalker saga, new legends will be born-and the final battle for freedom is yet to come.

PLOT: Get ready to rock! In this upbeat musical, Barbie stars as Courtney, a princess whose world is turned upside down when she switches places with Erika, a famous rockstar.

There he meets the lovely Nina, who is communing with her late husband. The two are penniless--she works in a local bar that is about to close down, while he has been forced to start selling his meager possessions. All seems hopelessly bleak, yet when Hamo begins to court Nina, their unexpected love revitalizes them.—Sujit R. Varma

PLOT: Three drag queens travel cross-country until their car breaks down, leaving them stranded in a small town.

List F:

PLOT: JR busts out of prison with Brendan Lynch, Australia's most notorious criminal, and joins Lynch's gang for a gold heist that soon pits the two men against one another.

PLOT: This documentary follows the 2002 mayoral campaign in Newark, New Jersey in which a City Councilman, Cory Booker, attempted to unseat longtime mayor Sharpe James.

PLOT: The story recounts the early life of Genghis Khan who was a slave before going on to conquer half the world in 1206.

PLOT: A fortune teller with extrasensory perception is asked to help find a young woman who has mysteriously disappeared.

evaluations.prompt:

PLOT: A man with short-term memory loss attempts to track down his wife's murderer.

PLOT: In the distant future, a small waste-collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.

PLOT: In 1985 where former superheroes exist, the murder of a colleague sends active vigilante Rorschach into his own sprawling investigation, uncovering something that could completely change the course of history as we know it.
