evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: A greedy film producer assembles a team of moviemakers and sets out for the infamous Skull Island, where they find more than just cannibalistic natives.

PLOT: Determined to make her own path in life, Princess Merida defies a custom that brings chaos to her kingdom. Granted one wish, Merida must rely on her bravery and her archery skills to undo a beastly curse.

PLOT: A pragmatic U.S. Marine observes the dehumanizing effects the Vietnam War has on his fellow recruits from their brutal boot camp training to the bloody street fighting in Hue.

PLOT: Supernatural exorcist and demonologist John Constantine helps a policewoman prove her sister's death was not a suicide, but something more.

PLOT: The fragile peace between apes and humans is threatened as mistrust and betrayal threaten to plunge both tribes into a war for dominance over the Earth.

PLOT: Two strangers awaken in a room with no recollection of how they got there, and soon discover they're pawns in a deadly game perpetrated by a notorious serial killer.

PLOT: Dr. Ellie Arroway, after years of searching, finds conclusive radio proof of extraterrestrial intelligence, sending plans for a mysterious machine.

PLOT: Follows the lives of eight very different couples in dealing with their love lives in various loosely interrelated tales all set during a frantic month before Christmas in London, England.

PLOT: After Peter Parker is bitten by a genetically altered spider, he gains newfound, spider-like powers and ventures out to save the city from the machinations of a mysterious reptilian foe.

PLOT: In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters.


List B:
PLOT: Hoping to walk away with a massive fortune, a trio of thieves break into the house of a blind man who isn't as helpless as he seems.

PLOT: David Attenborough returns to the world's oceans in this sequel to the acclaimed documentary filming rare and unusual creatures of the deep, as well as documenting the problems our oceans face.

PLOT: When he finds out his longtime girlfriend is pregnant, a commitment-phobe realizes he might have to change his lifestyle for better or much, much worse.

PLOT: Xander Cage is left for dead after an incident, though he secretly returns to action for a new, tough assignment with his handler Augustus Gibbons.

PLOT: George, a lonely and fatalistic teen who has made it all the way to his senior year without ever having done a real day of work, is befriended by Sally, a popular but complicated girl who recognizes in him a kindred spirit.

PLOT: A shot-for-shot remake of Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981), started by three 12-year-olds and completed over a period of six years.

PLOT: A documentary on Brazilian Formula One racing driver Ayrton Senna, who won the F1 world championship three times before his death at age 34.

PLOT: A boy has a crush on another boy and he is too shy to confess, but his heart is not so reticent.

PLOT: In the small town of Mumford, a psychologist of the same name moves in and quickly becomes very popular, despite a questionable past.

PLOT: A quiet pawnshop keeper with a violent past takes on a drug-and-organ trafficking ring in hope of saving the child who is his only friend.


List C:
PLOT: Shy 14-year-old Duncan goes on summer vacation with his mother, her overbearing boyfriend, and her boyfriend's daughter. Having a rough time fitting in, Duncan finds an unexpected friend in Owen, manager of the Water Wizz water park.

PLOT: Alice is appointed to save her beloved Mad Hatter from deadly grief by travelling back to the past, but this means fatally harming Time himself, the noble clockwork man with the device needed to save the Hatter's family from the Red Queen.

PLOT: Documentary film produced for the 10th anniversary release of the film Schindler's List (1993) and the establishment of the "Survivors of the Shoah Visual History Foundation"

PLOT: When Bryan sets out to uncover the truth about doping in sports, a chance meeting with a Russian scientist transforms his story from a personal experiment into a geopolitical thriller.

PLOT: When a team of explorers venture into the catacombs that lie beneath the streets of Paris, they uncover the dark secret that lies within this city of the dead.

PLOT: An injured, unconscious man washes ashore in a small French town. As he recovers, it becomes quite clear, someone is trying to kill him.

PLOT: Now settled in Genovia, Princess Mia faces a new revelation: she is being primed for an arranged marriage to an English suitor.

PLOT: Mammoth series, five years in the making, taking a look at the rich tapestry of life in the world's oceans.

PLOT: Fresh from prison, a street racer who was framed by a wealthy business associate joins a cross-country race with revenge in mind. His ex-partner, learning of the plan, places a massive bounty on his head as the race begins.

PLOT: A teenager finds his dreams of becoming a basketball star threatened after he free falls into the harrowing world of drug addiction.


List D:
PLOT: Three backpackers head to a Slovak city that promises to meet their hedonistic expectations, with no idea of the hell that awaits them.

PLOT: Based on the New York Times bestseller, this movie tells the incredibly inspiring and heartwarming story of August Pullman, a boy with facial differences who enters the fifth grade, attending a mainstream elementary school for the first time.

PLOT: A girl is among the few survivors of a dystopian Earth. Riding a war tank, she fights against the tyranny of a mega-corporation that dominates the remaining potable water supply of the planet.

PLOT: Ella is under a spell to be constantly obedient, a fact she must hide from her new stepfamily in order to protect the prince of the land, her friend for whom she's falling.

PLOT: To protect his brother-in-law from a drug lord, a former smuggler heads to Panama to score millions of dollars in counterfeit bills.

PLOT: A snowstorm forces two people who made an online connection to unwillingly extend their one-night stand as the blizzard goes through the night.

PLOT: Mr. Miyagi is back and he takes a new pupil under his wing: a troubled adolescent girl.

PLOT: A documentary that follows the journeys of indie game developers as they create games and release those works, and themselves, to the world.

PLOT: A man suffering a family loss enrolls in a class about care-giving that changes his perspective on life.

PLOT: A Hong Kong detective suffers a fatal accident involving a mysterious medallion and is transformed into an immortal warrior with superhuman powers.


List F:

PLOT: A maverick skydiver and a former KGB agent team up to stop the Russian mafia from stealing gold.

PLOT: A streetwise man flees South Central Los Angeles, heading to the suburbs and his lottery-winner uncle and cousin, to avoid a neighborhood thug with a grudge who has just escaped from prison.

PLOT: Several months after the U.S. entry into World War II, an inexperienced U.S. Navy commander must lead an Allied convoy being stalked by a German submarine wolf pack.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, covering genres like action-adventure (Skull Island, Merida), war (Vietnam War), horror (Constantine), sci-fi (War for the Planet of the Apes, Contact), thriller (Room), and romantic comedy (Love Actually).  There's a superhero element (Spider-Man) and a Western-style thriller (The Hateful Eight).
response.list_B_description: List B is more diverse than it initially appears. It includes crime (Blind), nature documentaries (David Attenborough's Ocean), romantic comedy (Knocked Up), action (xXx), coming-of-age (George), a remake (Raiders), biographical documentary (Ayrton Senna), LGBTQ+ romance (Heart), dark comedy (Mumford), and action thriller (Pawn Shop Chronicles).
response.list_C_description: List C features coming-of-age (Duncan), fantasy (Alice), documentary (Schindler's List anniversary), thriller (Doping), horror (Catacombs), thriller (The Man from London), romantic comedy (Princess Diaries), nature documentary (Oceans), action (Street Racer), and sports drama (Basketball). The diversity is good, with a mix of genres and themes.
response.list_D_description: List D offers a mix of genres including horror (Hostel), heartwarming drama (Wonder), dystopian action (Tank Girl), nature documentary (David Attenborough), fairytale (Ella Enchanted), action (Panama), coming-of-age (Summer House), musical (That Thing You Do!), historical drama (Vlad), and fantasy (Onward). The range of themes and tones is quite broad.
response.list_E_description: List E contains a documentary (Jiro Dreams of Sushi), action (Mei), horror (Apartment Building), dark comedy (Hitler), romantic comedy (Snowstorm), romance (A Room with a View), martial arts (Mr. Miyagi), documentary (Indie Game: The Movie), drama (Caregiving), and action (Hong Kong Detective). The list presents a good mix of genres and tones.
response.list_F_description: List F showcases a variety of genres: action (NASCAR Heist), horror (Zombie Film), children's adventure (Lorax), drama (AIDS Crisis), romantic comedy (Dating), true crime documentary (Making a Murderer), action (Skydiver), biographical drama (David Lipsky), crime (Lottery Ticket), and war (Convoy). The list is diverse in terms of genre and subject matter.
response.diversity_summarization: All six lists demonstrate a good level of diversity in terms of genre, tone, and subject matter.  While some lists lean more heavily into certain genres (e.g., documentaries), the overall collection shows a wide range of cinematic experiences, from action and horror to romantic comedies and documentaries.  The inclusion of documentaries and films representing diverse perspectives adds to the overall diversity.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

PLOT: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.

PLOT: Blacksmith Will Turner teams up with eccentric pirate "Captain" Jack Sparrow to save his love, the governor's daughter, from Jack's former pirate allies, who are now undead.

PLOT: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, two monsters realize things may not be what they think.

PLOT: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, billionaire engineer Tony Stark creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.

PLOT: While trying to lead a quiet suburban life, a family of undercover superheroes are forced into action to save the world.

PLOT: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the shocking truth--the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence.

PLOT: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

PLOT: Marty McFly, a 17-year-old high school student, is accidentally sent 30 years into the past in a time-traveling DeLorean invented by his close friend, the maverick scientist Doc Brown.

PLOT: A pragmatic paleontologist touring an almost complete theme park on an island in Central America is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the park's cloned dinosaurs to run loose.


List B:
PLOT: A small town in upstate New York plays host to its inhabitants' delusions of grandeur.

PLOT: Together, four heroes build their own army to retrieve the orb, using elemental forces to defeat Damodar before he summons the sleeping black dragon.

PLOT: In this documentary, the show's emcee, Vince Vaughn, and four stand-up comedians hand-picked by Vaughn, travel the country and perform in 30 cities. This film documents the interactions on and off stage along the way.

PLOT: Teenage tech whizzes unwittingly use military software to program a robotic boyfriend.

PLOT: It's South Africa 1990. Two major events are about to happen: The release of Nelson Mandela and, more importantly, it's Spud Milton's first year at an elite boys only private boarding school.

PLOT: The intimate, final performance of Bruce Springsteen's 236-show run at Jujamcyn's Walter Kerr Theatre on Broadway.

PLOT: In a small Turkish town, two young tuberculous poets try to survive while publishing their poems. As they both fall in love, their life would never be the same.

PLOT: Left for dead on a sun-scorched planet, Riddick finds himself up against an alien race of predators. Activating an emergency beacon alerts two ships: one carrying a new breed of mercenary, the other captained by a man from Riddick's past.

PLOT: Five best friends, all married, decide to share a loft apartment to carry on affairs.

PLOT: Vegucated is a guerrilla-style documentary that follows three meat- and cheese-loving New Yorkers who agree to adopt a vegan diet for six weeks and learn what it's all about.


List C:
PLOT: Jon, a young wanna-be musician, discovers he's bitten off more than he can chew when he joins an eccentric pop band led by the mysterious and enigmatic Frank.

PLOT: Stefan's back in Germany for a paper for his wedding in Dubai. His old friend, Kai, gets him in drug trouble. They try to help Kai's stepson, who works for drug dealers. Stefan meets an old flame.

PLOT: Regardless of Joe Rogan's success on television with the Ultimate Fighting Championship or hosting Fear Factor or co-starring in NewsRadio, his true love is stand-up comedy. With more than 15 years as a touring comedian, Rogan has honed an opinionated comedic style that challenges the status quo. From his unorthodox ideas for peace in the Middle East to debunking the myth of Noah's Ark and appreciating the vastness of space - all of the energy of a live Joe Rogan performance is captured on Joe Rogan: Live!—Anonymous

PLOT: The Seven Dwarves live deep within a female-free-zone of the Enchanted Forest, but they cannot resist the innocent charms of Snow White when she enters their world. So when the evil queen (Nina Hagen) abducts her, it is up to the dwarves to save her life.

PLOT: Get ready to rock! In this upbeat musical, Barbie stars as Courtney, a princess whose world is turned upside down when she switches places with Erika, a famous rockstar.

PLOT: A 3-D concert film of the 2007 Hannah Montana/Miley Cyrus tour.

PLOT: A failed parole officer framed for murder must enlist the help of his former clients to clear his name.

PLOT: Dr. Seung-hoon sedates his landlord before medical check-up, when the old man begins telling him a convincing murder confession.

PLOT: Louis meets parents who have turned to medication to keep their children under control.

PLOT: SAVING CAPITALISM is a documentary film that follows former Secretary of Labor and Professor, Robert Reich, as he takes his book and his views to the heart of conservative America to speak about our economic system and present big ideas for how to fix it.


List D:
PLOT: A 20-something supervising staff member of a residential treatment facility navigates the troubled waters of that world alongside her co-worker and longtime boyfriend.

PLOT: While visiting Tuscany, Italy, a young wizard accidentally creates an evil version of herself.

PLOT: Conman Leo Garfield is in hot water after accepting a contract to murder businessman Julius Harvey's alleged wife, Gloria. Leo's wife Lily brings trouble too when her old flame Elmo pops up again, years after she abandoned him mid-heist.

PLOT: After their mother dies, two boys flee their mean aunt and head for Venice, Italy, where they meet Scipio, the mysterious "Thief Lord." Along with a small gang of abandoned kids, the boys start robbing the rich to support themselves.

PLOT: Alex is floating unconscious in a lake when light from a UFO of light saves her by enhancing her abilities such as telekinesis and healing power. Her friend Sean helps her. The authorities want her - not just for stealing a police car.

PLOT: In 1915 a man survives the Armenian genocide in the Ottoman Empire, but loses his family, speech and faith. One night he learns that his twin daughters may be alive, and goes on a quest to find them.

PLOT: Michael, Arjun and Lallan, three men from three different strata of society, cross paths one morning in Calcutta and change one another's lives forever.

PLOT: A family become imprisoned in their home by intruders who force them to play a life and death game where the mysterious rules become clear as the night unfolds.

PLOT: This is a documentary about the musical artists who performed the songs in the Coen Brothers' film O Brother, Where Art Thou?

PLOT: A Finnish man has dreamed of becoming a Swede since childhood.


List E:
PLOT: As Michael and Robert, a gay couple in New York, prepare for Robert's departure for a two-year work assignment in Africa, Michael must face Robert's true motives for leaving while dealing with their circle of eccentric friends, including Nick, who is living with AIDS.—Travis Spence <00tdspence@bsuvc.bsu.edu>

PLOT: An aging rock star's wife is kidnapped while vacationing in Chile.

PLOT: Christine Daaé, a talented young singer, after being discovered by the known playboy Comte Philippe de Chagny, is sent to the Paris Opera House by her new patron to be classically trained. Unfortunately, her point of contact, the manager, Gérard Carrière, has just been fired. The new managers -- Cholet and his wife, Carlotta -- put Christine to work in the costuming department instead. After a short time there, Christine is overheard singing in the dead of night by the fabled Phantom of the Opera that lurks far below the theatre. The Phantom soon introduces himself as Maestro and decides to take Christine under his wing, training her voice himself. However, all of their plans upend when Comte de Chagny returns to Paris.

PLOT: Diagnosed with a mental illness halfway through his senior year of high school, a witty, introspective teen struggles to keep it a secret while falling in love with a brilliant classmate who inspires him to not be defined by his condition.

PLOT: A thousand 17-year-old boys from Texas join together to build a representative government from the ground up.

PLOT: Ellie, a recovering drug addict, moves to a new city with her two teenage children. Struggling to stay sober, her life changes when she meets Christopher, who is a different kind of addict.

PLOT: In Greece during World War II, a young Jewish boxer, meets regularly with girlfriend Allegra until they and their families are sent to Auschwitz. When the Nazis learn of his boxing, they force him to participate in weekly boxing matches.

PLOT: Masha is a young provincial girl, trying her best to succeed in a big city. She studies all day, works all night, and dreams of winning the heart of a popular singer. Will the fairy-tale romance happen?

PLOT: A look at the story behind Marvel Studios and the Marvel Cinematic Universe, featuring interviews and behind-the-scenes footage from all of the Marvel films, the Marvel One-Shots and "Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D."

PLOT: In April 1964, more than twenty years after the Nazis won World War II, S.S. officer Xavier March uncovers a plot to eliminate the attendees of the Wannsee Conference so that Germany can establish better relations with the U.S.


List F:
PLOT: The only dream of Pietro is to become a famous actor. 28 year-old Pietro is so obsessed with becoming an actor that he does not mind trying every single way. He comes Rome and starts to work in a bakery. Also, at the same time, he tries to be an actor. At first, he stays with his cousin, Maria , but then he rents a house.

PLOT: A woman at rock bottom must find her way across Los Angeles in order to crash her ex-boyfriend's engagement party.

PLOT: The exploits of 303 Squadron RAF during the Battle of Britain. The squadron consisted of Polish pilots, many of whom were veterans of the air battles involved in Germany's invasion of Poland.

PLOT: What if the most chilling novel of all time was actually based on account of a horrific experiment gone awry?

PLOT: Poor girl attends the elite Shin Hwa High and is bullied by the leader of F4 (the four richest boys). He becomes attracted to her; however, she has a crush on his best friend. Whom will she choose?

PLOT: In a post-Armageddon world, a young woman finds herself in a fight for survival against mutant cavemen, dinosaurs and other prehistoric animals.

PLOT: Megiddo is a supernatural ride into a world teetering on the edge of the Apocalypse. It follows the rise of a Machiavellian leader bent on amassing the armies of the world for the battle of Armageddon while calamities of Biblical proportions pummel the Earth. Though both prequel and sequel to The Omega Code, Megiddo works also as a stand alone story for anyone who missed its predecessor, for, at its emotional core, Megiddo is the Caine and Abel story of the two men enamored with the same woman, raised as brothers, who grew up to find themselves pitted against each other over the fate and souls of the entire world.—Anonymous

PLOT: The drama follows two brothers who start a bar and get swept up in its success in the midst of Belgium's nightlife scene.

PLOT: Toby Mastallone (Jami Gertz) wants to trade her local diner for upmarket dates in Manhattan. But what is a New Jersey schoolteacher who longs to look 'like a city girl' to do? Ever resourceful, she decides to collide her battered VW into the brand-new Mercedes that belongs to Sal (Dylan McDermott). Will her plan work? What secrets are hiding beneath Sal's slick yuppie exterior? And what will her loyal friends say?

PLOT: A man tries to make his wife fall in love with him again, after waking up in an alternate reality where she never knew him.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a mix of genres including fantasy, adventure, action, sci-fi, superhero, and thriller.  There's a good balance between different themes and settings, indicating decent diversity.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a more eclectic mix, encompassing drama, fantasy, documentary, sci-fi, coming-of-age, musical performance, romance, and action. The inclusion of documentaries and varied subgenres within broader categories enhances its diversity.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a blend of musical, crime, comedy, fantasy, and documentary elements. While some genres are repeated, the inclusion of diverse subgenres and styles within those categories contributes to a moderate level of diversity.
response.list_D_description: List D features a range of genres including drama, fantasy, crime, adventure, sci-fi, historical fiction, and thriller. The variety in settings and themes suggests a relatively diverse selection of movies.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a mix of romance, thriller, musical, drama, political satire, and historical fiction. The inclusion of LGBTQ+ themes adds another layer of diversity, although the number of entries is relatively small.
response.list_F_description: List F includes a variety of genres such as drama, comedy, war, thriller, romance, sci-fi, and apocalyptic fiction. The range of themes and settings contributes to a moderate level of diversity.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a considerable variety of genres represented, including fantasy, sci-fi, action, thriller, romance, comedy, drama, historical fiction, documentaries, and musicals.  While some genres appear more frequently than others, the overall representation of diverse themes, settings, and styles suggests a good level of diversity in the movie selections.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: The human city of Zion defends itself against the massive invasion of the machines as Neo fights to end the war at another front while also opposing the rogue Agent Smith.

PLOT: After graduating from Emory University, top student and athlete Christopher McCandless abandons his possessions, gives his entire $24,000 savings account to charity and hitchhikes to Alaska to live in the wilderness. Along the way, Christopher encounters a series of characters that shape his life.

PLOT: As Steve Rogers struggles to embrace his role in the modern world, he teams up with a fellow Avenger and S.H.I.E.L.D agent, Black Widow, to battle a new threat from history: an assassin known as the Winter Soldier.

PLOT: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.

PLOT: A single mother and waitress, a misanthropic author, and a gay artist form an unlikely friendship after the artist is assaulted in a robbery.

PLOT: Four kids travel through a wardrobe to the land of Narnia and learn of their destiny to free it with the guidance of a mystical lion.

PLOT: Guilt-stricken after a job gone wrong, hitman Ray and his partner await orders from their ruthless boss in Bruges, Belgium, the last place in the world Ray wants to be.

PLOT: Journalist Mikael Blomkvist is aided in his search for a woman who has been missing for 40 years by young computer hacker Lisbeth Salander.

PLOT: A self-indulgent and vain publishing magnate finds his privileged life upended after a vehicular accident with a resentful lover.

PLOT: A substance designed to help the brain repair itself gives advanced intelligence to a chimpanzee who leads an ape uprising.


List B:
PLOT: A whiny news reporter is given the chance to step into God's shoes.

PLOT: Acting under the cover of a Hollywood producer scouting a location for a science fiction film, a CIA agent launches a dangerous operation to rescue six Americans in Tehran during the U.S. hostage crisis in Iran in 1979.

PLOT: The drug-induced utopias of four Coney Island people are shattered when their addictions run deep.

PLOT: The dwarves, along with Bilbo Baggins and Gandalf the Grey, continue their quest to reclaim Erebor, their homeland, from Smaug. Bilbo Baggins is in possession of a mysterious and magical ring.

PLOT: A man in a legal but hurtful business needs an escort for some social events, and hires a beautiful prostitute he meets... only to fall in love.

PLOT: A special bond develops between plus-sized inflatable robot Baymax and prodigy Hiro Hamada, who together team up with a group of friends to form a band of high-tech heroes.

PLOT: Dr. Ellie Arroway, after years of searching, finds conclusive radio proof of extraterrestrial intelligence, sending plans for a mysterious machine.

PLOT: An adaptation of Homer's great epic, the film follows the assault on Troy by the united Greek forces and chronicles the fates of the men involved.

PLOT: In 1945, immediately following the end of Second World War, a woman who lives with her two photosensitive children on her darkened old family estate in the Channel Islands becomes convinced that the home is haunted.

PLOT: In a future where mutants are nearly extinct, an elderly and weary Logan leads a quiet life. But when Laura, a mutant child pursued by scientists, comes to him for help, he must get her to safety.


List C:
PLOT: A mysterious pill that enables the user to access 100% of his brain's abilities transforms a struggling writer into a financial wizard, but it also puts him in a new world with many dangers.

PLOT: A puppeteer discovers a portal that leads literally into the head of movie star John Malkovich.

PLOT: To everyone's surprise, including his own, Po, an overweight, clumsy panda, is chosen as protector of the Valley of Peace. His suitability will soon be tested as the valley's arch-enemy is on his way.

PLOT: An F.B.I. Agent and an Interpol Detective track a team of illusionists who pull off bank heists during their performances, and reward their audiences with the money.

PLOT: A pragmatic U.S. Marine observes the dehumanizing effects the Vietnam War has on his fellow recruits from their brutal boot camp training to the bloody street fighting in Hue.

PLOT: A misfit ant, looking for "warriors" to save his colony from greedy grasshoppers, recruits a group of bugs that turn out to be an inept circus troupe.

PLOT: In 2006-2007 a group of investors bet against the United States mortgage market. In their research, they discover how flawed and corrupt the market is.

PLOT: After being kidnapped and imprisoned for fifteen years, Oh Dae-Su is released, only to find that he must find his captor in five days.

PLOT: As Harry Potter begins his sixth year at Hogwarts, he discovers an old book marked as "the property of the Half-Blood Prince" and begins to learn more about Lord Voldemort's dark past.

PLOT: Maverick teacher John Keating returns in 1959 to the prestigious New England boys' boarding school where he was once a star student, using poetry to embolden his pupils to new heights of self-expression.


List D:
PLOT: Evan Treborn suffers blackouts during significant events of his life. As he grows up, he finds a way to remember these lost memories and a supernatural way to alter his life by reading his journal.

PLOT: When the newly crowned Queen Elsa accidentally uses her power to turn things into ice to curse her home in infinite winter, her sister Anna teams up with a mountain man, his playful reindeer, and a snowman to change the weather condition.

PLOT: Kazakh TV talking head Borat is dispatched to the United States to report on the greatest country in the world. With a documentary crew in tow, Borat becomes more interested in locating and marrying Pamela Anderson.

PLOT: After being betrayed and left for dead in Italy, Charlie Croker and his team plan an elaborate gold heist against their former ally.

PLOT: A young man who survives a disaster at sea is hurtled into an epic journey of adventure and discovery. While cast away, he forms an unexpected connection with another survivor: a fearsome Bengal tiger.

PLOT: After a wealthy San Francisco banker is given an opportunity to participate in a mysterious game, his life is turned upside down as he begins to question if it might really be a concealed conspiracy to destroy him.

PLOT: Political involvement in the Avengers' affairs causes a rift between Captain America and Iron Man.

PLOT: Four weeks after a mysterious, incurable virus spreads throughout the UK, a handful of survivors try to find sanctuary.

PLOT: Determined to make her own path in life, Princess Merida defies a custom that brings chaos to her kingdom. Granted one wish, Merida must rely on her bravery and her archery skills to undo a beastly curse.

PLOT: A biopic depicting the early years of legendary director and aviator Howard Hughes' career from the late 1920s to the mid 1940s.


List E:
PLOT: While on a journey of physical and spiritual healing, a brilliant neurosurgeon is drawn into the world of the mystic arts.

PLOT: Goaded by his buddies, a nerdy guy who's never "done the deed" only finds the pressure mounting when he meets a single mother.

PLOT: The magically long-haired Rapunzel has spent her entire life in a tower, but now that a runaway thief has stumbled upon her, she is about to discover the world for the first time, and who she really is.

PLOT: Living a life marked by violence, neo-Nazi Derek finally goes to prison after killing two black youths. Upon his release, Derek vows to change; he hopes to prevent his brother, Danny, who idolizes Derek, from following in his footsteps.

PLOT: Katniss Everdeen is in District 13 after she shatters the games forever. Under the leadership of President Coin and the advice of her trusted friends, Katniss spreads her wings as she fights to save Peeta and a nation moved by her courage.

PLOT: Between 1968 and 1983, a San Francisco cartoonist becomes an amateur detective obsessed with tracking down the Zodiac Killer, an unidentified individual who terrorizes Northern California with a killing spree.

PLOT: Stranded in 1955, Marty McFly learns about the death of Doc Brown in 1885 and must travel back in time to save him. With no fuel readily available for the DeLorean, the two must figure how to escape the Old West before Emmett is murdered.

PLOT: A fisherman, a smuggler, and a syndicate of businessmen match wits over the possession of a priceless diamond.

PLOT: A highly advanced robotic boy longs to become "real" so that he can regain the love of his human mother.

PLOT: A bedridden boy's grandfather reads him the story of a farmboy-turned-pirate who encounters numerous obstacles, enemies and allies in his quest to be reunited with his true love.


List F:
PLOT: A soldier wakes up in someone else's body and discovers he's part of an experimental government program to find the bomber of a commuter train within 8 minutes.

PLOT: A faded movie star and a neglected young woman form an unlikely bond after crossing paths in Tokyo.

PLOT: A video game villain wants to be a hero and sets out to fulfill his dream, but his quest brings havoc to the whole arcade where he lives.

PLOT: At an archaeological dig in the ancient city of Hamunaptra, an American serving in the French Foreign Legion accidentally awakens a mummy who begins to wreak havoc as he searches for the reincarnation of his long-lost love.

PLOT: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.

PLOT: Armed with a super-suit with the astonishing ability to shrink in scale but increase in strength, cat burglar Scott Lang must embrace his inner hero and help his mentor, Dr. Hank Pym, pull off a plan that will save the world.

PLOT: The adventures of writer Newt Scamander in New York's secret community of witches and wizards seventy years before Harry Potter reads his book in school.

PLOT: When Louis Bloom, a con man desperate for work, muscles into the world of L.A. crime journalism, he blurs the line between observer and participant to become the star of his own story.

PLOT: Hancock is a superhero whose ill-considered behavior regularly causes damage in the millions. He changes when the person he saves helps him improve his public image.

PLOT: A widowed former reverend living with his children and brother on a Pennsylvania farm finds mysterious crop circles in their fields, which suggests something more frightening to come.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a mix of genres, including science fiction, adventure, drama, and crime.  There's a balance between action-oriented plots and character-driven narratives, resulting in moderate diversity.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a blend of genres, from comedy and political thrillers to fantasy and science fiction. The inclusion of historical settings and futuristic elements contributes to its diversity, although some plots share similar themes of adventure and heroism.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a variety of genres, including fantasy, crime, war, and coming-of-age stories. The plots range from whimsical adventures to serious explorations of human nature, creating a diverse collection.
response.list_D_description: List D features a mix of genres, including fantasy, comedy, action, and thriller. The inclusion of historical and contemporary settings adds to the diversity, although some plots share similar themes of adventure and heroism.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a range of genres, from fantasy and romance to crime and science fiction. The plots explore diverse themes, including personal growth, social issues, and technological advancements, resulting in a relatively high level of diversity.
response.list_F_description: List F presents a mix of genres, including science fiction, drama, comedy, and fantasy. The plots range from action-packed adventures to character-driven stories, creating a diverse collection. However, some plots share similar themes of heroism and adventure.
response.diversity_summarization: Overall, the six lists demonstrate a good level of diversity in terms of genre and thematic content. While some lists show a stronger representation of certain genres (e.g., adventure and fantasy), the overall collection offers a varied selection of movie plots, showcasing different styles and narratives.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the shocking truth--the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence.

PLOT: Barely 21 yet, Frank is a skilled forger who has passed as a doctor, lawyer and pilot. FBI agent Carl becomes obsessed with tracking down the con man, who only revels in the pursuit.

PLOT: Over the course of several years, two convicts form a friendship, seeking consolation and, eventually, redemption through basic compassion.

PLOT: Will Hunting, a janitor at M.I.T., has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.

PLOT: A struggling salesman takes custody of his son as he's poised to begin a life-changing professional career.

PLOT: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.

PLOT: A man with short-term memory loss attempts to track down his wife's murderer.

PLOT: A group of intergalactic criminals must pull together to stop a fanatical warrior with plans to purge the universe.

PLOT: In turn-of-the-century Vienna, a magician uses his abilities to secure the love of a woman far above his social standing.

PLOT: When Earth becomes uninhabitable in the future, a farmer and ex-NASA pilot, Joseph Cooper, is tasked to pilot a spacecraft, along with a team of researchers, to find a new planet for humans.


List B:
PLOT: After a tragic accident, two stage magicians in 1890s London engage in a battle to create the ultimate illusion while sacrificing everything they have to outwit each other.

PLOT: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.

PLOT: A FedEx executive undergoes a physical and emotional transformation after crash landing on a deserted island.

PLOT: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

PLOT: A tale set on death row in a Southern jail, where gentle giant John possesses the mysterious power to heal people's ailments. When the lead guard, Paul, recognizes John's gift, he tries to help stave off the condemned man's execution.

PLOT: When a criminal mastermind uses a trio of orphan girls as pawns for a grand scheme, he finds their love is profoundly changing him for the better.

PLOT: Danny Ocean and his ten accomplices plan to rob three Las Vegas casinos simultaneously.

PLOT: Detective Sherlock Holmes and his stalwart partner Watson engage in a battle of wits and brawn with a nemesis whose plot is a threat to all of England.

PLOT: Frankie, an ill-tempered old coach, reluctantly agrees to train aspiring boxer Maggie. Impressed with her determination and talent, he helps her become the best and the two soon form a close bond.

PLOT: As Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the social networking site that would become known as Facebook, he is sued by the twins who claimed he stole their idea and by the co-founder who was later squeezed out of the business.


List C:
PLOT: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.

PLOT: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.

PLOT: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.

PLOT: In a near future, a lonely writer develops an unlikely relationship with an operating system designed to meet his every need.

PLOT: Two astronauts work together to survive after an accident leaves them stranded in space.

PLOT: When Gru, the world's most super-bad turned super-dad has been recruited by a team of officials to stop lethal muscle and a host of Gru's own, He has to fight back with new gadgetry, cars, and more minion madness.

PLOT: A seventeen-year-old aristocrat falls in love with a kind but poor artist aboard the luxurious, ill-fated R.M.S. Titanic.

PLOT: Two terminally ill men escape from a cancer ward and head off on a road trip with a wish list of to-dos before they die.


List D:
PLOT: In the distant future, a small waste-collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.

PLOT: A paraplegic Marine dispatched to the moon Pandora on a unique mission becomes torn between following his orders and protecting the world he feels is his home.

PLOT: When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories for ever.

PLOT: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soap maker form an underground fight club that evolves into much more.

Henry (Neil Giuntoli) takes a thankless job at a port-o-john company where he meets husband and wife, Kai (Ken Komenich) and Cricket (Kate Walsh). They take pity on the homeless drifter and offer him a room in the home they share with their emotionally fragile teenage niece, Louisa (Carri Levinson). Henry learns that Kai has a side job as an arsonist-for-hire, setting up phony insurance scams to make money for their boss, Rooter (Daniel Allar). He agrees to join Kai and on one of their first outings, they discover two squatters in a building that's been marked for fire. It is then that Henry introduces Kai to his life's work... and the murders begin. Kai has never killed before, but he turns into a willing accomplice. Initially, the two men work well together. But as the killing sprees increase in their depravity, it's more than Kai can handle. He wants out, but he's in too deep.—Anonymous

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, covering genres like war, animation, superhero, sci-fi, action, and crime.  There's a mix of historical settings and contemporary ones, with some fantastical elements.
response.list_B_description: List B is less diverse, with a focus on crime, thriller, and horror elements. While there's some variation in subplots (e.g., a strange child appearing, a family dynamic within assassins), the overall tone and themes remain relatively consistent.
response.list_C_description: List C offers a broader range of genres than List B, including sci-fi, action, animation, crime, fantasy, and drama. The settings and time periods are diverse, contributing to a more varied collection.
response.list_D_description: List D presents a blend of sci-fi, animation, action, crime, and superhero themes.  The inclusion of futuristic settings and character types adds to the diversity, although some plots share similar crime-related elements.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a mix of genres, including comedy, historical drama, sci-fi, animation, fantasy, and action. The inclusion of diverse settings and character types enhances the overall diversity.
response.list_F_description: List F is a mixed bag, with genres ranging from drama, sci-fi, comedy, and documentary. The settings and themes are varied, but the overall coherence is less apparent compared to other lists.
response.diversity_summarization: Lists A, C, and E demonstrate the highest levels of diversity, encompassing a wide range of genres, settings, and themes. Lists B and D show moderate diversity, while List F presents a less cohesive but still varied selection of movies.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: A Monkey King is reincarnated in the un human form as Joker, a highwayman oblivious to his original identity and the fact that 500 years earlier, he and his master, the Longevity Monk, were punished and made to stay human.

PLOT: Loosely based on the true story of two young men, David Packouz and Efraim Diveroli, who won a three hundred million dollar contract from the Pentagon to arm America's allies in Afghanistan.

PLOT: A nun, while comforting a convicted killer on death row, empathizes with both the killer and his victim's families.

PLOT: After the apes suffer unimaginable losses, Caesar wrestles with his darker instincts and begins his own mythic quest to avenge his kind.

PLOT: Captain Jack Sparrow is pursued by old rival Captain Salazar and a crew of deadly ghosts who have escaped from the Devil's Triangle. They're determined to kill every pirate at sea...notably Jack.

PLOT: The life of a simple bookshop owner changes when he meets the most famous film star in the world.

PLOT: A cooler-than-ever Bruce Wayne must deal with the usual suspects as they plan to rule Gotham City, while discovering that he has accidentally adopted a teenage orphan who wishes to become his sidekick.

PLOT: Hardened by years in foster care, a teenage girl from Brooklyn's Brownsville neighborhood decides that joining the boys' wrestling team is the only way back to her estranged father.

PLOT: U.K. gay activists work to help miners during their lengthy strike of the National Union of Mineworkers in the summer of 1984.

PLOT: Comedian John Mulaney talks about his milk toast boyish looks, his childhood, his Jewish girlfriend, his gayish charm, his favorite TV shows, Ice-T, a homeless person he met in N.Y., and a prostate exam with Batman.


List B:
PLOT: After the Kingsman's headquarters is destroyed and the world is held hostage, an allied spy organization in the United States is discovered. These two elite secret agencies must band together to defeat a common enemy.

PLOT: Aryan is a Syrian refugee trying to make his way into Hungary from Serbia, along with his father and many other wretched souls. They are all caught, and find themselves in a web of cynicism and corruption.

PLOT: Ben Sanderson, a Hollywood screenwriter who lost everything because of his alcoholism, arrives in Las Vegas to drink himself to death. There, he meets and forms an uneasy friendship and non-interference pact with prostitute Sera.

PLOT: Chronicling the creation of Game of Thrones (2011)'s final season, its most ambitious and complicated one.

PLOT: In this critically acclaimed comedy, an emotionally stunted New Yorker's miserable love life turns around when he meets a deadbeat vampire and becomes a blood-sucker himself.

PLOT: Tom's in love with the cute house sitter next door. He's too shy but his older brother visits and helps Tom with the first date. Things don't go as planned.

PLOT: Two teenagers share a profound, magical connection upon discovering they are swapping bodies. Things manage to become even more complicated when the boy and girl decide to meet in person.

PLOT: Publisher Will Randall becomes a demon wolf and has to fight to keep his job.

PLOT: The story of Barry Seal, an American pilot who became a drug-runner for the CIA in the 1980s in a clandestine operation that would be exposed as the Iran-Contra Affair.

PLOT: Four children, all but one of whom go unnamed, build a snowman which comes to life and threatens their town. Kenny, the only child whose name is given in the film, and who resembles the character called Cartman in the subsequent Spirit of Christmas, The (1995) and "South Park" (1997), is immediately killed by the monster. When the children go to Santa for help, he is revealed to be a monster in disguise, and slaughters another one of the kids. The two survivors approach the baby Jesus, who takes on the evil snowman and wins, saving Christmas.


List C:
PLOT: A physically perfect but innocent man goes in search of his long-lost twin brother, who is short, a womanizer, and small-time crook.

PLOT: A U.S. Air Force officer tries to stop a murderous group of terrorists who are trying to steal two top secret F-117A Stealth Fighters from the cargo hold of a gigantic C-5 Galaxy Transport flying at 30,000 feet over the Pacific Ocean.

PLOT: Pregnant out of wedlock, an educated young woman is pressured by her father into an arranged marriage with a lonely farmer in this drama set during WWII.

PLOT: Todd and Rory are intellectual soul mates. He might be gay. She might not care. A romantic-comedy drama with a twist; a love story without the thrill of copulation.

PLOT: After a global cataclysm, mankind has degraded to a tribal society. In one of the tribes there is a disagreement about what is the best way to survive.

PLOT: A documentary going in depth about the creation and success of the greatest basketball team ever created. The Dream Team. Takes place in the 92 Olympics, where team USA and it's eleven Hall of Famers take gold in the greatest assertion of sports dominance in history.—Kevin Menezes

PLOT: A look at the story behind Marvel Studios and the Marvel Cinematic Universe, featuring interviews and behind-the-scenes footage from all of the Marvel films, the Marvel One-Shots and "Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D."

PLOT: Five high school seniors (3 cute girls) in a VW van on their way to camp by a river in the forest hear about a boy, who once killed his identical twin and parents in the area. They ignore the warning.

PLOT: Professor Marcus du Sautoy demystifies the hidden world of algorithms and reveals where these 2,000-year-old problem solvers came from, how they work, and what they have achieved.

PLOT: A look at the lives of a group of teenagers who ride the same bus route and how their relationships change and evolve on the last day of school.


List D:
PLOT: A woman, Rose, goes in search for her adopted daughter within the confines of a strange, desolate town called Silent Hill.

PLOT: The history of the Final Solution phase of the Nazi Holocaust, particularly with the most infamous of the death camps.

PLOT: The successful writer and professor of architecture Nick Kaminsky returns from New York to Elderstown to visit his biological mother Lillian Anderson Munnsen that is terminal. Nick does not know Lilian since he was adopted when he was a child but he pays the bill for her to stay in a private room in the hospital. While walking on the street, Nick stumbles upon his former college friend Paul Kessler, who is demolishing with his team an old department store building where a murder and a suicide happened many years ago. While talking to Paul, there is an accident and Nick saves his life. Paul invites Nick to go to the birthday party of his wife Jane Kessler. Nick feels attracted by the building that is built in cast iron and asks Paul to visit it. Meanwhile Jane, who is a photographer, decides to take photos of the same building. They get close to each other and Nick learns that Jane was also adopted. Along the following days, Jane and Nick have a love affair and Nick discloses hidden secrets from their past.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

PLOT: An ex-soldier ventures into the Pacific Northwest to uncover the truth behind his fiance's disappearance.

PLOT: Poor girl attends the elite Shin Hwa High and is bullied by the leader of F4 (the four richest boys). He becomes attracted to her; however, she has a crush on his best friend. Whom will she choose?

PLOT: The mysterious disappearance of a young woman leads her boyfriend on a journey for truth and perhaps his own unknown reality in this dark, hypnotic mystery that transcends the limitations of traditional narrative.

PLOT: An archaeologist embarks on the historically important excavation of Sutton Hoo in 1938.

PLOT: In this visual essay style documentary, intimate audio of journalist Michael Azerrad's interviews with Kurt Cobain is played over more recently photographed footage of Cobain's Washington state homes and haunts.

PLOT: A pair of friends embark on a mission to reunite their pal with the woman he was going to marry.

PLOT: The Lonely Island spoofs notorious baseball stars Jose Canseco and Mark McGwire in this visual rap album set in the Bash Brothers' 1980s heyday.


List E:
PLOT: When Diancie a Pokémon said to create diamond travels to find Xerneas to help her make a heart diamond to save her home, Ash, Serena, Clemont and Bonnie help her to be safe on the way from thieves.

PLOT: Kara is a visually stunning and emotional PS3 technology which is here "represented" by a female android who becomes self conscious.

PLOT: A woman with a troubled past sets out to find her missing brother.

PLOT: While visiting Tuscany, Italy, a young wizard accidentally creates an evil version of herself.

PLOT: An unsuspecting university professor is an unwitting accomplice in a foiled Chinese cocaine deal. Wrongly imprisoned, he escapes to take his revenge and prove his innocence.

PLOT: The rats and mice, made intellectually superior in the original Secret of N.I.M.H., return to Thorn Valley to groom their destined leader - young Timmy Brisby.

PLOT: A group of assorted Americans survive a plane crash in a Caribbean island, and discover it is infested with crawling snakes and other venomous beasts. Even worse, terrorists are preparing a full out war on America with a biological weapon.

PLOT: The manager of England's national football unexpectedly succumbs to a heart attack, and suddenly the search is on for a replacement. Most people who seem qualified for the position have the good sense to turn it down, and so the responsibility falls to Mike Bassett, a scruffy and loud-mouthed lout whose claim to football fame is leading a previously undistinguished team to a league championship. Bassett insists that England will win the World Cup under his leadership, but that's before he replaces his star player with a once-gifted footballer who has since developed a drinking problem, and hired a one-time car salesman as his assistant. After stunning losses to Poland and Belgium, Bassett goes from a favorite of both fans and the press to one of the most hated men in England; hoping to whip his team into shape, he subjects them to the high-tech training methods of eccentric Dr. Shoegaarten, which injures more players than it helps. Despite Bassett's ineptitude, England manages to qualify for the World Cup tournament thanks to group opponents Turkey losing their final game, and he flies to Rio with his team in hopes of somehow turning their bad luck around.—Anonymous

PLOT: What makes a woman swipe right for Mr. Wrong? Sofía Vergara and Whitney Cummings star in this fresh, witty look at the science behind our romantic missteps.

PLOT: A violent, guitar-playing, electrically charged boxer faces off against an electronic wizard half-merged with a metallic Buddha.


List F:
PLOT: A documentary that reveals what its subjects do in their respective basements.

PLOT: Tom Grant, a private investigator once hired by Courtney Love, reveals his take on the death of Kurt Cobain.

PLOT: A talented but obese girl, who ghost-sings for a not-so-talented pop star, undergoes extensive plastic surgery to become a slender beauty with a new identity.

PLOT: This is a documentary about the musical artists who performed the songs in the Coen Brothers' film O Brother, Where Art Thou?

PLOT: Christine Daaé, a talented young singer, after being discovered by the known playboy Comte Philippe de Chagny, is sent to the Paris Opera House by her new patron to be classically trained. Unfortunately, her point of contact, the manager, Gérard Carrière, has just been fired. The new managers -- Cholet and his wife, Carlotta -- put Christine to work in the costuming department instead. After a short time there, Christine is overheard singing in the dead of night by the fabled Phantom of the Opera that lurks far below the theatre. The Phantom soon introduces himself as Maestro and decides to take Christine under his wing, training her voice himself. However, all of their plans upend when Comte de Chagny returns to Paris.

PLOT: When a police officer wakes up in a hospital to find out he is in the middle of a zombie apocalypse, he will do anything to find his family, even sacrifice Twitter.

PLOT: When a wealthy elderly man dies and unexpectedly leaves his estate to his new caregiver, she's drawn into a web of deception and murder. If she's going to survive, she'll have to question everyone's motives - even the people she loves.

PLOT: A famous action movie hero and martial arts star comes out of retirement to assume his alter ego as undercover private contractor named Jean-Claude Van Johnson. He must also deal with aging and his handler Vanessa, the ex he still loves.

PLOT: A love story set during a tense encounter between a wagon train of settlers and a renegade Mormon group.

PLOT: Follows a variety of New York characters as they navigate personal relationships and unexpected problems over the course of one day.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes, including fantasy, crime, drama, action, and comedy.  There's diversity in terms of setting (from Gotham to Afghanistan) and character types (apes, pirates, a nun, a comedian). However, some thematic overlaps exist, such as stories about revenge and the search for identity.
response.list_B_description: List B presents a mix of genres, including action, drama, and comedy, but with a noticeable focus on geopolitical themes (refugees, spies, war).  The inclusion of a documentary about Game of Thrones adds an element of meta-commentary.  While there's variety, the overall tone leans towards serious and often dark subject matter.
response.list_C_description: List C offers a blend of genres, from action and comedy to documentaries and dramas.  The themes are diverse, touching upon family relationships, cultural differences, and the creation of popular culture.  However, the list lacks a strong unifying thread, resulting in a somewhat less cohesive sense of diversity compared to other lists.
response.list_D_description: List D showcases a mix of genres, including horror, drama, mystery, and documentary.  The themes are varied, exploring personal relationships, historical events (the Holocaust), and supernatural elements.  The inclusion of documentaries adds a unique layer to the list's diversity.

The themes are varied, including adventure, self-discovery, and survival.  The inclusion of a documentary about football adds an unexpected element. response.list_F_description: List F is a mix of genres, including documentaries, drama, comedy, and action. The list has a good balance of serious and lighter themes, but the overall diversity is not as striking as some other lists.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists demonstrate varying degrees of diversity in terms of genre, theme, and tone. Some lists, like A and D, offer a well-balanced mix of genres and thematic explorations, while others, like C and E, feel less cohesive, despite including diverse elements. response.list_E_description: List E includes genres such as children's fantasy (Charlie and the Chocolate Factory), superhero (Thor), period drama (The Illusionist), adventure (Life of Pi), animated action-comedy (Zootopia), fantasy (The Hobbit), drama (Dead Poets Society), animation (Who Framed Roger Rabbit), science fiction (Source Code), and superhero (Logan). The list is diverse, with a good mix of animation and live-action, and a range of tones and settings.
response.list_F_description: List F features superhero (Iron Man 3), historical drama (The King's Speech), fantasy (Alice Through the Looking Glass), comedy (Evan Almighty), science fiction (Elysium), fantasy (The Chronicles of Narnia), crime (O Brother, Where Art Thou?), martial arts comedy (Kung Fu Panda), action (Taken), and superhero (Big Hero 6). The list is diverse, with a mix of genres and tones, but has a slight emphasis on action and adventure.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a broad representation of genres, including superhero, fantasy, science fiction, action, comedy, drama, horror, animation, and historical fiction.  While some lists lean towards specific themes (e.g., action in List A and D), overall, the collection demonstrates a significant level of diversity in terms of genre, tone, and setting.  The inclusion of animated films and diverse cultural representations further enhances the overall diversity.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a diverse range of genres and themes, including drama, comedy, sports, romance, stand-up comedy, and musical documentaries. response.list_F_description: List F presents a mix of genres, including historical epics, crime thrillers, romantic comedies, and horror.  The settings and cultural backgrounds are diverse, but the thematic focus is somewhat scattered, with a noticeable presence of stories involving relationships and personal struggles.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists exhibit varying degrees of diversity in terms of genre, theme, cultural representation, and setting. Lists A and C show the highest diversity, with a wide range of genres and cultural contexts. Lists B and D are less diverse, with a more focused thematic approach. Fabio and Miá are invited to have dinner with the wealthy Beto Assunção and his gorgeous wife Laura in a VIP restaurant on the ship. Soon Fábio discovers that Beto was Miá's boyfriend and Miá learns that Fábio had a crush on Laura when they were classmates. Meanwhile, cynical chambermaid Suzana Mello and her estranged husband, entertainer Wilson, make a bet that Fábio and Miá will split before the end of the trip, then try to poison their relationship. When the ship arrives in Casablanca, Fábio meets his bothersome childhood friend Cabeça; this affects their honeymoon.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

PLOT: The history of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle franchise.

PLOT: An archaeologist embarks on the historically important excavation of Sutton Hoo in 1938.

List F:

response.list_A_description: List A shows a diverse range of genres and themes, including fantasy (female warrior, samurai, demons), social commentary (cannons, neighbors' conflict), crime (college students, Russian prisoners), adventure (Orca rescue), horror (fiery spirit), animation (Garfield), thriller (religious cult), and music documentary (Keith Richards).  The plots vary significantly in tone and setting.
response.list_B_description: List B focuses more on social and character-driven narratives.  There's a focus on specific social issues (South African farmers, farm workers), character studies (uneventful days of friends, Geethanjali's love triangle), and some fantastical elements (Thor, missing people in apartment building). The overall diversity is moderate, with less genre variety than List A.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a mix of genres, including psychological thriller (Derren Brown's experiment), drama (Janie's illness), comedy (stand-up, roommates), religious fantasy (Jesus and Buddha), romantic comedy, children's adventure (Barbie), crime (gangster Mahindra Dolas), faith-based drama (interview with God), dark comedy (honeymoon cruise), and documentary (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles). The diversity is good, with a balance of serious and lighthearted themes.
response.list_D_description: List D features a blend of adventure (Darien Gap journey), drama (best friends, archaeologist, Grump's life), children's adventure (Barbie's Christmas), horror (reanimating mother), action (cabbie and businessman), romantic comedy (25-year-old virgin), documentary (Michael Moore), and drama (woman in van). The diversity is moderate, with a good mix of genres but some thematic overlap.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a variety of genres and themes, including historical drama (Chevrolet Impala, Assassin), documentary (Alien movies), romance (girl resembling Sadako), crime (barber, two men), monster movie (megalodon, crocosaurus), family drama (Ramkishen's family), horror (Hank's girlfriend), adventure (boys in Venice), and coming-of-age. The diversity is high, with a good balance of genres and tones.
response.list_F_description: List F offers a mix of genres, including science fiction (Puppet Master), thriller (dysfunctional man), action (Colombian revolutionaries), biographical drama (Brontë sisters), crime (suspended cop), gangster film (gangster on the run), action-romance (China to Vietnam), cooking show (spaghetti), horror (murderous thieves), and children's adventure (Leprechaun). The diversity is good, with a range of genres and settings.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists demonstrate varying levels of diversity in terms of genre, theme, and tone. Lists A, C, and E exhibit the highest diversity, encompassing a wide range of genres and narrative styles. Lists B, D, and F show moderate diversity, with a more focused selection of genres and themes. Overall, the collection of lists presents a reasonably diverse representation of cinematic storytelling.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety of genres and themes, including action-adventure (Zorro, Jack Sparrow), sci-fi (sleeping pod), crime (New York thief, gangster), drama (redemption journey, three brothers), fantasy (magic ticket), and thriller (teenager's death).  However, there's a slight overrepresentation of action-adventure and crime subgenres.
response.list_B_description: List B leans heavily towards comedy and fantasy, with some sci-fi and action elements.  The diversity is limited by the concentration on these genres, lacking significant representation of drama or thriller elements.
response.list_C_description: List C offers a broader range of genres than List B, including thriller (premonition, Secret Service), action (James Bond, alien colonization), animation (Wallace and Gromit), sci-fi (Mulholland Drive, reigniting the sun), and family (Polar Express). The inclusion of animation and family films adds to the diversity.
response.list_D_description: List D presents a mix of genres, including thriller (Dissociative Identity Disorder cop, Witness Protection), action (death proof cars, canine star), comedy (Devil Wears Prada), sci-fi (19th-century inventor), survival (mountain climber), and superhero (Spider-Man). The variety is good, but the thriller genre is slightly overrepresented.
response.list_E_description: List E features a blend of fantasy (mermaid, Hellboy), superhero (Avengers), action (Black Cell, Bret Maverick), animation (Gromit), and coming-of-age (Monsters University, d'Artagnan). The inclusion of animation and diverse subgenres within the broader categories enhances the diversity.
response.list_F_description: List F showcases a mix of thriller (traumatized lovers, murdered man), sci-fi (virtual world, Snowpiercer), crime (altar boy, crocodile poacher), fantasy (giant robot, Frozen), and historical drama (Civil War). The range of genres is relatively diverse, although the thriller genre is somewhat prominent.
response.diversity_summarization: Lists A, C, D, E, and F demonstrate a good level of genre diversity, incorporating elements of action, adventure, sci-fi, fantasy, thriller, comedy, drama, and animation. List B shows less diversity, primarily focusing on comedy and fantasy. Overall, the collection of lists presents a reasonably diverse range of movie plots, although some genres are more prevalent than others.

response.diversity_summarization: Overall, the six lists demonstrate a good level of diversity in terms of genres, settings, and themes. PLOT: A young boy named Kubo must locate a magical suit of armour worn by his late father in order to defeat a vengeful spirit from the past.

PLOT: They influence our decisions without us knowing it. They numb our senses without us feeling it. They control our lives without us realizing it. They live.


List D:
PLOT: A musical about what happens when a mom and daughter argue, get their bodies magically switched, and must make it through the day being the other at high school or preparing for the next-day wedding--while hoping to switch back.

PLOT: Based on the absurd but true 1973 bank heist and hostage crisis in Stockholm that was documented in the New Yorker as the origins of the 'Stockholm Syndrome'.
