List A:
PLOT: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, billionaire engineer Tony Stark creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.

PLOT: Living a life marked by violence, neo-Nazi Derek finally goes to prison after killing two black youths. Upon his release, Derek vows to change; he hopes to prevent his brother, Danny, who idolizes Derek, from following in his footsteps.

PLOT: With the help of a German bounty-hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal plantation owner in Mississippi.

PLOT: A young boy wins a tour through the most magnificent chocolate factory in the world, led by the world's most unusual candy maker.

PLOT: When Hiccup and Toothless discover an ice cave that is home to hundreds of new wild dragons and the mysterious Dragon Rider, the two friends find themselves at the center of a battle to protect the peace.

PLOT: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.

PLOT: While Frodo and Sam edge closer to Mordor with the help of the shifty Gollum, the divided fellowship makes a stand against Sauron's new ally, Saruman, and his hordes of Isengard.

PLOT: A linguist works with the military to communicate with alien lifeforms after twelve mysterious spacecraft appear around the world.

PLOT: During World War II, the English mathematical genius Alan Turing tries to crack the German Enigma code with help from fellow mathematicians while attempting to come to terms with his troubled private life.

PLOT: Years after a plague kills most of humanity and transforms the rest into monsters, the sole survivor in New York City struggles valiantly to find a cure.


List B:
PLOT: After being told that their children never existed, a man and woman soon discover there is a much bigger enemy at work.

PLOT: An exceptionally-adept Florida lawyer is offered a job at a high-end New York City law firm with a high-end boss--the biggest opportunity of his career to date.

PLOT: On his sprawling country estate, an aging writer matches wits with the struggling actor who has stolen his wife's heart.

PLOT: Kenichi and his uncle Shunsaku Ban must find the mystery behind robot girl Tima.

PLOT: Political involvement in the Avengers' affairs causes a rift between Captain America and Iron Man.

PLOT: After a Hmong teenager tries to steal his prized 1972 Gran Torino, a disgruntled, prejudiced Korean War veteran seeks to redeem both the boy and himself.

PLOT: A random invitation to a Halloween party leads a man into the hands of a rogue collective intent on murdering him for the sake of their art, sparking a bloodbath of mishap, mayhem and hilarity.

PLOT: When a successful country lawyer captures and attempts to "civilize" the last remaining member of a violent clan that has roamed the Northeast coast for decades, he puts the lives of his family in jeopardy.

PLOT: A young woman is attracted to a man despite her thinking she's seen him kill someone.

PLOT: Friendly but forgetful blue tang Dory begins a search for her long-lost parents and everyone learns a few things about the real meaning of family along the way.


List C:
PLOT: Upon arriving in a small town where she has inherited a rundown mansion, a famous horror hostess battles an evil uncle, and townspeople who want her burned at the stake.

PLOT: This moving story was the swan song of actress Viveca Lindfors, who died unexpectedly soon after completing it. It's a fitting tribute, as the film explores the last performance in the ancestral home of a large family of actors.

PLOT: The mysterious death of an enigmatic young man newly arrived in the suburb of Wetherby releases the long-repressed, dark passions of some of its residents.

PLOT: A police sergeant must rally the cops and prisoners together to protect themselves on New Year's Eve, just as corrupt policeman surround the station with the intent of killing all to keep their deception in the ranks.

PLOT: Based on the events of the brutal Ugandan dictator Idi Amin's regime as seen by his personal physician during the 1970s.

PLOT: The magically long-haired Rapunzel has spent her entire life in a tower, but now that a runaway thief has stumbled upon her, she is about to discover the world for the first time, and who she really is.

PLOT: The Pacific Theatre of World War II, as seen through the eyes of several young Marines.

PLOT: Deadpool sees an opportunity to save the day, but it doesn't go entirely as planned.

PLOT: In 1985 Dallas, electrician and hustler Ron Woodroof works around the system to help AIDS patients get the medication they need after he is diagnosed with the disease.

PLOT: Rich Mr. Dashwood dies, leaving his second wife and her three daughters poor by the rules of inheritance. The two eldest daughters are the title opposites.


List D:
PLOT: It's been three years since we last met Janne and Inari. Since then, they've had a daughter, Lumi. Janne and his friends experience a new adventure, this time on an autumn night. The boys go to a party, but end up chasing Lumi, who has disappeared. Meanwhile, Inari has her own adventure as she enjoys a girls' night out.—AnonymousB

PLOT: Paulette lives alone in a housing project in the Paris suburbs. With her meager pension, she can no longer make ends meet.

PLOT: After the Kingsman's headquarters is destroyed and the world is held hostage, an allied spy organization in the United States is discovered. These two elite secret agencies must band together to defeat a common enemy.

PLOT: Into the world of the Emperor Penguins, who find their soul mates through song, a penguin is born who cannot sing. But he can tap dance something fierce!

PLOT: Four individuals sign up for a psychological research study only to discover that they are now subjects of a brutal, classified government program.

PLOT: Director Tamra Davis pays homage to her friend in this definitive documentary but also delves into Basquiat as an iconoclast. His dense, bebop-influenced neoexpressionist work emerged while minimalist, conceptual art was the fad; as a successful black artist, he was constantly confronted by racism and misconceptions. Much can be gleaned from insider interviews and archival footage, but it is Basquiat's own words and work that powerfully convey the mystique and allure of both the artist and the man.—Sundance Film Festival

PLOT: A moody, jaded police detective, while investigating a drug ring, falls for a mysterious woman and is drawn into a shady and dangerous scheme.

PLOT: A retiring police detective pledges to catch the killer of a young child.

PLOT: The alumni cast of a space opera television series have to play their roles as the real thing when an alien race needs their help. However, they also have to defend both Earth and the alien race from a reptilian warlord.

PLOT: A Japanese gangster is exiled to Los Angeles where his brother lives with a small but respectable multi-racial gang, who he inspires to expand their influence.


List E:
PLOT: Four Mexican high school students form a robotics club. With no experience, 800 bucks, used car parts and a dream, this rag tag team goes up against the country's reigning robotics champion, MIT.

PLOT: A thirteen-year-old girl's relationship with her mother is put to the test as she discovers drugs, sex, and petty crime in the company of her cool but troubled best friend.

PLOT: Hoping to walk away with a massive fortune, a trio of thieves break into the house of a blind man who isn't as helpless as he seems.

PLOT: A toon-hating detective is a cartoon rabbit's only hope to prove his innocence when he is accused of murder.

PLOT: The crew of the USS Enterprise explores the furthest reaches of uncharted space, where they encounter a new ruthless enemy, who puts them, and everything the Federation stands for, to the test.

PLOT: Rick and Fred, two husbands who are having difficulty in their marriages, are given a Hall Pass by their wives: for one week, they can do whatever they want.

PLOT: A group of high-end professional thieves start to feel the heat from the LAPD when they unknowingly leave a clue at their latest heist.

PLOT: An inventive crime thriller told backwards reversing day by day through a week following a local sheriff's quest to unlock the mystery of three small-town criminals and a bank heist gone wrong.

PLOT: France, 1625: Young d'Artagnan heads to Paris to join the Musketeers but the evil cardinal has disbanded them - save 3. He meets the 3, Athos, Porthos and Aramis, and joins them on their quest to save the king and country.

PLOT: All the kids in a town over night become feverish and have convulsions. The next day they start to become evil, change their names for those of kids killed long ago, and then start killing any adult in their path, in vicious and mysterious forms. A young woman who has just returned to town tries to find out what is happening, while trying to protect her transformed young sister. However, the kids are starting to revive their leader...—Parca Mortem <icy_shadow@rocketmail.com>


List F:
PLOT: One couple's story as they try to reclaim the life and love they once knew and pick up the pieces of a past that may be too far gone.

PLOT: Filmmaker Davis Guggenheim follows Al Gore on the lecture circuit, as the former presidential candidate campaigns to raise public awareness of the dangers of global warming and calls for immediate action to curb its destructive effects on the environment.

PLOT: A journalist recounts her wartime coverage in Afghanistan.

PLOT: The lives of several individuals intertwine as they go about their lives in their own unique ways, engaging in acts which society as a whole might find disturbing in a desperate search for human connection.

PLOT: A widower who realized his only connection to his family was through his wife sets off on an impromptu road trip to reunite with each of his grown children.

PLOT: Lila wants to emulate the sexual exploits of her more experienced best friend. She fixates on a tough older guy who will "sleep with anyone" and tries to insert herself into his world, putting herself in a dangerously vulnerable situation.

PLOT: To stall a witch plotting to eat him, a boy reads her horror tales dealing with a collegian's resurrection of a mummy, a murderous cat, and an artist's pact with a gargoyle.

PLOT: An immigrant single mother disenfranchised by her regular life decides to take a chance working at a Japanese restaurant and realises her dreams to become a sushi chef to provide a better future to her family.

PLOT: A group of college students break into an abandoned convent and become possessed by demonic spirits.

PLOT: A group of Catholic school friends, after being caught drawing an obscene comic book, plan a heist that will outdo their previous prank and make them local legends.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes, including superhero adventures, crime dramas, historical fiction, fantasy, science fiction, and dystopian thrillers.  There's a mix of settings and time periods, from Afghanistan to Mississippi to Mordor. The plots vary significantly in tone, from action-packed to introspective.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a more diverse range of genres than List A, including science fiction, legal drama, romantic comedy, mystery, superhero films, and action-comedies.  The settings are varied, from Florida to New York City to the suburbs.  The plots are less focused on grand adventures and more on interpersonal relationships and character development.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a mix of horror, drama, thriller, and historical fiction.  The settings are varied, from small towns to war zones to historical periods.  The plots explore themes of evil, family, war, and personal struggles.
response.list_D_description: List D includes a mix of genres, including family drama, social realism, action, animation, science fiction, documentary, crime, and gangster films. The settings are diverse, ranging from suburban Finland to Los Angeles. The plots explore themes of family, social issues, crime, and espionage.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a variety of genres, including coming-of-age stories, crime thrillers, science fiction, animation, comedy, and horror. The settings range from Mexico to space. The plots explore themes of friendship, family, crime, and adventure.
response.list_F_description: List F presents a diverse range of genres, including romance, documentaries, war journalism, dark comedy, family drama, coming-of-age stories, fantasy, and crime. The settings are varied, from personal relationships to Afghanistan to a Japanese restaurant. The plots explore themes of love, loss, environmentalism, and personal growth.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there is a significant diversity of genres, themes, settings, and tones.  While some lists lean towards specific genres (e.g., List C's horror elements), the overall collection demonstrates a wide range of cinematic storytelling.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: As Harry Potter begins his sixth year at Hogwarts, he discovers an old book marked as "the property of the Half-Blood Prince" and begins to learn more about Lord Voldemort's dark past.

PLOT: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.

PLOT: Harry, Ron, and Hermione search for Voldemort's remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.

PLOT: Barely 21 yet, Frank is a skilled forger who has passed as a doctor, lawyer and pilot. FBI agent Carl becomes obsessed with tracking down the con man, who only revels in the pursuit.

PLOT: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

PLOT: Will Hunting, a janitor at M.I.T., has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.

PLOT: Blacksmith Will Turner teams up with eccentric pirate "Captain" Jack Sparrow to save his love, the governor's daughter, from Jack's former pirate allies, who are now undead.

PLOT: Jeff "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire of the same name, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.

PLOT: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are going to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.

PLOT: A paraplegic Marine dispatched to the moon Pandora on a unique mission becomes torn between following his orders and protecting the world he feels is his home.


List B:
PLOT: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.

PLOT: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

PLOT: Captain Barbossa, Will Turner and Elizabeth Swann must sail off the edge of the map, navigate treachery and betrayal, find Jack Sparrow, and make their final alliances for one last decisive battle.

PLOT: When Earth becomes uninhabitable in the future, a farmer and ex-NASA pilot, Joseph Cooper, is tasked to pilot a spacecraft, along with a team of researchers, to find a new planet for humans.

PLOT: A soldier wakes up in someone else's body and discovers he's part of an experimental government program to find the bomber of a commuter train within 8 minutes.

PLOT: A clean-cut high school student relies on the school's rumor mill to advance her social and financial standing.

PLOT: An insurance salesman discovers his whole life is actually a reality TV show.

PLOT: Detective Sherlock Holmes is on the trail of criminal mastermind Professor Moriarty, who is carrying out a string of random crimes across Europe.

PLOT: A Mumbai teenager reflects on his life after being accused of cheating on the Indian version of "Who Wants to be a Millionaire?"

PLOT: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the shocking truth--the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence.


List C:
PLOT: Jack Sparrow races to recover the heart of Davy Jones to avoid enslaving his soul to Jones' service, as other friends and foes seek the heart for their own agenda as well.

PLOT: In the distant future, a small waste-collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.

PLOT: When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories for ever.

PLOT: With the help of a German bounty-hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal plantation owner in Mississippi.

PLOT: With the world now aware of his identity as Iron Man, Tony Stark must contend with both his declining health and a vengeful mad man with ties to his father's legacy.

PLOT: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soap maker form an underground fight club that evolves into much more.

PLOT: The history of the United States from the 1950s to the '70s unfolds from the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75, who yearns to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart.

PLOT: In a magically realistic version of Toronto, a young man must defeat his new girlfriend's seven evil exes one by one in order to win her heart.

PLOT: A mean lord exiles fairytale creatures to the swamp of a grumpy ogre, who must go on a quest and rescue a princess for the lord in order to get his land back.

PLOT: A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring.


List D:
PLOT: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

PLOT: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

PLOT: A man with short-term memory loss attempts to track down his wife's murderer.

PLOT: A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a highly advanced humanoid A.I.

PLOT: A tale set on death row in a Southern jail, where gentle giant John possesses the mysterious power to heal people's ailments. When the lead guard, Paul, recognizes John's gift, he tries to help stave off the condemned man's execution.

PLOT: Charlie, a 15-year-old introvert, enters high school and is nervous about his new life. When he befriends his seniors, he learns to cope with his friend's suicide and his tumultuous past.

PLOT: Marty McFly, a 17-year-old high school student, is accidentally sent 30 years into the past in a time-traveling DeLorean invented by his close friend, the maverick scientist Doc Brown.

PLOT: In the 1960s, superpowered humans Charles Xavier and Erik Lensherr work together to find others like them, but Erik's vengeful pursuit of an ambitious mutant who ruined his life causes a schism to divide them.

PLOT: Captain Jack Sparrow is pursued by old rival Captain Salazar and a crew of deadly ghosts who have escaped from the Devil's Triangle. They're determined to kill every pirate at sea...notably Jack.

PLOT: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father, the ambitious celestial being Ego.


List E:
PLOT: Imprisoned on the planet Sakaar, Thor must race against time to return to Asgard and stop Ragnarök, the destruction of his world, at the hands of the powerful and ruthless villain Hela.

PLOT: In a near future, a lonely writer develops an unlikely relationship with an operating system designed to meet his every need.

PLOT: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

PLOT: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.

PLOT: With their warning about Lord Voldemort's return scoffed at, Harry and Dumbledore are targeted by the Wizard authorities as an authoritarian bureaucrat slowly seizes power at Hogwarts.

PLOT: Freedom fighters Neo, Trinity and Morpheus continue to lead the revolt against the Machine Army, unleashing their arsenal of extraordinary skills and weaponry against the systematic forces of repression and exploitation.

PLOT: After young Riley is uprooted from her Midwest life and moved to San Francisco, her emotions - Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust, and Sadness - conflict on how best to navigate a new city, house, and school.

PLOT: A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.

PLOT: A group of intergalactic criminals must pull together to stop a fanatical warrior with plans to purge the universe.

PLOT: Dr. Ellie Arroway, after years of searching, finds conclusive radio proof of extraterrestrial intelligence, sending plans for a mysterious machine.


List F:
PLOT: Harry Potter finds himself competing in a hazardous tournament between rival schools of magic, but he is distracted by recurring nightmares.

PLOT: The Avengers and their allies must be willing to sacrifice all in an attempt to defeat the powerful Thanos before his blitz of devastation and ruin puts an end to the universe.

PLOT: Peter Parker balances his life as an ordinary high school student in Queens with his superhero alter-ego Spider-Man, and finds himself on the trail of a new menace prowling the skies of New York City.

PLOT: Malcolm Crowe, a child psychologist, starts treating a young boy, Cole, who encounters dead people and convinces him to help them. In turn, Cole helps Malcolm reconcile with his estranged wife.

PLOT: The uneventful, aimless lives of a London electronics salesman and his layabout roommate are disrupted by the zombie apocalypse.

PLOT: At the age of 21, Tim discovers he can travel in time and change what happens and has happened in his own life. His decision to make his world a better place by getting a girlfriend turns out not to be as easy as you might think.

PLOT: A pragmatic U.S. Marine observes the dehumanizing effects the Vietnam War has on his fellow recruits from their brutal boot camp training to the bloody street fighting in Hue.

PLOT: Years after a plague kills most of humanity and transforms the rest into monsters, the sole survivor in New York City struggles valiantly to find a cure.

PLOT: Harry Potter, Ron and Hermione return to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for their third year of study, where they delve into the mystery surrounding an escaped prisoner who poses a dangerous threat to the young wizard.

PLOT: Tells the story of Benjamin Button, a man who starts aging backwards with consequences.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety of genres and themes, including fantasy, sci-fi, crime, superhero, drama, and action-adventure.  However, there's a noticeable concentration on male protagonists and action-oriented plots.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a broader range of historical settings and genres than List A, encompassing historical fiction (WWII), animation, sci-fi, action, thriller, and coming-of-age stories. The inclusion of diverse protagonists is also more apparent.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a mix of genres including fantasy, sci-fi, drama, action, and superhero films.  The settings and themes are diverse, ranging from historical dramas to futuristic adventures. However, the plots often revolve around male-centric narratives.
response.list_D_description: List D features a blend of crime, war, thriller, sci-fi, drama, and coming-of-age stories. The inclusion of diverse characters and settings is more balanced compared to previous lists, although action-oriented plots remain prominent.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a variety of genres, including fantasy, sci-fi, historical drama, and animation.  The representation of diverse characters and settings is more balanced than in previous lists, with a good mix of male and female-led narratives.
response.list_F_description: List F offers a mix of fantasy, superhero, drama, thriller, horror, and sci-fi genres.  The representation of diverse characters and settings is relatively balanced, although the plots tend to lean towards action and adventure.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists demonstrate varying degrees of diversity in terms of genre, setting, and representation. While some lists show a stronger focus on action and male-centric narratives, others offer a more balanced representation of diverse characters, themes, and historical periods. Overall, there's a noticeable improvement in diversity across the lists, with later lists showing a more conscious effort to include diverse perspectives.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, covering genres like sci-fi, action, fantasy, and war, but with a concentration on action-adventure plots.  There's a mix of futuristic and historical settings, but character archetypes are somewhat repetitive (e.g., multiple protagonists fighting against powerful antagonists).
response.list_B_description: List B offers a broader range of genres than List A, including animation, crime, war, and science fiction. The plots are diverse in terms of setting and tone, ranging from lighthearted adventures to serious dramas. However, there's a noticeable lack of fantasy elements.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a mix of historical dramas, crime thrillers, and fantasy, with a focus on character-driven narratives. The historical settings vary, and the plots explore themes of war, vengeance, and personal relationships. The inclusion of fantasy elements adds to the diversity, but the overall tone is quite serious.
response.list_D_description: List D is a diverse list, encompassing genres such as dark comedy, superhero, fantasy, drama, and crime. The plots explore various themes, including family relationships, social issues, and existential questions. The tone varies significantly, from humorous to serious and intense.
response.list_E_description: List E demonstrates a good balance of genres, including sci-fi, action, drama, and fantasy. The plots are diverse in terms of setting and tone, ranging from lighthearted comedies to intense action sequences. The inclusion of a reality TV show concept adds an unusual element to the mix.
response.list_F_description: List F showcases a blend of thriller, action, fantasy, and sci-fi genres. The plots explore themes of mental illness, war, and self-discovery. The inclusion of a time-loop element adds an interesting twist, but the overall tone is quite serious and suspenseful.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists exhibit varying degrees of diversity in terms of genre, setting, and thematic elements. Some lists focus on specific genres (e.g., action-adventure), while others offer a broader range.  Overall, there's a good representation of different genres and themes across all lists, although some lists show more internal consistency in tone and style than others.

PLOT: Teddy Daniels and Chuck Aule, two US marshals, are sent to an asylum on a remote island in order to investigate the disappearance of a patient, where Teddy uncovers a shocking truth about the place.

PLOT: A prince cursed to spend his days as a hideous monster sets out to regain his humanity by earning a young woman's love.

PLOT: A mysterious pill that enables the user to access 100% of his brain's abilities transforms a struggling writer into a financial wizard, but it also puts him in a new world with many dangers.

PLOT: A historian races to find the legendary Templar Treasure before a team of mercenaries.


List C:

response.list_A_description: List A shows a mix of genres, including post-apocalyptic thriller, dramedy, superhero, survival, crime, and romantic comedy.  There's a blend of serious and lighthearted themes, and the settings vary widely.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a variety of genres: animation, action, fantasy, thriller, romance, and adventure. While there's a mix, the plots lean towards adventure and fantasy, with a few exceptions.

response.diversity_summarization: Lists A through F all demonstrate a degree of genre diversity, with a mix of action, adventure, comedy, drama, fantasy, horror, romance, science fiction, and thriller elements. evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: The true story of Homer Hickam, a coal miner's son who was inspired by the first Sputnik launch to take up rocketry against his father's wishes.

PLOT: Surreal events occur when a hapless country doctor visits an ill boy one cold night.

PLOT: Jolly is a clumsy lawyer who is faced with representing the most critical court case of his career.

PLOT: Titanica reveals the clearest motion pictures ever captured of the Titanic. Witness startling images of the long-lost ruin contrasted with never-before-seen 1912 archival photos showing her in all her splendor. Feel the passion of the explorers, each obsessed with a different aspect of the expedition.—Anonymous

PLOT: Sonic the Hedgehog and his sidekicks Tails and Knuckles the Echidna are determined to thwart a plan that would turn their Land of the Sky into the equivalent of The Land of Darkness, which lurks beneath the surface (and is obviously the former planet Earth). So they plow through to the center of the planet and the ancient city of Robotropolis (the former New York City?) to do righteous battle. The big question of the day is whether the usually evil Dr. Robotnik is telling the truth for once or sending the good guys into a trap.—Anthony Pereyra {hypersonic91@yahoo.com}

PLOT: An unsuspecting university professor is an unwitting accomplice in a foiled Chinese cocaine deal. Wrongly imprisoned, he escapes to take his revenge and prove his innocence.

PLOT: When a container washes ashore the residents of a sleepy cul-de-sac are plunged into violence, terror and paranoia. Ring fenced by the military a single mother must overcome all the odds to save her daughter.

PLOT: In the near future, when communications go offline at a remote nuclear power plant isolated in the desert, a young safety inspector, Abby Dixon, is forced to fly out to bring them back online. Once inside the facility, mysterious clues and strange behaviors cause Abby to have doubts about the sanity, and perhaps identities, of the two employees onsite.

PLOT: He is a small, short-sighted boy who politically incorrectly terrorizes his environment in an old-fashioned, disrespectful and sometimes vulgar manner.

PLOT: After a young fashion designer runs afoul of her corrupt stepmother and stepsisters, she dons a disguise to help save the family business for her father.


List B:
PLOT: Individually, Sanjay and Karina don't earn enough to be able to buy a home, so they enter into a marriage of convenience.

PLOT: Hari riffs on celebrity encounters, identity politics, and why firefighters are better than cops.

PLOT: A film documentary about the fate of the young actors of the award winning film City of God by Fernando Meirelles and Katia Lund. It shows how their lives unfolded after the film's worldwide success.

PLOT: Wendy and her friends avoid the heartless world of random hookups and friends-with-benefits by spending all their time together. When she meets Sean, Wendy is torn between her genuine affection and desire for him and her commitment to her friends, especially her best friend Billie: and Billie isn't interested in losing her friends.

PLOT: Two ice skaters (Christy Carlson Romano, Ross Thomas) develop a love-hate relationship while dreaming of Olympic glory.

PLOT: In 1989, physicist Bob Lazar broke the story of Area 51 and the US government's work on alien spacecrafts. He blew the whistle, shocked the world, then went silent - until now.

PLOT: A violent chain of events ensues as a jailed criminal arranges to buy a car from a shady car dealer, unaware that his partner in freedom has squandered most of the money from their last bank robbery on horse race betting.

PLOT: Best friends Laura and Tyler fellow deviants, enablers and co-dependents. Laura is getting married and their booze and drug-fuelled Thelma and Louise life is in jeopardy and finds herself suspended between the two unable to give either up.

PLOT: In the 19th century Pyrénées, a stagecoach stops for the night at an isolated inn run by a couple of murderous thieves. The husband wants to kill and rob them all, but one of them is a priest whom the wife refuses to see harmed.

PLOT: Love drives two young lovers from Medellin, Colombia to seek fortune in New York City, only to find a harsh reality that will put to test their true love for one another.


List C:
PLOT: A modern retelling of Snow White set against students in their freshman year of college in the greek system.

PLOT: On his release from a prison sentence for crimes of which he was innocent, a shamed former cop connects a murder case to a government conspiracy involving rogue agents from a top spy agency.

PLOT: A fear-obsessed freelance cameraman (Shinya Tsukamoto) investigates an urban legend involving mysterious spirits that haunt the subways of Tokyo.

PLOT: Tom Noonan's dark comedy features a husband-and-wife team of psychotherapists who run a New-Age therapy group out in the wilderness. Late one night, Jack and Rita are visited by one of their patients, Cosmo, and his wife, Arlie. Cosmo's wife has felt "left out," since her husband spends so much time with the therapists and confides all of their secrets to them. Arlie has insisted on meeting them--the evening begins awkwardly, then painfully grinds on, as various tensions and power struggles emerge between and among the two couples.—Tad Dibbern <DIBBERN_D@a1.mscf.upenn.edu>

PLOT: Hiccup and Toothless reunite to remind both their kinds of the inseparable bond between vikings and dragons.

PLOT: A documentary series on the wildlife found on Earth. Each episode covers a different habitat: deserts, mountains, deep oceans, shallow seas, forests, caves, polar regions, fresh water, plains and jungles. Narrated by David Attenborough.

PLOT: Janey is new in town and soon meets Lynne, who shares her passion for dancing in general and "Dance TV" in particular.

PLOT: George is the scapegoat of his classmates. One day he cracks and shoots them. His best and only friend Blaise is accused in his place and sentenced to 7 years in a psychiatric hospital. At the day of his release, Blaise realizes he only has one family: his best friend George. But he does not want to hear about his childhood friend, as he tries to integrate with the "Chivers" a gang whose members wear red jackets and boots, drink milk, drive sport trucks and play an incomprehensible and violent game that mixes cricket and mental arithmetic.

PLOT: An impoverished preacher who brings hope to the Miami projects is offered cash to save his family from eviction. He has no idea his sponsor works for the FBI who plan to turn him into a criminal by fueling his madcap revolutionary dreams.

PLOT: A successful entrepreneur accused of murder and a witness preparation expert have less than three hours to come up with an impregnable defense.


List D:
PLOT: A family in 1630s New England is torn apart by the forces of witchcraft, black magic and possession.

She lives with her father and brother (Bleibtreu) in a small village in Central Asia. One night she is seduced by an actor from a traveling troupe, who poses as a friend of Tom Cruise, and makes her pregnant. She tries to abort, but her father and brother become determined to find the seducer, setting in motion a cascade of comic adventures.—Steve Shelokhonov

PLOT: In Jerusalem, a bullied teen befriends his grandfather and long lost uncle and soon they decide to solve their financial problems by robbing a bank.

List E:

PLOT: A gang of teenage boys stalks the streets of Naples armed with hand guns and AK-47s to do their mob bosses' bidding.

PLOT: Captain Jack Sparrow is pursued by old rival Captain Salazar and a crew of deadly ghosts who have escaped from the Devil's Triangle. They're determined to kill every pirate at sea...notably Jack.

PLOT: A comic caper about Happy Singh, a Punjabi villager who goes through a series of misadventures and eventually becomes the King of the Australian underworld.

PLOT: Killer slugs on the rampage in a rural community.

PLOT: In this sci-fi tinged story of young love and teenage turmoil, a mysterious glowing ball offers Norimichi a second chance at securing his dream date.

PLOT: Based on real events, this crime action film depicts a Seoul detective's attempts to keep peace while two Chinese-Korean gangs battle over turf in the neighborhood.

PLOT: A farmer's wife is seduced into running away from her stolid older husband by a city slicker, who enslaves her in a brothel.

PLOT: The rap group NWA emerges from the mean streets of Compton in Los Angeles, California, in the mid-1980s and revolutionizes Hip Hop culture with their music and tales about life in the hood.


List F:
PLOT: 

PLOT: Feature documentary about legendary oceanographer, marine biologist, environmentalist, and National Geographic Explorer-in-Residence Sylvia Earle and her campaign to create a global network of protected marine sanctuaries.

PLOT: An offbeat romantic comedy about a decent guy, Ray Tuckby, with a dead-end life in the dead-end town of Trona, CA. After encouragement from a stranger whom he happens upon, Ray begins to dream again. He sheds the parasites in his life, musters the nerve to pursue his childhood love, and finally takes back his community by toppling the local teenage Meth-baron.

PLOT: Street Fighter: Assassin's Fist takes us back to the formative years of the iconic characters, Ryu and Ken, as they live a traditional warrior's life in the secluded mountain wilderness of Japan.

PLOT: A drama centered on the love affair between two men on opposite sides of the Mid-East conflict: Palestinian student Nimer and Roy, an Israeli lawyer.

PLOT: A day in the life of two best friends, a drug dealer, and a store manager collide at a hip-hop concert in the Inland Empire.

PLOT: Three part documentary series that tells the story of the birth of the personal computer, with the candid recollections of PC pioneers, like Steve Wozniak, Steve Jobs and Bill Gates.

PLOT: A '40s period piece which revolves around an American expat who returns to Shanghai in the months before Pearl Harbor due to the death of his friend.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes, including biographical drama, fantasy, legal drama, documentary, science fiction, action, thriller, and comedy.  There's a mix of serious and lighthearted plots, and the settings vary widely.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a blend of romantic comedies, documentaries, crime dramas, and sports movies. The settings are diverse, spanning different countries and time periods. While there's some thematic overlap, the individual stories are distinct.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a mix of genres, including modern retellings of fairy tales, crime thrillers, horror, animation, nature documentaries, and romantic comedies. The settings and themes are varied, showcasing a decent level of diversity.
response.list_D_description: List D includes historical dramas, comedies, crime thrillers, sports movies, biographical pieces, and war dramas. The time periods and settings are diverse, ranging from 17th-century New England to 20th-century Europe. The plots offer a good mix of serious and lighter themes.
response.list_E_description: List E features a variety of genres, including adventure, drama, crime, fantasy, comedy, horror, science fiction, and biographical pieces. The settings and themes are diverse, with stories set in different countries and time periods. The plots range from serious to lighthearted.
response.list_F_description: List F contains documentaries, romantic comedies, martial arts films, dramas, and period pieces. The settings and themes are varied, showcasing a decent level of diversity, although there's a slight concentration on biographical and historical themes.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a considerable variety of genres, themes, settings, and time periods represented. While some lists show a stronger concentration in certain genres than others, the overall collection demonstrates a good level of diversity in cinematic storytelling.

evaluations.prompt:

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes, including action, thriller, sci-fi, superhero, comedy, drama, and war.  There's a mix of character-driven stories and plot-driven narratives, with varying settings and time periods. The diversity is quite high.

response.list_F_description: List F offers a variety of genres, including drama, fantasy, animation, romance, sports, sci-fi, and dark comedy. The themes are diverse, but there's a noticeable emphasis on character development and personal journeys. The diversity is moderate to high.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a good representation of various genres, including action, thriller, sci-fi, fantasy, comedy, drama, romance, horror, and animation. There's a good balance between plot-driven and character-driven narratives, with diverse settings and time periods.

PLOT: Mammoth series, five years in the making, taking a look at the rich tapestry of life in the world's oceans.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, touching upon action (Dark Knight, Troy), adventure (Life of Pi), dystopian fiction (Hunger Games), sports (Cars), drama (Trainspotting), superhero origin story (Wolverine), comedy (Austin Powers), animation (How to Train Your Dragon), and science fiction (Robot Boy).  However, the genres are somewhat broadly defined and there's a lack of diversity in terms of cultural representation and thematic depth.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a more diverse range of genres and tones. It includes comedy (To Wong Foo, Family Guy), science fiction (Another Earth), action (Rambo), horror-comedy (Zomcon), thriller (The Changeling), horror (Mirrors), superhero (Sky High), drama (The Nanny), and mystery (The Girl in the Simulation). The inclusion of LGBTQ+ themes and animated content adds to the diversity.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a mix of biographical (Memoirs of a Geisha), horror (Midsommar), action (Multiverse), documentary (Inside Job), teen drama (Bring It On), documentary (Free Solo), fantasy (King Arthur), crime (The Green Mile), horror (The Conjuring), and romance (The Danish Girl). While the genres are varied, the cultural representation is somewhat limited, primarily focusing on Western and Japanese contexts.
response.list_D_description: List A shows a decent variety, touching upon drama (Scenes from a Marriage), nature documentary (Blue Planet II), thriller (The Boy), thriller (The Pianist), comedy (Malia), crime (The Killer), biographical (Project X), teen drama (Jawbreaker), biographical (Vincent van Gogh), and comedy (The Guru). The genres are somewhat broadly defined and there's a lack of diversity in terms of cultural representation and thematic depth.
response.list_E_description: List E demonstrates a good mix of genres, including drama (The Nun), animated biographical (Loving Vincent), musical (Havana Summer), coming-of-age (The Music of Chance), drama (Trainspotting 2), action (National Guard), coming-of-age (The Kids Are All Right), sports (McFarland, USA), thriller (The Poet), and thriller (Handmaiden).  The settings and cultural backgrounds are more varied than in some other lists.
response.list_F_description: List F showcases a blend of genres such as drama (The Goodbye Girl), animation (Isle of Dogs), action (The Man from U.N.C.L.E.), romance (Spanish Affair), horror (The Babadook), superhero (Incredibles 2), fantasy (The Brothers Grimm), historical drama (The Warlord), action (The Last Flight), and action (Kingsman: The Secret Service). The list offers a decent variety in terms of genre and tone, but the cultural representation could be more expansive.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists exhibit varying degrees of diversity. Lists B and E stand out with a wider range of genres, tones, and cultural representations. Lists A, C, and D show some diversity but are limited in their thematic exploration and cultural scope. List F presents a decent variety of genres but could benefit from more diverse cultural representation. Overall, there's a noticeable imbalance in the representation of different cultures and themes across the lists.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: Carter and Lee head to Hong Kong for a vacation, but become embroiled in a counterfeit money scam.

PLOT: A young girl is plucked from small-town obscurity and thrust into the spotlight of the glamorous world of super-models.

PLOT: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.

PLOT: With his signature one-liners and drawings, Demetri Martin muses on doughnut holes, dogs, sports bars, the alphabet's most aggressive letters and more.

PLOT: A team of archaeologists discover an ancient mummy, unleashing a deadly curse from its eternal tomb.

PLOT: The crew of the USS Enterprise explores the furthest reaches of uncharted space, where they encounter a new ruthless enemy, who puts them, and everything the Federation stands for, to the test.

PLOT: Several teenage girls at a Purity Retreat participate in a secret ritual, and they start to see a supernatural entity. The girls need to focus on the demon they have unleashed, as well as their fathers' expectations.

PLOT: There is more to this story than this review lets on. It reflects all different facets of society over one driver's shift. As he starts out, he seems cold and ignorant, but his character develops as different Chicago riders come and go. His character shows through when he tells a woman the truth about one of the guys he has in his cab. One highlight is the amount of cameos by well-known faces who seem to be doing this film for the craic (fun, "kicks"). The cab driver reacts well to the madness surrounding him, and by the end of the shift the viewer might share his weariness. This low-budget film deals with crackheads, stoners, posh randy lawyers, irate Pakistanis, and the high and lows of the working day.—Michael A Hunter <thewaas@yahoo.co.uk>

PLOT: In the 1970s, Om, an aspiring actor, is murdered, but is immediately reincarnated into the present day. He attempts to discover the mystery of his demise and find Shanti, the love of his previous life.

PLOT: Ed and Lorraine Warren travel to North London to help a single mother raising four children alone in a house plagued by a supernatural spirit.


List B:
PLOT: An F.B.I. Agent must go undercover in the Miss United States beauty pageant to prevent a group from bombing the event.

PLOT: Recep Ivedik coaches the children football team in his neighborhood. For the training he uses the only free piece of land as football field on which he used to play football as a child. Recep notices sadly that this piece of land was sold to a businessman.

PLOT: Hannah and Tahir fall in love while homeless on the streets of New York. Shelter explores how they got there, and as we learn about their pasts we realize they need each other to build a future.

PLOT: Kung Lao has triumphed in the Mortal Kombat tournament, defeating Shang Tsung and saving Earth Realm. Now, he must train a new generation of warriors for the next tournament.

PLOT: A quirky love story revolving around the unexpected wedding and unconventional married life of a 26-year-old widow and her late husband's brother, a handsome 30-year-old cardiologist.

PLOT: A drama centered on the love affair between two men on opposite sides of the Mid-East conflict: Palestinian student Nimer and Roy, an Israeli lawyer.

PLOT: After Kwon, an exceptional gamer, is wrongly framed for murder, he along with his allies decides to find the real culprit and prove his innocence.

PLOT: Paranormal investigator Zak Bagans documents the most authenticated case of possession in American history.

PLOT: Investigative documentary probing the background of the Finnish doping scandal of Lahti 2001 FIS Nordic world ski championship and the sports culture that enabled it.

PLOT: A former gangster fresh out of prison wants to change his life for the better and must save his 10 year old son who has already chosen a gang life.


List C:
PLOT: Haunted houses for Halloween have spawned a growing subculture of extreme "full contact" terror simulations. But how far is too far?

PLOT: In 2100, when humanity has abandoned the Earth, a colony of extravagant creatures still thrives in the deepest abyss of the ocean. Deep, an adventurous "dumbo" octopus and the last one of his kind lives there with his two unconditional friends: Evo, a nerdy and clumsy angler fish, and Alice, a neurotic deep-sea shrimp. When an accident destroys their home, the guardian of the abyss, The Kraken, will send Deep and his friends on a perilous journey to find a new home. In their mission, they will be joined by Maura -a voracious moray eel- and together they will travel to amazing places like the submerged city of New York, the Titanic or the Arctic, facing formidable enemies and hilarious situations. Will they be able to bring the oceans back to their former glory?—corrected

PLOT: Marek and her company must go on a journey and prevent Szorlok from obtaining all the shards of the Darkspore, or all will be lost.

PLOT: Luffy and his pirates can't wait to board the glittering Sin City ship known as Gran Tesoro, but they soon find themselves in way over their heads.

PLOT: Jessica Darling's older sister gives her the "IT List," a checklist on how to navigate the middle school popularity hierarchy. The instructions appear simple enough to follow, but like life, nothing is as easy as it seems.

PLOT: A suicidal man hires a demented killer to assist him in suicide, but for some reason, miraculously survives each attempt on his life.

PLOT: The life of Mikhail Gorbachev, the eighth and final President of the Soviet Union in chronological order.

PLOT: A look at iconic pop artist Taylor Swift during a transformational time in her life as she embraces her role as a singer/songwriter and harnesses the full power of her voice.

PLOT: Twenty-four hours in the tentative relationship of two young San Franciscans also dealing with the conundrum of being a minority in a rapidly gentrifying city.

PLOT: Grandpa Ward gives a horse he found to his grandchildren, who keep it in their tower-block flat in Dublin. The horse is stolen from them, and the two young boys set out to find it and flee on it.


List D:
PLOT: A mockumentary following an ambitious TV network executive trying to produce a controversial reality show where contestants play Russian Roulette.

PLOT: Four astronauts working at a lunar base suffer a meteor strike that brings an infection that leads to paranoia, fear and death.

PLOT: Cash performs a concert for the inmates of California's Folsom Prison, and the show was recorded for a live album.

PLOT: A man looks back 15 years to the injury that ended his career as a promising high-school football player.

PLOT: Dick Proenneke's simple, yet profound account of his 30 year adventure in the remote Alaska wilderness continues in this sequel to "Alone in the Wilderness". Watch through his eyes as he continues to document with his 16mm wind-up Bolex camera, capturing his own amazing craftsmanship, the stunning Alaskan wildlife and scenery and even a visit from his brother Ray (Jake). His epic journey takes you on a vacation away from the hustle and bustle of today's fast-paced society, and is a true breath of fresh air.—Pike Briggs

PLOT: When a student takes on a theology project, he taps into another side that had been hidden away from him.

PLOT: Simone plans to inform her conservative Jewish family that she's a lesbian, but as she proceeds with coming out she finds herself attracted to a man.

PLOT: The Earth's moon is suddenly 70% smaller and permanently crescent shaped by a devastating and unknown force. For the students of E Class, Kunugigaoka Junior High School, the being responsible is known, as their teacher. The strange and very supportive entity has given the Japanese government a challenge to save the Earth from destruction. It wants to be the teacher of the class with the lowest expectations for success, in anything. The students, armed with special weapons that only harm their teacher, must find a way to kill him before the end of the school year. If not, summer break will be canceled by the end of the world.—Titus O'Neill

PLOT: A struggling mother encounters the son she abandoned 20 years earlier.

PLOT: In this documentary, the show's emcee, Vince Vaughn, and four stand-up comedians hand-picked by Vaughn, travel the country and perform in 30 cities. This film documents the interactions on and off stage along the way.


List E:

PLOT: After the funeral of one of their own, a criminal family decides to embark on an emotionally unnerving journey in an attempt to exact bloody revenge.

PLOT: A Catholic boy tries to convert a terminally ill Jewish boy, so he will be able to go to Heaven.

One day a limousine pulls up and he is handed a check for $1,000,000 with instructions that he is to give the check back in 30 days. Initially he uses the check to convince people to extend credit to him. In the meantime he also attracts a woman who is in a dead end relationship with a bossy businessman. At the end of the 30 days, he finds his life in turmoil, the things he got on credit is repossessed, and he is being evicted from his dwelling and being sent back to Mexico.—John Sacksteder <jsackste@bellsouth.net>

PLOT: The Joker has escaped from Arkham and Batman must once again bring him in - once and for all. Unfortunately for the bat, there is something even more sinister than the Joker waiting in the alley for the dark knight detective..

PLOT: A Brooklyn smoke shop is the center of neighborhood activity, and the stories of its customers.

PLOT: Fantastic Fungi is a descriptive time-lapse journey about the magical, mysterious and medicinal world of fungi and their power to heal, sustain and contribute to the regeneration of life on Earth that began 3.5 billion years ago.

response.list_B_description: List B is more diverse in terms of subject matter than genre. It includes animation, documentaries, dramas exploring social issues (like workplace abuse and war's impact on families), historical biographies, and romantic stories. The geographical settings and time periods are also varied.
response.list_C_description: List C features a blend of anime, romance, period dramas, coming-of-age stories, fantasy adventures, redemption arcs, thrillers, biographical dramas, and heartwarming tales.  The diversity is present in both genre and emotional tone.
response.list_D_description: List D offers a mix of genres, including drama, science fiction, comedy, stand-up comedy, and crime.  The plots vary from personal journeys to futuristic crime-fighting and historical revenge tales. There's a blend of serious and comedic elements.
response.list_E_description: List E presents a diverse range of genres, including romance, science fiction horror, Shakespearean drama, historical thriller, musical drama, stand-up comedy, action, dark comedy, mystery, and superhero fiction. The settings and time periods are also quite varied.
response.list_F_description: List F includes crime thrillers, adventure, documentaries, romantic comedies, dramas exploring cultural clashes and immigration, animated adventures, science fiction, coming-of-age stories, and absurdist humor. The diversity is noticeable in both genre and cultural representation.
response.diversity_summarization: All six lists demonstrate a good level of diversity in terms of genre, themes, settings, and cultural representation. While some lists lean more towards specific genres (e.g., List B's inclusion of documentaries), the overall collection showcases a broad spectrum of cinematic storytelling.

response.diversity_summarization: The six lists exhibit varying degrees of diversity. evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: Blade forms an uneasy alliance with the vampire council in order to combat the Reapers, who are feeding on vampires.

Finally when all hope seems lost, they're pretty sure there's a monster on board the station. Somehow they all get laid, including the rubber duck.

PLOT: Improbable encounters bring tenderness, laughter and compassion to a world of urban alienation.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a diverse range of genres and settings. While there's variety, the themes of family and relationships are recurring.

The settings are geographically diverse, spanning Naples, Japan, and various other locations.
response.list_D_description: List D showcases a variety of genres, including historical drama (dressmaker), rockumentary (Barenaked Ladies), fantasy (female warrior), crime (corporate spies), animation (dinosaur adventure), drama (recovering drug addict), documentary (gambling culture), thriller (FBI Agent), documentary (Darwinists vs. Intelligent Design), and surreal comedy (Louis). The settings and themes are quite diverse.
response.list_E_description: List E offers a mix of genres: fantasy (selfish Prince), romantic comedy (surfer), dramedy (Christmas-tree salesman), documentary (Robert Durst), fantasy (dragon), action (zombie apocalypse), romantic comedy (six strangers), fantasy (ancient scroll), comedy (three bachelors), and animation (shipwrecked man). The stories explore different themes and settings.
response.list_F_description: List F includes a range of genres: dark comedy (simple funeral), crime (insurance agent), science fiction (aliens), comedy (Stig-Helmer and Ole), action (Get Smart spin-off), romantic comedy (Massimo and Laura), romantic comedy (Julien), documentary (algorithms), horror (English country manor), and comedy (Jack). The settings and themes are varied, though some comedic elements are prevalent.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a considerable variety in genres, settings, and themes.  Lists A, C, and D stand out for their particularly broad range of genres and cultural contexts.  Lists B and F show some genre diversity but with more thematic consistency. List E falls somewhere in between, offering a good mix but perhaps less geographical diversity than some of the others. Overall, the movie lists demonstrate a significant level of diversity.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: In the distant future, a small waste-collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.

She and their leader, U Aung Ko, travel through Burma, whilst witnessing many bloody acts of repression by the dictatorship, in an attempt to escape to Thailand. Based on a true story.—James Hastie <jdh1000@cus.cam.ac.uk>

PLOT: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

PLOT: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: The lives of several individuals intertwine as they go about their lives in their own unique ways, engaging in acts which society as a whole might find disturbing in a desperate search for human connection.

PLOT: In the year 2154, the very wealthy live on a man-made space station while the rest of the population resides on a ruined Earth. A man takes on a mission that could bring equality to the polarized worlds.

PLOT: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

PLOT: After their cave is destroyed, a caveman family must trek through an unfamiliar fantastical world with the help of an inventive boy.

PLOT: Teddy Daniels and Chuck Aule, two US marshals, are sent to an asylum on a remote island in order to investigate the disappearance of a patient, where Teddy uncovers a shocking truth about the place.

PLOT: A loyal and dedicated Hong Kong Inspector teams up with a reckless and loudmouthed L.A.P.D. detective to rescue the Chinese Consul's kidnapped daughter, while trying to arrest a dangerous crime lord along the way.


List B:

PLOT: A paraplegic Marine dispatched to the moon Pandora on a unique mission becomes torn between following his orders and protecting the world he feels is his home.

PLOT: Over the course of several years, two convicts form a friendship, seeking consolation and, eventually, redemption through basic compassion.

PLOT: A young boy named Kubo must locate a magical suit of armour worn by his late father in order to defeat a vengeful spirit from the past.

PLOT: Years after a plague kills most of humanity and transforms the rest into monsters, the sole survivor in New York City struggles valiantly to find a cure.

PLOT: A very rich and successful playboy amuses himself by stealing artwork, but may have met his match in a seductive detective.

PLOT: Bret Maverick, needing money for a poker tournament, faces various comic mishaps and challenges, including a charming woman thief.

PLOT: On the day that a serial killer that he helped put away is supposed to be executed, a noted forensic psychologist and college professor receives a call informing him that he has 88 minutes left to live.

PLOT: Two co-dependent high school seniors are forced to deal with separation anxiety after their plan to stage a booze-soaked party goes awry.

PLOT: A Las Vegas magician who can see into the future is pursued by FBI agents seeking to use his abilities to prevent a nuclear terrorist attack.


List C:
PLOT: In the distant future, a small waste-collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.

PLOT: A voyeuristic hotel clerk becomes the subject of a murder investigation.

PLOT: When Hiccup and Toothless discover an ice cave that is home to hundreds of new wild dragons and the mysterious Dragon Rider, the two friends find themselves at the center of a battle to protect the peace.

PLOT: A young African-American visits his White girlfriend's parents for the weekend, where his simmering uneasiness about their reception of him eventually reaches a boiling point.

PLOT: An English Duke from 1876 is inadvertently dragged to modern day New York where he falls for a plucky advertising executive.

PLOT: The sole survivor of a pier shoot-out tells the story of how a notorious criminal influenced the events that began with five criminals meeting in a seemingly random police lineup.

PLOT: A historian races to find the legendary Templar Treasure before a team of mercenaries.

PLOT: Eight candidates for a highly desirable corporate job are locked together in an exam room and given a final test with just one seemingly simple question. However, it doesn't take long for confusion to ensue and tensions to unravel.

PLOT: A marksman living in exile is coaxed back into action after hearing of a plot to kill the President. After being-double crossed for the attempt and on the run, he sets out for the real killer and the truth.


List D:

PLOT: Marty McFly, a 17-year-old high school student, is accidentally sent 30 years into the past in a time-traveling DeLorean invented by his close friend, the maverick scientist Doc Brown.

PLOT: A mean lord exiles fairytale creatures to the swamp of a grumpy ogre, who must go on a quest and rescue a princess for the lord in order to get his land back.

PLOT: A factory worker, Douglas Quaid, begins to suspect that he is a spy after visiting Rekall - a company that provides its clients with implanted fake memories of a life they would like to have led - goes wrong and he finds himself on the run.

PLOT: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.

PLOT: An insurance salesman discovers his whole life is actually a reality TV show.

List E:

PLOT: In turn-of-the-century Vienna, a magician uses his abilities to secure the love of a woman far above his social standing.

PLOT: A young man who survives a disaster at sea is hurtled into an epic journey of adventure and discovery. While cast away, he forms an unexpected connection with another survivor: a fearsome Bengal tiger.

PLOT: Daniel Ocean recruits one more team member so he can pull off three major European heists in this sequel to Ocean's Eleven (2001).

PLOT: A reporter is assigned to write a story about a woman who has left a string of fiancés at the altar.

PLOT: After the Kingsman's headquarters is destroyed and the world is held hostage, an allied spy organization in the United States is discovered. These two elite secret agencies must band together to defeat a common enemy.

PLOT: A cyborg, identical to the one who failed to kill Sarah Connor, must now protect her ten year old son John from an even more advanced and powerful cyborg.

PLOT: While on a journey of physical and spiritual healing, a brilliant neurosurgeon is drawn into the world of the mystic arts.

PLOT: Louis C.K. muses on religion, eternal love, giving dogs drugs, email fights, teachers, and more in a live performance from Washington D.C.

PLOT: A veteran assigned to extract Earth's remaining resources begins to question what he knows about his mission and himself.

PLOT: Jack Ryan, as a young covert C.I.A. analyst, uncovers a Russian plot to crash the U.S. economy with a terrorist attack.

PLOT: A divorced woman and her diabetic daughter take refuge in their newly-purchased house's safe room when three men break-in, searching for a missing fortune.

PLOT: A man and a woman are compelled, for legal reasons, to live life as a couple for a limited period of time. At stake is a large amount of money.

PLOT: A whiny news reporter is given the chance to step into God's shoes.

There's a mix of contemporary and futuristic settings, and the plots range from personal revenge to larger-scale conflicts. However, several plots involve crime or violence.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a blend of science fiction, fantasy, drama, and crime, with a touch of comedy.  The settings vary, from futuristic space stations to ancient lands, and the themes explore redemption, revenge, and supernatural elements. The plots explore themes of social commentary, adventure, and mystery, with settings spanning different time periods and locations. The diversity is good, but some plots are similar in their focus on crime or investigation.
response.list_D_description: List D showcases a mix of genres, including crime, science fiction, fantasy, comedy, and drama.  The plots explore themes of revenge, time travel, and magical realism, with settings ranging from historical periods to futuristic worlds. The diversity is good, but some plots are similar in their focus on crime or personal struggles.
response.list_E_description: List E displays a good variety of genres, including animation, comedy, fantasy, drama, and action.  The plots explore themes of friendship, adventure, and personal growth, with settings ranging from fantasy lands to modern-day locations. The diversity is good, with a balance of different themes and genres.
response.list_F_description: List F offers a mix of science fiction, action, fantasy, comedy, and drama.  The plots explore themes of technology, espionage, and spiritual journeys, with settings ranging from futuristic worlds to contemporary locations. The diversity is good, but some plots are similar in their focus on action or conflict.
response.diversity_summarization: Overall, the six lists demonstrate a reasonable level of diversity in terms of genres, themes, and settings. However, there's a noticeable tendency towards plots involving crime, violence, or personal struggles across multiple lists.

PLOT: Teddy Daniels and Chuck Aule, two US marshals, are sent to an asylum on a remote island in order to investigate the disappearance of a patient, where Teddy uncovers a shocking truth about the place.

PLOT: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soap maker form an underground fight club that evolves into much more.

PLOT: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

PLOT: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, billionaire engineer Tony Stark creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.

PLOT: With their warning about Lord Voldemort's return scoffed at, Harry and Dumbledore are targeted by the Wizard authorities as an authoritarian bureaucrat slowly seizes power at Hogwarts.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a mix of genres, including fantasy (Harry Potter, Narnia), thriller (Shutter Island), action (Iron Man, Batman, Shrek), and drama (Fight Club).  There's a balance between children's literature adaptations and adult-oriented stories, offering some diversity but not a wide range.
response.list_B_description: List B features a blend of fantasy (Harry Potter, Fantastic Beasts), action (Batman, Avengers), crime (The Departed), and sci-fi (Monsters University, Ant-Man). The inclusion of diverse subgenres within these broader categories adds to the list's diversity.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a variety of genres, including sci-fi (The Martian, Lucy, Wall-E), action (Django Unchained, Avatar, Edge of Tomorrow), drama (Sherlock Holmes, The Avengers, The Social Network), and thriller (Zodiac). The settings and themes are also diverse, ranging from space exploration to historical drama.
response.list_D_description: List V is dominated by fantasy and adventure (Up, Guardians of the Galaxy, The Prestige, V for Vendetta, Kung Fu Panda, The Hobbit, The Green Mile, Sherlock Holmes, Ratatouille, The Hunger Games). While there's some thematic variation, the genre consistency limits the overall diversity.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a good mix of animation (Toy Story, Shrek), superhero (Thor, X-Men), fantasy (Lord of the Rings, The Hobbit), adventure (Pirates of the Caribbean), and sci-fi (Mad Max: Fury Road, Groundhog Day, How to Train Your Dragon). The inclusion of different animation styles and tones enhances the diversity.
response.list_F_description: List F offers a mix of fantasy (Lord of the Rings, The Hobbit), adventure (Pirates of the Caribbean), action (Casino Royale), animation (Ice Age), superhero (Big Hero 6), and historical drama (Schindler's List, Gladiator). The time periods and settings vary significantly, contributing to the list's diversity.
response.diversity_summarization: Lists A through F exhibit varying degrees of diversity. Some lists, like C and E, demonstrate a broader range of genres and themes, while others, such as D, are more focused.  Overall, the collection of lists shows a reasonable level of diversity in terms of genre, setting, and tone, although some lists are more homogenous than others.

List B:
PLOT: The story of a man who feels happy only when he is unhappy, a man addicted to sadness, who has such need for pity, he's willing to do everything to evoke it from others. This is the life of a man in a world not cruel enough for him.

PLOT: A compilation of erotic films intended to illuminate the points where art meets sexuality.

PLOT: Kevin James is back with a new stand-up special dishing on parenting, allergies, his fans, and more.

Their honeymoon in Venice turns tragic when Fosca realizes that she cannot compete with Raniero's first wife; finally, she commits suicide--just like her predecessor did. Story 2: The vulgar Ivano is married to Jessica, and their wedding journey is an uncompromising tour of discos. Soon the two realize that their relationship is running dry, and after several attempts to revive their passion, they fall into depression and boredom. Story 3: Newlyweds Giovannino and Valeria are about to leave for a cruise, when Giovannino is forced to look after his elderly father, who has been abandoned by the caretaker. Meanwhile, Valeria takes care of her sister, who pretends to commit suicide to get money from her ex-boyfriend. Their honeymoon turns into a nightmare.—X

PLOT: A colorful and foul-mouthed feature musical comedy. A film about a frizzy-haired, pink-cheeked outcast named Spork who is trying to navigate her way through the annals of junior high. When a school dance show provides a chance for Spork to show up a mean girls gang, her trailer-park neighbor steps up to coach her with some "booty-poppin" moves. Featuring a vintage '90s soundtrack (that includes 2-Live Crew, JJ Fad's "SuperSonic," Dimples T's "Get It Girl"), a score by Casey James and the Staypuft Kid; and extended school hall dance sequences, Spork is a film about standing out and fitting in.—Spork

PLOT: 

PLOT: Faces of Death VI is a direct-to-video compilation of the highlights of the earlier films in the Faces of Death series. It features many of the same scenes shown in Faces of Death 1 and 4, as well as the earlier compilation Faces of Death V. It begins without any opening credits, before recycling (for the third time) the sequence from Faces of Death involving the killing of a monkey which is then prepared and served to patrons of a gourmet restaurant, also shown for the second time is the staged heart ripping scene by African natives and the "head in a box" scene, both taken from Faces of Death IV. John Alan Schwartz's cameo as the leader of the flesh eating cult, as well as "The encapsulation of Samuel Berkowitz", are also featured again, and the final credits are those from Faces of Death.—Faces Of Death

response.list_A_description: List A shows a mix of genres, including fantasy (Harry Potter, Narnia), thriller (Shutter Island), action (Iron Man, Batman), and fairytale (Shrek).  There's a balance between children's literature adaptations and adult-oriented stories. The diversity is moderate.
response.list_B_description: List B is highly diverse, ranging from dark comedies and erotic films to stand-up specials and dramatic stories. The inclusion of Faces of Death suggests a willingness to include controversial or disturbing content, further increasing the diversity, but also lowering the quality.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a varied selection, including fantasy (Harry Potter), documentaries (Beatles), romantic dramas (Frank and Elise), heartwarming stories (Wonder), and action/adventure (Naruto, Riddick). The range of tones and themes is notable.
response.list_D_description: List D offers a blend of crime (Three young thieves, Two New Orleans cops), drama (Valentino and Gary, Juice Leskinen), comedy (A depressed middle-aged tour guide), documentary (City of God), and historical fiction (Cathy Rush). The diversity is good, with a focus on different life stories and genres.
response.list_E_description: List E features science fiction (Guardians of the Galaxy, Logan, Interstellar), fantasy (Shrek), action (James Bond, Iron Man), and crime (War Dogs). The list is well-balanced in terms of genre and tone, showing a good level of diversity.
response.list_F_description: List F includes fantasy (Pirates of the Caribbean, Lord of the Rings), animation (Simba), drama (The Shawshank Redemption), action (Die Hard), and thriller (Sin City, Inglourious Basterds). The list is diverse, but leans slightly towards action and adventure.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists demonstrate varying degrees of diversity. Some lists, like B and C, showcase a wide range of genres and tones, including controversial content. Others, like A and F, offer a more balanced mix of genres but with less extreme variations. Overall, the collection of lists presents a diverse range of film types, but the quality of the selections varies significantly.

evaluations.prompt:
