PLOT: A clean-cut high school student relies on the school's rumor mill to advance her social and financial standing.

PLOT: Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship.

PLOT: Shallow, rich and socially successful Cher is at the top of her Beverly Hills high school's pecking scale. Seeing herself as a matchmaker, Cher first coaxes two teachers into dating each other.

PLOT: A special bond develops between plus-sized inflatable robot Baymax and prodigy Hiro Hamada, who together team up with a group of friends to form a band of high-tech heroes.

PLOT: Bruce Banner, a genetics researcher with a tragic past, suffers an accident that causes him to transform into a raging green monster when he gets angry.

PLOT: While on a journey of physical and spiritual healing, a brilliant neurosurgeon is drawn into the world of the mystic arts.


List C:
PLOT: After India's father dies, her Uncle Charlie, whom she never knew existed, comes to live with her and her unstable mother. She comes to suspect this mysterious, charming man has ulterior motives and becomes increasingly infatuated with him.

PLOT: A mermaid princess makes a Faustian bargain in an attempt to become human and win a prince's love.

PLOT: A mountain climber becomes trapped under a boulder while canyoneering alone near Moab, Utah and resorts to desperate measures in order to survive.

PLOT: When the newly crowned Queen Elsa accidentally uses her power to turn things into ice to curse her home in infinite winter, her sister Anna teams up with a mountain man, his playful reindeer, and a snowman to change the weather condition.

PLOT: Three girls are kidnapped by a man with a diagnosed 23 distinct personalities. They must try to escape before the apparent emergence of a frightful new 24th.

PLOT: A fisherman, a smuggler, and a syndicate of businessmen match wits over the possession of a priceless diamond.

PLOT: A stubborn teenager enlists the help of a tough U.S. Marshal to track down her father's murderer.

PLOT: Based on the events of the brutal Ugandan dictator Idi Amin's regime as seen by his personal physician during the 1970s.

PLOT: When Jason Bourne is framed for a CIA operation gone awry, he is forced to resume his former life as a trained assassin to survive.


List D:
PLOT: A white midwestern girl moves to Chicago, where her new boyfriend is a black teen from the South Side with a rough, semi-criminal past.

PLOT: Julia Child's story of her start in the cooking profession is intertwined with blogger Julie Powell's 2002 challenge to cook all the recipes in Child's first book.

PLOT: Nina is a talented but unstable ballerina on the verge of stardom. Pushed to the breaking point by her artistic director and a seductive rival, Nina's grip on reality slips, plunging her into a waking nightmare.

PLOT: John Beckwith and Jeremy Grey, a pair of committed womanizers who sneak into weddings to take advantage of the romantic tinge in the air, find themselves at odds with one another when John meets and falls for Claire Cleary.

PLOT: An abortion clinic worker with a special heritage is called upon to save the existence of humanity from being negated by two renegade angels trying to exploit a loop-hole and reenter Heaven.

PLOT: An alien invasion threatens the future of humanity. The catastrophic nightmare is depicted through the eyes of one American family fighting for survival.


List E:
PLOT: A woman flying to France to confront her straying fiance gets into trouble when the charming crook seated next to her uses her for smuggling.

PLOT: In 2002, an artistically inclined 17-year-old girl comes of age in Sacramento, California.

PLOT: A smart but sensible new graduate lands a job as an assistant to Miranda Priestly, the demanding editor-in-chief of a high fashion magazine.

PLOT: Charlie, a 15-year-old introvert, enters high school and is nervous about his new life. When he befriends his seniors, he learns to cope with his friend's suicide and his tumultuous past.

PLOT: A talented young boy becomes torn between his unexpected love of dance and the disintegration of his family.

PLOT: A poor yet passionate young man falls in love with a rich young woman, giving her a sense of freedom. However, social differences soon get in the way.

PLOT: A young Greek woman falls in love with a non-Greek and struggles to get her family to accept him while she comes to terms with her heritage and cultural identity.

PLOT: Paul Rusesabagina, a hotel manager, houses over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda, Africa.


List F:
PLOT: In 1980s Italy, romance blossoms between a seventeen-year-old student and the older man hired as his father's research assistant.

PLOT: A flight attendant with a criminal past gets nabbed by the ATF for smuggling. Under pressure to become an informant against the drug dealer she works for, she must find a way to secure her future without getting killed.

PLOT: A French woman and her young daughter open up a chocolate shop in a small remote village that shakes up the rigid morality of the community.

PLOT: Aspiring musician Miguel, confronted with his family's ancestral ban on music, enters the Land of the Dead to find his great-great-grandfather, a legendary singer.

PLOT: When a pilot crashes and tells of conflict in the outside world, Diana, an Amazonian warrior in training, leaves home to fight a war, discovering her full powers and true destiny.

PLOT: An aspiring author during the civil rights movement of the 1960s decides to write a book detailing the African American maids' point of view on the white families for which they work, and the hardships they go through on a daily basis.

PLOT: An Eastern European tourist unexpectedly finds himself stranded in JFK airport, and must take up temporary residence there.

PLOT: Rango is an ordinary chameleon who accidentally winds up in the town of Dirt, a lawless outpost in the Wild West in desperate need of a new sheriff.

PLOT: Renton, deeply immersed in the Edinburgh drug scene, tries to clean up and get out, despite the allure of the drugs and influence of friends.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, spanning genres like romance, sci-fi, animation, drama, and fantasy, with historical and time-travel elements.  However, there's a concentration on individual character journeys.

response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a good representation of various genres including romance, animation, drama, sci-fi, fantasy, historical fiction, crime, and social commentary. evaluations.prompt:

PLOT: In 2002, an artistically inclined 17-year-old girl comes of age in Sacramento, California.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a diverse range of genres and historical settings. The time periods range from the modern day to the Victorian era and even a fictional world.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: Twelve men heard and spread the message of Jesus. Only one woman understood it.

List B:
PLOT: The newly formed team SG-1, led by Colonel Jack O'Neill, goes on a rescue mission to the planet Chulak.

PLOT: A businessman thwarts his wife's bequest of an estate to another woman.

PLOT: The people of a small village in Victorian India stake their future on a game of cricket against their ruthless British rulers.

PLOT: A live musical recounting the final days of Jesus Christ and those around him.

PLOT: An examination of how a cultured people could have allowed Adolf Hitler's rise to power.

Barclift

response.list_A_description: List A shows a diverse range of genres and themes, including religious drama, fantasy adventure, romance, psychological thriller, and social commentary.  There's a mix of historical settings and contemporary stories, with varying levels of seriousness and tone.

response.list_D_description: List D includes a variety of genres such as biographical drama, romantic comedy, coming-of-age story, documentary, fantasy adventure, horror, stand-up comedy special, anthology film, and animated children's film. This list demonstrates a wide range of styles and target audiences.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases action thrillers, fantasy horror, war dramas, romantic mysteries, comedic reviews, mythological epics, sports dramas, science fiction, animated children's films, and LGBTQ+ themed dramas. The list is highly diverse in terms of genre, tone, and target audience.
response.list_F_description: List F offers a mix of nature documentaries, crime dramas, comedies, prison dramas, philosophical dramas, historical action, coming-of-age stories, war dramas, and animated children's films. The list demonstrates a broad spectrum of genres and themes.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a significant variety of genres represented, including action, adventure, comedy, drama, fantasy, horror, mystery, romance, science fiction, and thriller.  The settings range from historical periods to contemporary times, and the themes explored are equally diverse, touching upon social issues, political intrigue, personal relationships, and supernatural elements. While some lists lean towards specific genres, the overall collection demonstrates a broad range of cinematic styles and storytelling approaches.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, covering genres like action, adventure, fantasy, thriller, and crime.  There's a mix of established franchises (Harry Potter) and original stories, but the plots lean towards action-oriented narratives.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a broader range of genres than List A, including heist movies, dystopian fiction, romance, war, and psychological thrillers. The inclusion of diverse themes like memory manipulation and addiction adds to its variety.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a mix of crime, drama, sci-fi, and action.  The plots explore themes of violence, redemption, and the complexities of human relationships. The inclusion of true stories adds a unique element.
response.list_D_description: List D focuses more on psychological thrillers and dark fantasies.  There's a strong emphasis on character studies and exploring themes of mental instability, societal control, and illusion. The time periods vary, adding some diversity.
response.list_E_description: List E has a good mix of genres, including sci-fi, superhero, drama, and crime.  The plots explore themes of identity, mental health, and the consequences of actions. The inclusion of stories set in different time periods and locations adds to the diversity.
response.list_F_description: List F showcases a blend of crime, thriller, and drama.  The plots explore themes of friendship, ambition, and revenge.  While there's variety, the focus remains largely on crime and suspense.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists exhibit varying degrees of diversity in terms of genre, theme, and narrative style. Some lists, like B and E, demonstrate a wider range of genres and thematic explorations compared to others, such as D and F, which are more focused in their subject matter. Overall, there's a good representation of different movie types, but the level of diversity varies across the lists.

PLOT: True story of the undersized Depression-era racehorse whose victories lifted not only the spirits of the team behind it but also those of their nation.

PLOT: A wisecracking mercenary gets experimented on and becomes immortal yet hideously scarred, and sets out to track down the man who ruined his looks.

PLOT: A mountain climber becomes trapped under a boulder while canyoneering alone near Moab, Utah and resorts to desperate measures in order to survive.

PLOT: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the shocking truth--the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence.

PLOT: John Bennett, a man whose childhood wish of bringing his teddy bear to life came true, now must decide between keeping the relationship with the bear, Ted or his girlfriend, Lori.

PLOT: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.


List B:
PLOT: The former World Heavyweight Champion Rocky Balboa serves as a trainer and mentor to Adonis Johnson, the son of his late friend and former rival Apollo Creed.

PLOT: A self-indulgent and vain publishing magnate finds his privileged life upended after a vehicular accident with a resentful lover.

PLOT: In an oppressive future where all forms of feeling are illegal, a man in charge of enforcing the law rises to overthrow the system and state.

PLOT: Martin Blank is a professional assassin. He is sent on a mission to a small Detroit suburb, Grosse Pointe, and, by coincidence, his ten-year high school reunion party is taking place there at the same time.

PLOT: A puppeteer discovers a portal that leads literally into the head of movie star John Malkovich.

PLOT: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.

PLOT: An arms dealer confronts the morality of his work as he is being chased by an INTERPOL Agent.

PLOT: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

PLOT: After a Hmong teenager tries to steal his prized 1972 Gran Torino, a disgruntled, prejudiced Korean War veteran seeks to redeem both the boy and himself.

PLOT: An F.B.I. Agent goes undercover to catch a gang of surfers who may be bank robbers.


List C:
PLOT: A high-school boy in the early 1970s is given the chance to write a story for Rolling Stone magazine about an up-and-coming rock band as he accompanies them on their concert tour.

PLOT: After witnessing his parents' death, Bruce learns the art of fighting to confront injustice. When he returns to Gotham as Batman, he must stop a secret society that intends to destroy the city.

PLOT: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

PLOT: Will Hunting, a janitor at M.I.T., has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.

PLOT: Die-hard gamers compete to break world records on classic arcade games.

PLOT: Minnesota car salesman Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson.

PLOT: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.

PLOT: In a future British dystopian society, a shadowy freedom fighter, known only by the alias of "V", plots to overthrow the tyrannical government - with the help of a young woman.

PLOT: A story of family, religion, hatred, oil and madness, focusing on a turn-of-the-century prospector in the early days of the business.

PLOT: Three friends attempt to recapture their glory days by opening up a fraternity near their alma mater.


List D:
PLOT: After narrowly escaping a bizarre accident, a troubled teenager is plagued by visions of a man in a large rabbit suit who manipulates him to commit a series of crimes.

PLOT: A hapless young Viking who aspires to hunt dragons becomes the unlikely friend of a young dragon himself, and learns there may be more to the creatures than he assumed.

PLOT: A reluctant Hobbit, Bilbo Baggins, sets out to the Lonely Mountain with a spirited group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home, and the gold within it from the dragon Smaug.

PLOT: An examination of the machinations behind the scenes at a real estate office.

PLOT: Harry Potter, Ron and Hermione return to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for their third year of study, where they delve into the mystery surrounding an escaped prisoner who poses a dangerous threat to the young wizard.

PLOT: History of Apple and Microsoft.

PLOT: A young, reformed gambler must return to playing high stakes poker to help a friend pay off loan sharks, while balancing his relationship with his girlfriend and his commitments to law school.

PLOT: A phobic con artist and his protégé are on the verge of pulling off a lucrative swindle when the former's teenage daughter arrives unexpectedly.

PLOT: Teddy Daniels and Chuck Aule, two US marshals, are sent to an asylum on a remote island in order to investigate the disappearance of a patient, where Teddy uncovers a shocking truth about the place.

PLOT: A cowboy doll is profoundly threatened and jealous when a new spaceman action figure supplants him as top toy in a boy's bedroom.


List E:
PLOT: A popular high school student, admired by his peers, decides to take a day off from school and goes to extreme lengths to pull it off, to the chagrin of his Principal, who'll do anything to stop him.

PLOT: Three buddies wake up from a bachelor party in Las Vegas, with no memory of the previous night and the bachelor missing. They make their way around the city in order to find their friend before his wedding.

PLOT: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon a drug deal gone wrong and more than two million dollars in cash near the Rio Grande.

PLOT: A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.

PLOT: Henry Roth is a man afraid of commitment until he meets the beautiful Lucy. They hit it off and Henry think he's finally found the girl of his dreams until discovering she has short-term memory loss and forgets him the next day.

PLOT: A wealthy New York City investment banking executive, Patrick Bateman, hides his alternate psychopathic ego from his co-workers and friends as he delves deeper into his violent, hedonistic fantasies.

PLOT: The story of Barry Seal, an American pilot who became a drug-runner for the CIA in the 1980s in a clandestine operation that would be exposed as the Iran-Contra Affair.

PLOT: With the help of a German bounty-hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal plantation owner in Mississippi.

PLOT: A Puerto Rican former convict, just released from prison, pledges to stay away from drugs and violence despite the pressure around him and lead on to a better life outside of N.Y.C.

PLOT: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.


List F:
PLOT: Evan Treborn suffers blackouts during significant events of his life. As he grows up, he finds a way to remember these lost memories and a supernatural way to alter his life by reading his journal.

PLOT: Frankie, an ill-tempered old coach, reluctantly agrees to train aspiring boxer Maggie. Impressed with her determination and talent, he helps her become the best and the two soon form a close bond.

PLOT: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

PLOT: A man is picked up by a fishing boat, bullet-riddled and suffering from amnesia, before racing to elude assassins and attempting to regain his memory.

PLOT: An exploration of the dark and miserable Basin City and three of its residents, all of whom are caught up in violent corruption.

PLOT: In Las Vegas, two best friends - a casino executive and a mafia enforcer - compete for a gambling empire and a fast-living, fast-loving socialite.

PLOT: In a future where mutants are nearly extinct, an elderly and weary Logan leads a quiet life. But when Laura, a mutant child pursued by scientists, comes to him for help, he must get her to safety.

PLOT: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.

PLOT: During World War II, the English mathematical genius Alan Turing tries to crack the German Enigma code with help from fellow mathematicians while attempting to come to terms with his troubled private life.

PLOT: An FBI undercover agent infiltrates the mob and finds himself identifying more with the Mafia life--at the expense of his regular one.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, covering historical dramas (Thermopylae, Wallace), action (CIA agent, mercenary), sci-fi (robotic boy, Neo), sports (racehorse), adventure (mountain climber), and comedy (Ted).  However, there's a concentration on male-driven narratives and action/adventure genres.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a mix of genres including sports drama (Rocky), dark comedy (publishing magnate), dystopian fiction (oppressive future), crime (assassin, mob hitmen), surrealism (Malkovich), family drama (Park family), action (arms dealer), and social commentary (Gran Torino). The diversity is better than List A, but still leans towards male protagonists and crime/action themes.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a blend of genres: coming-of-age (high-school boy), superhero (Batman), fantasy (Hobbit), drama (Will Hunting), documentary-style (arcade gamers), crime (Fargo), animation (Up), dystopian fiction (V), historical drama (oil prospector), and comedy (fraternity). This list demonstrates better genre diversity than the previous two, but still lacks significant representation of female-led stories.
response.list_D_description: List D includes psychological thriller (teenager with visions), animation (Viking and dragon), fantasy (Hobbit), dark comedy (real estate office), children's fantasy (Harry Potter), historical documentary (Apple/Microsoft), drama (poker player), crime (con artist), psychological thriller (asylum), and dark comedy (cowboy doll).  The list is diverse in terms of genre but some plots are quite similar in tone.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a range of genres: teen comedy (high school student), comedy (Las Vegas bachelor party), crime (drug deal), historical drama (Roman general), romantic comedy (short-term memory loss), psychological thriller (Patrick Bateman), biographical crime (Barry Seal), historical drama (freed slave), coming-of-age (Puerto Rican ex-con), and sci-fi (dream-sharing technology). This list shows a good balance of genres and some representation of diverse characters, but still leans towards male-centric narratives.
response.list_F_description: List F contains a mix of genres: supernatural drama (Evan Treborn), sports drama (boxer), historical drama (Nazi-occupied France), thriller (amnesia), crime (Basin City), crime (Las Vegas), superhero (Logan), drama (quadriplegic and caregiver), biographical drama (Alan Turing), and crime (FBI agent).  The list has a good variety of genres but could benefit from more diverse character representation.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a noticeable variety in genres, including action, adventure, comedy, drama, fantasy, sci-fi, crime, historical, and biographical films. However, a common thread is the predominance of male-centric narratives and a lack of significant representation of diverse cultural backgrounds and female-led stories. While genre diversity is present, the character and thematic diversity could be significantly improved.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: Four kids travel through a wardrobe to the land of Narnia and learn of their destiny to free it with the guidance of a mystical lion.

PLOT: The Fantastic Four learn that they aren't the only super-powered beings in the universe when they square off against the powerful Silver Surfer and the planet-eating Galactus.

PLOT: In the 22nd century, a scientist attempts to right the wrong his ancestor created: the puzzle box that opens the gates of Hell and unleashes Pinhead and his Cenobite legions.

PLOT: A man shuffles through a dream meeting various people and discussing the meanings and purposes of the universe.

PLOT: To impress a foxy divorcee, ladies' man Nick offers to take her kids on an extended road trip, unaware of the torture he's in for.

PLOT: In the Iranian ghost-town Bad City, a place that reeks of death and loneliness, the townspeople are unaware they are being stalked by a lonesome vampire.

PLOT: A homeless vigilante blows away crooked cops, pedophile Santas, and other scumbags with his trusty pump-action shotgun.

PLOT: Two New Yorkers accused of murder in rural Alabama while on their way back to college call in the help of one of their cousins, a loudmouth lawyer with no trial experience.

PLOT: As part of a fertility research project, a male scientist agrees to carry a pregnancy in his own body.

PLOT: In 1978, a boy travels eight years into the future and has an adventure with an intelligent, wisecracking alien ship.


List B:
PLOT: A young boy just short of a monster is adopted by a loving man and his wacky wife. The laughs keep coming as the boy pushes them to the limits.

PLOT: Puss in Boots returns with the help of three kittens to rescue a precious ruby from the evil Whisperer.

PLOT: SG-1 search for an Ancient artifact called the Ark of Truth to finally defeat the Ori. However, the Ark is in the Ori's galaxy.

PLOT: Agents of an oil tycoon vanish while exploring a swamp marked for drilling. The local sheriff investigates and faces a Seminole legend come to life: Man-Thing, a shambling swamp-monster whose touch burns those who feel fear.

PLOT: Famed swordsman and poet Cyrano de Bergerac is in love with his cousin Roxane. He has never expressed his love for her as he his large nose undermines his self-confidence. Then he finds a way to express his love to her, indirectly.

PLOT: A talented young photographer, who enjoys snapping photos of his satirical, perverted Baltimore neighborhood and his wacky family, gets dragged into a world of pretentious artists from New York City and finds newfound fame.

PLOT: An elite team of Navy SEALs embark on a covert mission to recover a kidnapped CIA agent.

PLOT: A fashion designer must join forces with a C.I.A. agent to combat terrorism.

PLOT: Four socially troubled 18-year-olds from the south of England go on holiday to Malia.

PLOT: After reuniting with his mother in Ho Chi Minh City, a family tragedy causes Binh to flee from Viet Nam to America. Landing in New York, Binh begins a road trip to Texas, where his American father is said to live.


List C:
PLOT: Explores the under-representation of women in positions of power and influence in America, and challenges the media's limited portrayal of what it means to be a powerful woman.

PLOT: Bishop, trusted advisor to the president, has shots fired at him when Pachenko comes to him about a traitor in highest level of government. He gets away from the cold blooded assassin twice. Will he find the traitor before getting killed?

PLOT: Inspired by a true crime, a man begins to experience mystifying events that lead him to slay his mother with a sword.

PLOT: An unconventional retelling of the life of William Walker, a 19th century American mercenary leader who became the president of Nicaragua.

PLOT: A spoiled rich girl is visited by her fairy godmother and turned into a maid.

PLOT: Marc Maron returns to his old stomping grounds for an intimate special in which he takes stock of himself. More than ever, Maron is raw and hilariously honest as he dissects his own neuroses and self-loathing while providing outrageous anecdotes from his personal life, in which he starts to realize the hurt isn't real, it's just "Thinky Pain."—Anonymous

PLOT: Max goes to college, but to his embarassment his father loses his job and goes to his son's campus.

PLOT: The true story of how a seal named Andre befriended a little girl named Toni and her family in 1962.

PLOT: An investigation of a college student's missing boyfriend becomes quite strange when she begins to see him periodically.

PLOT: Strange things start happening after a girl is found drowned in a lake.


List D:
PLOT: A young man inherits a nearly bankrupt funeral home from his estranged father. He falls in love with the alluring young mortician, only to find out she's offing people to keep the place in business!

PLOT: A picture-perfect family is shattered when the work of a serial killer hits too close to home.

PLOT: Perched on the hull of a wrecked Soviet freighter, a team of deep-sea miners led by head oceanographer Steven Beck comes face to face with a mutant creature that's the product of a failed genetic experiment.

PLOT: When a Vienna museum guard befriends an enigmatic visitor, the grand Kunsthistorisches Art Museum becomes a mysterious crossroads that sparks explorations of their lives, the city, and the ways in which works of art reflect and shape the world.

PLOT: When their country is invaded and their families are taken, eight unlikely teenagers band together to fight.

PLOT: An ex-con's first act of freedom is moving to Miami where he restarts his old criminal ways with even more potency.

PLOT: A scanner discovers a plot by renegade elements in the city government to take power with the help of evil scanners.

PLOT: An in-depth look at various NASA moon landing missions, starting with Apollo 8.

PLOT: A telephone operator living an empty, amoral life finds God and loses him again.

PLOT: An unhappily married Manhattan socialite couple flee from the I.R.S. and end up in Amish country where they pretend to be visiting relatives.


List E:
PLOT: To save her small law firm, earnest lawyer Susan takes a high-paying case from Nick, a charming new client who wants to sue a dating website that guarantees love. But as the case heats up, so do Susan and Nick's feelings for each other.

PLOT: A widow tries to find out why her daughter's strange behavior, a reaction to her father's death, is progressively worsening.

PLOT: During the early years of Nazi occupation of France in World War II, romance blooms between Lucile Angellier (Michelle Williams), a French villager, and Lieutenant Bruno von Falk (Matthias Schoenaerts), a German soldier.

PLOT: Two kids set their mom up on a date with a vampire!

PLOT: A woman inherits a rent-controlled apartment and is terrorized by a neighbor.

PLOT: A small southwestern town Sheriff finds a body in the desert with a suitcase and five hundred thousand dollars. He impersonates the man and stumbles into an F.B.I. investigation.—Ed Sutton <esutton@mindspring.com>

PLOT: Live from New York City, Jerry Seinfeld, aided and abetted by a host of friends and fellow comedians, performs his 1998 Emmy-nominated performance on Broadway.

PLOT: A gang of bank robbers with a suitcase full of money go to the desert to hide out. After burying the loot, they find their way to a surreal town full of cowboys who drink an awful lot of coffee. The townspeople are hostile to the outsiders at first, but seem to accept them once they've killed a couple of people. After a while, a mysterious man named Dade arrives, who seems to have unpleasant business to settle with the robbers. A free-for-all shoot-em-up ensues.—George S. Davis <mgeorges@prodigy.net>

PLOT: In the great restaurant of life, there are those who eat and those who get eaten. Raimundo Nonato finds an alternative way, a life of his own: he cooks in order to survive and find a place in society. He arrives in town without a penny in his pockets and starts working as help in a decadent bar, a nasty place, lost amid the urban desert. He sleeps in the storage room on the back, and under a cold neon light learns how to fry "pastel" and "coxinhas", outdoing his "master", Zulmiro, the owner of the bar. Nonato is ignorant, but talented. He knows how to work the kitchen, soon others realize it too. The first one to notice him, is Iria, a prostitute, who doesn't know how to cook but loves to eat and starts an affair with him. Then, Giovanni, the owner of the Boccaccio (an Italian restaurant in the neighborhood), offers Nonato a job as his apprentice. A turn of events results in Nonato spending time in prison. For the prisoners and their boss, the violent Bujiù, Nonato is a savior; in fact soon their meager meals turn to a feast of exotic dishes orchestrated by Nonato's magic. As a consequence of this, Nonato is given the following the nickname, a well suited one indeed: Rosemary.—Anonymous

PLOT: Deep within a forest on the U.S.-Canadian border, two sworn enemies must work together to escape a ruthless drug cartel hell-bent on retrieving a drug shipment which went missing there.


List F:
PLOT: A Seattle history professor, drawn back to his estranged family on the Oregon coast to execute his late mother's estate, is reaquainted with his best friend from childhood, with whom he has a long-awaited tryst. Caught in an accelerating series of events, he discovers aspects of his father's New Age cult which take on a dangerous and apocalyptic significance.—Grant Cogswell

PLOT: Turning her back on her wealthy, established family, Diane Arbus falls in love with Lionel Sweeney, an enigmatic mentor who introduces Arbus to the marginalized people who help her become one of the most revered photographers of the twentieth century.

PLOT: Documentary about Father 'Oliver OGrady, a Catholic priest who was relocated to various parishes around the United States during the 1970s in an attempt by the Catholic Church to cover up his rape of dozens of children.

PLOT: A man travels to Italy with his family to live in the castle they have recently inherited. But he soon begins to suspect that they are not the only occupants.

PLOT: An adventure set in the early part of the 20th century and focused on a popular novelist and her dealings with would-be suitors, the cops, monsters, and other distractions.

PLOT: Crazy old Professor Gangreen has developed a way to make tomatoes look human for a second invasion.

PLOT: An American nurse living in Jamaica grows suspicious of the nearby group of Voodoo practitioners.

PLOT: A serial killer returns to his hometown to stalk seven children who share the same birthday as the date he was allegedly put to rest.

PLOT: In a world of fake castles and anthropomorphic rodents, an epic battle begins when an unemployed father's sanity is challenged by a chance encounter with two underage girls on holiday.

PLOT: Friendships are tested and secrets come to the surface when terminally single Rachel falls for Dex, her best friend Darcy's fiancé.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes, including fantasy, sci-fi, horror, drama, comedy, and thriller.  There's a mix of high-concept ideas and more grounded stories, showcasing diversity in narrative style and tone.
response.list_B_description: List B features a more consistent tone, leaning towards family-friendly adventures and comedies, with some sci-fi elements. While there's variety within this range, the overall thematic consistency limits the diversity score.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a blend of genres, including documentaries, dramas, and thrillers, with some exploring social and political themes. The inclusion of a true crime story and a focus on women's representation adds to the diversity, although the overall range is less broad than List A.
response.list_D_description: List D offers a mix of genres, including horror, thriller, sci-fi, drama, and crime.  The stories vary in setting and tone, but there's a noticeable concentration on darker themes and suspenseful narratives.
response.list_E_description: List E demonstrates a diverse range of genres and tones, from romantic comedies and dramas to thrillers and crime stories. The inclusion of a stand-up comedy special and stories set in different cultural contexts adds to the diversity.
response.list_F_description: List F showcases a mix of genres, including drama, romance, thriller, horror, and comedy. The stories vary in setting and tone, but there's a noticeable concentration on interpersonal relationships and darker themes.
response.diversity_summarization: Lists A and E exhibit the highest levels of diversity, encompassing a wide array of genres, tones, and thematic concerns. Lists B and F show less diversity, with a more focused selection of genres and themes. Lists C and D fall somewhere in between, offering a decent variety but lacking the breadth of A and E.

evaluations.prompt:

PLOT: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

PLOT: A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.

PLOT: A self-indulgent and vain publishing magnate finds his privileged life upended after a vehicular accident with a resentful lover.

PLOT: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.

PLOT: Martin Blank is a professional assassin. He is sent on a mission to a small Detroit suburb, Grosse Pointe, and, by coincidence, his ten-year high school reunion party is taking place there at the same time.

PLOT: An arms dealer confronts the morality of his work as he is being chased by an INTERPOL Agent.

PLOT: After a Hmong teenager tries to steal his prized 1972 Gran Torino, a disgruntled, prejudiced Korean War veteran seeks to redeem both the boy and himself.


List C:
PLOT: A clean-cut high school student relies on the school's rumor mill to advance her social and financial standing.

PLOT: A courier for a local crime lord must deliver a mysterious package while being chased by a horde of unusual gangsters.

PLOT: Libby Day was only eight years old when her family was brutally murdered in their rural Kansas farmhouse. Almost thirty years later, she reluctantly agrees to revisit the crime and uncovers the wrenching truths that led up to that tragic night.

PLOT: The story of a family in Waco, Texas in 1956. The eldest son witnesses the loss of innocence and struggles with his parents' conflicting teachings.

PLOT: A crew of ex-cons are hired by a Cleveland mafioso to kidnap the baby of a rival mobster.

PLOT: A single mother and waitress, a misanthropic author, and a gay artist form an unlikely friendship after the artist is assaulted in a robbery.

PLOT: A visiting city reporter's assignment suddenly revolves around the murder trial of a local millionaire, whom he befriends.

PLOT: A female pirate and her companion race against their rivals to find a hidden island that contains a fabulous treasure.

PLOT: Still recovering from a heart transplant, retired F.B.I. profiler Terry McCaleb (Clint Eastwood) returns to service when his own blood analysis offers clues to the identity of a serial killer.

PLOT: Passionada is a romantic comedy about a Portuguese widow whose husband, a fisherman, died at sea. The widow's naive teenage daughter wants to be a professional gambler and she convinces her mother to date a British man who's new in town. The widow falls for the Brit, a professional gambler who pretends to be in the fishing business.—Anonymous

PLOT: Amarendra Baahubali, the heir apparent to the throne of Mahishmati, finds his life and relationships endangered as his adoptive brother Bhallaladeva conspires to claim the throne.

PLOT: Scott Calvin has been a humble Santa Claus for eight years, but it might come to an end if he doesn't find a Mrs. Claus.

List F:
PLOT: Five Vermont state troopers, avid pranksters with a knack for screwing up, try to save their jobs and out-do the local police department by solving a crime.

PLOT: Director Tamra Davis pays homage to her friend in this definitive documentary but also delves into Basquiat as an iconoclast. His dense, bebop-influenced neoexpressionist work emerged while minimalist, conceptual art was the fad; as a successful black artist, he was constantly confronted by racism and misconceptions. Much can be gleaned from insider interviews and archival footage, but it is Basquiat's own words and work that powerfully convey the mystique and allure of both the artist and the man.—Sundance Film Festival

PLOT: Buckle up for the wildest road trip of the year. A comedy adventure about a misfit family trying to survive outrageous obstacles (including each other) on a cross-country trek to their annual family reunion.

PLOT: In the future, an alien race uses androids as bombs to attack Earth. A government weapons specialist is accused of being one such android and sets out to prove his innocence.

PLOT: Two Russians push the wrong button on a strange device and end up on the telepathic planet Pluke with its strange societal norms.

PLOT: Isolated by his strange parents, Leon finds solace in an imaginary friend, which happens to be an anatomy doll from his father's doctor office. Unfortunately, the doll begins to take over Leon's life, and his sister's life as well.

PLOT: A discovery made by a kung fu obsessed American teen sends him on an adventure to ancient China, where he joins up with a band of martial arts warriors in order to free the imprisoned Monkey King.

PLOT: Hopeless dweeb Elliot Richards is granted seven wishes by the Devil to snare Allison, the girl of his dreams, in exchange for his soul.

PLOT: A sepia tinted weepie where a niave girl learns about men in more ways than one; a loss of innocence - but full of charm

PLOT: Pete and Debbie are both about to turn 40, their kids hate each other, both of their businesses are failing, they're on the verge of losing their house, and their relationship is threatening to fall apart.

response.list_B_description: List B offers a blend of biographical, crime, historical drama, and character studies. While there's some thematic overlap (revenge, societal issues), the settings and central conflicts vary enough to provide moderate diversity.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a more eclectic mix, including teen drama, fantasy, sci-fi, action, biographical, crime, adventure, and horror. The genres are diverse, but some plots share similar coming-of-age or underdog themes.
response.list_D_description: List D features a range of genres including coming-of-age, legal drama, superhero, documentary, action-comedy, crime, thriller, drama, and crime-comedy. The settings and time periods are varied, resulting in a relatively diverse list.

response.list_F_description: List F includes comedy, documentary, adventure, sci-fi, fantasy, horror, action, and drama. The list is diverse in terms of genre, but some plots share similar themes of family or personal struggles.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists demonstrate varying degrees of diversity. Some lists, like C and D, offer a wider range of genres and plot structures, while others, like A and F, show more thematic consistency. Overall, there's a good representation of different genres and narrative styles across all lists, although the level of diversity varies.

response.diversity_summarization: Lists A through F all demonstrate a fair amount of diversity in terms of genre, theme, and setting.  List D and E show particularly strong diversity, while List B is somewhat less diverse, with a slightly uneven tone across its entries. evaluations.prompt:

PLOT: In a future where the polar ice-caps have melted and Earth is almost entirely submerged, a mutated mariner fights starvation and outlaw "smokers," and reluctantly helps a woman and a young girl try to find dry land.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes, including thriller, drama, science fiction, fantasy, animation, and crime.  There's a mix of contemporary and historical settings, and the plots vary from personal struggles to large-scale conflicts.
response.list_B_description: List B features a blend of animation, adventure, action, and dystopian fiction. While there's some variety, many plots center around adventure or quests, resulting in less thematic diversity than List A.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a mix of action, crime, war, and superhero genres.  The settings span different eras and locations, but the plots often involve violence or conflict, limiting the thematic diversity.

response.list_E_description: List E offers a variety of genres, including psychological thriller, science fiction, drama, dystopian fiction, and fantasy. The plots explore themes of identity, survival, and societal structures, showcasing more thematic depth than some other lists.
response.list_F_description: List F contains science fiction, fantasy, adventure, and comedy.  The settings and time periods are diverse, but the plots often involve quests, journeys, or escaping difficult situations.
response.diversity_summarization: Lists A and E demonstrate the highest diversity, encompassing a wide range of genres, themes, and settings. Lists B, C, D, and F show some diversity but tend to cluster around certain genres (e.g., action, adventure) or thematic elements (e.g., quests, conflicts).  Overall, the movie lists exhibit moderate diversity, with some lists showcasing more variety than others.

PLOT: In a dystopic and crime-ridden Detroit, a terminally wounded cop returns to the force as a powerful cyborg haunted by submerged memories.

PLOT: As corruption grows in 1950s Los Angeles, three policemen - one strait-laced, one brutal, and one sleazy - investigate a series of murders with their own brand of justice.


List F:
PLOT: Desperation drives four inner-city women to bank robbery in Los Angeles, then they start mistrusting each other.

PLOT: A spaceship is discovered under three hundred years' worth of coral growth at the bottom of the ocean.

PLOT: A man struggles with memories of his past, which include a wife he cannot remember and a nightmarish world no one else ever seems to wake up from.

PLOT: A group of friends venture deep into the streets of New York on a rescue mission during a rampaging monster attack.

PLOT: Humans in a fascist, militaristic future wage war with giant alien bugs.

PLOT: A bureaucrat in a dystopic society becomes an enemy of the state as he pursues the woman of his dreams.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a diverse range of genres and themes, including crime, thriller, sci-fi, action, historical drama, fantasy, and superhero narratives.  There's a mix of character-driven stories and plot-driven adventures, with settings ranging from suburban America to the Wild West to outer space.
response.list_B_description: List B presents a blend of science fiction, crime thrillers, and superhero narratives.  While there's a focus on futuristic or technologically advanced elements, the character dynamics and moral dilemmas explored add depth and variety.
response.list_C_description: List C features a strong science fiction and fantasy element, with several plots involving space travel, alien encounters, and dystopian futures.  However, there's also a notable inclusion of darker, more psychological themes, such as serial killers and societal anxieties.
response.list_D_description: List D offers a mix of genres, including fantasy, comedy, action, and crime.  The settings and character types are varied, ranging from supernatural encounters to everyday life situations.  The tone shifts between lighthearted and serious.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a combination of science fiction, action, and crime thrillers, with a focus on technology, virtual reality, and futuristic settings.  The plots often involve high-stakes situations and morally ambiguous characters.
response.list_F_description: List F presents a mix of genres, including crime, science fiction, action, and fantasy.  The plots range from realistic depictions of urban life to fantastical adventures involving aliens and monsters.  There's a blend of character-driven and plot-driven narratives.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a broad representation of genres, including science fiction, fantasy, action, crime, thriller, horror, comedy, and drama.  The settings vary widely, from futuristic dystopias to historical periods and everyday locations.  Character types and plot structures also show significant diversity, with a mix of character-driven stories, plot-driven adventures, and explorations of complex moral dilemmas.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: After a threat from the tiger Shere Khan forces him to flee the jungle, a man-cub named Mowgli embarks on a journey of self discovery with the help of panther Bagheera and free-spirited bear Baloo.

PLOT: A proficient group of thieves rob a bank and hold Claire, the assistant manager, hostage. Things begin to get complicated when one of the crew members falls in love with Claire.

PLOT: With a plan to exact revenge on a mythical shark that killed his partner, Oceanographer Steve Zissou (Bill Murray) rallies a crew that includes his estranged wife, a journalist, and a man who may or may not be his son.

PLOT: The famed monster hunter is sent to Transylvania to stop Count Dracula, who is using Dr. Frankenstein's research and a werewolf for nefarious purposes.

PLOT: A young boy named Kubo must locate a magical suit of armour worn by his late father in order to defeat a vengeful spirit from the past.

PLOT: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren work to help a family terrorized by a dark presence in their farmhouse.

PLOT: Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship.

PLOT: A family struggles for survival in a world where most humans have been killed by blind but noise-sensitive creatures. They are forced to communicate in sign language to keep the creatures at bay.


List C:
PLOT: An idealistic FBI agent is enlisted by a government task force to aid in the escalating war against drugs at the border area between the U.S. and Mexico.

PLOT: A toon-hating detective is a cartoon rabbit's only hope to prove his innocence when he is accused of murder.

PLOT: When a pilot crashes and tells of conflict in the outside world, Diana, an Amazonian warrior in training, leaves home to fight a war, discovering her full powers and true destiny.

PLOT: A woman, accidentally caught in a dark deal, turns the tables on her captors and transforms into a merciless warrior evolved beyond human logic.

PLOT: A smart but sensible new graduate lands a job as an assistant to Miranda Priestly, the demanding editor-in-chief of a high fashion magazine.

PLOT: A look at the relationship between the famous physicist Stephen Hawking and his wife.

PLOT: After the death of one of his friends, a writer recounts a childhood journey with his friends to find the body of a missing boy.

PLOT: A writer and wall street trader, Nick, finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor, Jay Gatsby.

PLOT: Peter Parker balances his life as an ordinary high school student in Queens with his superhero alter-ego Spider-Man, and finds himself on the trail of a new menace prowling the skies of New York City.

PLOT: A cab driver finds himself the hostage of an engaging contract killer as he makes his rounds from hit to hit during one night in Los Angeles.


List D:
PLOT: Between 1968 and 1983, a San Francisco cartoonist becomes an amateur detective obsessed with tracking down the Zodiac Killer, an unidentified individual who terrorizes Northern California with a killing spree.

PLOT: A pathological liar-lawyer finds his career turned upside down when he inexplicably cannot physically lie for 24 whole hours.

PLOT: A machine from a post-apocalyptic future travels back in time to protect a man and a woman from an advanced robotic assassin to ensure they both survive a nuclear attack.

PLOT: Journalist Mikael Blomkvist is aided in his search for a woman who has been missing for 40 years by young computer hacker Lisbeth Salander.

PLOT: A young boy wins a tour through the most magnificent chocolate factory in the world, led by the world's most unusual candy maker.

PLOT: Guilt-stricken after a job gone wrong, hitman Ray and his partner await orders from their ruthless boss in Bruges, Belgium, the last place in the world Ray wants to be.

PLOT: A fisherman, a smuggler, and a syndicate of businessmen match wits over the possession of a priceless diamond.

PLOT: A man gets a chance to meet up with his dream girl from high school, even though his date with her back then was a complete disaster.

PLOT: When Louis Bloom, a con man desperate for work, muscles into the world of L.A. crime journalism, he blurs the line between observer and participant to become the star of his own story.

PLOT: Daniel Ocean recruits one more team member so he can pull off three major European heists in this sequel to Ocean's Eleven (2001).


List E:

PLOT: A biologist signs up for a dangerous, secret expedition into a mysterious zone where the laws of nature don't apply.

PLOT: The story of the legendary British rock band Queen and lead singer Freddie Mercury, leading up to their famous performance at Live Aid (1985).

List F:

PLOT: In the summer of 1989, a group of bullied kids band together to destroy a shape-shifting monster, which disguises itself as a clown and preys on the children of Derry, their small Maine town.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: Jack Bauer confronts African general/aspiring dictator Benjamin Juma, whose forces have been ordered to capture the children Bauer oversees for malicious military training.

PLOT: A happy newlywed marriage counselor's views on wedded bliss get thrown for a loop when she finds out her parents are getting divorced.

PLOT: In Jerusalem, a bullied teen befriends his grandfather and long lost uncle and soon they decide to solve their financial problems by robbing a bank.

PLOT: Two terminally ill patients escape from a hospital, steal a car and rush towards the sea.

PLOT: When a man meets a young girl in a parking lot he attempts to help her avoid a bleak destiny by initiating her into the beauty of the outside world. The journey shakes them in ways neither expects.

PLOT: When a discredited L.A. seismologist warns of an impending 12.7 earthquake, no one takes her seriously. Now on her own, she races desperately to get her family to safety before the earthquake breaks Los Angeles apart from the mainland.

PLOT: A woman (Jacobson) learns her brother (Franco) has relapsed on heroin.

PLOT: A motorcycle gang kidnaps a young woman, Josie, from a diner and brutally kills her. Many years later, the girl's father finds a magic crystal that can bring the dead back to life and uses it to re-animate his daughter. He lets her seduce any young men who visit the small town--Hellgate--then kills them. Four young students, two boys and two girls, spend a vacation near the town,hear about the story, and get involved.—Mattias Thuresson

PLOT: A fable of a young boy coming of age in the most peculiar of circumstances. It's the first time his Papa and Grandpa are taking him to work. Will he be able to find his own way?

PLOT: Get ready to rock! In this upbeat musical, Barbie stars as Courtney, a princess whose world is turned upside down when she switches places with Erika, a famous rockstar.


List B:
PLOT: A stage magician's rabbit gets into a magical onstage brawl against his neglectful guardian with two magic hats.

PLOT: Simone plans to inform her conservative Jewish family that she's a lesbian, but as she proceeds with coming out she finds herself attracted to a man.

PLOT: 10 years has passed since a fire broke out in Paris, leaving only a mask behind - As the love story continues in Coney Island, NY, The Phantom's undying love has grown for the soprano singer, Christine Daae. Christine, her 10-year-old son Gustave, and her husband Raoul, the Vicomte de Changy, travel to Coney Island where Christine is scheduled to sing for Hammerstein, but ends up singing for the mysterious Mister Y. They don't know what lies ahead. Christine and Erik confess about their past, Christine and Raoul reunite with old friends, and Christine sings for her mysterious masked man once more.—cwilliams-48886

PLOT: Three young thieves infiltrate a Malibu dinner party.

PLOT: Traitors, killers and lovers collide in London.

PLOT: After moving with his family into a new home, a boy discovers a bird-like man living in the old garage on their property.

PLOT: A night in the life of a young woman who wishes to learn and experience more of life. The men she meets have as much to learn from her as they can offer her, or more.

PLOT: In the south of France, former special-ops mercenary Frank Martin enters into a game of chess with a femme-fatale and her three sidekicks who are looking for revenge against a sinister Russian kingpin.

PLOT: After an accidental explosion at a local mine, dinosaurs emerge from the rubble to terrorize a small western town. Now, a group of gunslingers must defend their home if anyone is going to survive in a battle of cowboys versus dinosaurs.

PLOT: Rod Goldman and Al Silverman are street performers who work the tourist scene of Times Square. Goldman gets no respect and Silverman is the first one to make sure of that.


List C:
PLOT: A group of snooty birds roosting on a telephone wire get their just deserts when a goofy bird drops in.

PLOT: Vizontele Tuuba is the sequel to Vizontele and recounts the 1980 military coup, the repercussions of the coup in a small southeastern town in Turkey. This is a very confusing period: every sad incident leads to a funny event or every funny incident results in sadness.—BKM

PLOT: Modern remake of Rear Window in which the lead character is paralyzed and lives in a high-tech home filled with assistive technology.

PLOT: A story of two brothers set during the Sino-Indian war, 1962: the younger one who's at war at the borders and the elder who's at war with his own world.

PLOT: Cash-strapped virtual strangers Jennifer and Vince decide to stage a fake engagement and wedding just for the presents.

PLOT: Former cop Brenner has to return to his home town where he gets involved in a tragic story between his old friends.

PLOT: The successful writer and professor of architecture Nick Kaminsky returns from New York to Elderstown to visit his biological mother Lillian Anderson Munnsen that is terminal. Nick does not know Lilian since he was adopted when he was a child but he pays the bill for her to stay in a private room in the hospital. While walking on the street, Nick stumbles upon his former college friend Paul Kessler, who is demolishing with his team an old department store building where a murder and a suicide happened many years ago. While talking to Paul, there is an accident and Nick saves his life. Paul invites Nick to go to the birthday party of his wife Jane Kessler. Nick feels attracted by the building that is built in cast iron and asks Paul to visit it. Meanwhile Jane, who is a photographer, decides to take photos of the same building. They get close to each other and Nick learns that Jane was also adopted. Along the following days, Jane and Nick have a love affair and Nick discloses hidden secrets from their past.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

PLOT: Documentary about war photographer James Nachtwey, considered by many the greatest war photographer ever.

PLOT: A shot-for-shot remake of Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981), started by three 12-year-olds and completed over a period of six years.

PLOT: A group of people run a TV show where they set up locations to scare people. Things go horribly wrong when the producer wants them to get darker as they set up an asylum to spook the new target: a creepy guy who used to work there.


List D:
PLOT: A teenage boy and girl discover a renewed sense of possibility as they go on a road trip to photograph lighthouses along the California coast.

PLOT: During archery in a wood Princess Fantaghiro is discovered by the hostile king's son Romualdo. He is able to take a short look at her before she can escape and immediately falls in love with the unknown beauty. When Romulado challenges her father for a duel to end the bloody war between their people Fantaghiro is send out to fight him due to a prophecy. As Romualdo sees her dressed as a man he believes to recognize his beloved. So he tries everything to discover wether she is a man or a woman and prevent the duel. Fantaghiro starts to fall in love with him, too, but her sense of duty is strong. Will love bring them together or will it end as a tragedy?—Matthias Scheler <tron@lyssa.owl.de>

PLOT: A SWAT team leader is forced by his captain to go undercover as a high school student to retrieve the captain's personal gun which was stolen during a school field trip to the police station.

PLOT: The famous psychologist Xu Ruining has a raising career, when he met the troublesome patient Ren Xiaoyan. The meeting is not easy as feeble-looking Ren is point by point against him.

PLOT: A drama set in New Mexico during WWII, centered on the relationship between a young man and an elderly medicine woman who helps him contend with the battle between good and evil that rages in his village.

PLOT: The Extreme Mustang Makeover Challenge is an annual contest that dares 100 people to each tame a totally wild mustang in order to get it adopted into a better life beyond federal corrals.

PLOT: Carly, Sam, and Freddie are thrilled when their web show is nominated for a prestigious iWeb Award in the "Best Comedy Web Show" category, but when one of the nominees plots to sabotage their act, the gang must get to the show on time.

PLOT: When giant monsters crawl out of the Atlantic Ocean and attack the Eastern Seaboard the US Government is forced to trust a trio of mischievous soldiers, specialized in piloting gigantic robots, to defend America.

PLOT: In the aftermath of a tragedy a woman, Magda, reacts with a surge of newfound life that engulfs her circle of family and friends.

PLOT: Three provincial men, pushing 40, and friends since university, gather at one of their bachelor pads for a get-together to play a game of truth with their former university lady crush Maya Kovalevskaya. (Russain with English subtitles).


List E:
PLOT: A small town is haunted by the twin daughters of a wrongfully convicted man. Young Jordan is sent down the path to who the real killer is, only to find the killer is very close to her.

PLOT: Geri sets up a chess game to play his greatest opponent - himself.

PLOT: A talented professor is forced to come to terms with her clinical depression.

PLOT: A heartbroken Christmas-tree salesman returns to New York City hoping to put his past behind him. Living in a trailer and working the night shift, he begins to spiral downwards until the saving of a mysterious woman and some colorful customers rescue him from self-destruction.—Anonymous

PLOT: The great hunter Buck Ferguson (Josh Brolin) and his trusted cameraman Don (Danny McBride) set out for an epic weekend adventure to reconnect with Buck's young son (Montana Jordan).

PLOT: A look at the scandalous love triangle between Victorian art critic John Ruskin (Greg Wise), his teenage bride Euphemia "Effie" Gray (Dakota Fanning), and Pre-Raphaelite painter John Everett Millais (Tom Sturridge).

PLOT: A U.S. Air Force officer tries to stop a murderous group of terrorists who are trying to steal two top secret F-117A Stealth Fighters from the cargo hold of a gigantic C-5 Galaxy Transport flying at 30,000 feet over the Pacific Ocean.

PLOT: After hearing comedian Frankie Boyle say that all comedian over 40 should quit because they're not angry enough any more, 42-year-old Stewart Lee ponders youth, piracy, pears and the hatefulness of the Top Gear presenters.

PLOT: Part documentary, part narrative, part instructional format, this film aims to teach young inexperienced youth about all things involved with "getting down", while also pointing out some of the pitfalls associated with the party lifestyle.

PLOT: Artist Matt Furie, creator of the comic character Pepe the Frog, begins an uphill battle to take back his iconic cartoon image from those who used it for their own purposes.


List F:
PLOT: Jimmy Arnaud eulogizes his mother.

PLOT: Sent to Paris to visit their grandfather, the twins fall in love with France, not to mention two French boys.

PLOT: The story of two sisters, as Britain descends into an alien apocalypse.

PLOT: A platoon of American and Finnish soldiers is driven deep into a Russian forest where its Captain discovers a terrifying secret.

PLOT: Four friends decide to participate in the game organized by extravagant billionaire. The winner will be the one who seduces most girls during the competition.

PLOT: A comedy about two brothers, uptight Ed and playboy Cooper. Ed has a weekend to save his career, but Cooper has other plans for the weekend; to help his stressed out brother get lucky with the ladies.

response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a considerable range of genres represented, including action, comedy, drama, horror, fantasy, science fiction, romance, documentaries, musicals, and animation.  However, the level of diversity varies between lists. evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: A New York City police officer tries to save his estranged wife and several others taken hostage by terrorists during a Christmas party at the Nakatomi Plaza in Los Angeles.

PLOT: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the shocking truth--the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence.

PLOT: In 2035, a technophobic cop investigates a crime that may have been perpetrated by a robot, which leads to a larger threat to humanity.

PLOT: In a future where the polar ice-caps have melted and Earth is almost entirely submerged, a mutated mariner fights starvation and outlaw "smokers," and reluctantly helps a woman and a young girl try to find dry land.

response.list_F_description: List F showcases a mix of genres, including action, adventure, fantasy, and historical drama, with diverse settings and themes. The inclusion of a LEGO-themed movie adds a unique element.
response.diversity_summarization: Lists A and E demonstrate the highest diversity, encompassing a wide range of genres, settings, and themes. Through rebuilding the three little pigs' houses with the seven dwarves leading the way, Snow White learns the value of helping others. Only Snow White can foil her dad's wedding to stop Lady Vain. response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety of genres and themes, including animation, drama, thriller, fantasy, horror, and science fiction. response.list_C_description: List C presents a more eclectic mix, encompassing musical drama, coming-of-age stories, horror, fantasy, and crime thrillers. The settings and time periods also vary significantly, adding to the diversity.
response.list_D_description: List D features a range of genres, including drama, romance, action, and thriller.  The themes are somewhat less diverse, with several films focusing on personal struggles, relationships, and crime. The overall tone is quite varied, from dark and gritty to more lighthearted.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a diverse range of genres and themes, including comedy, drama, romance, crime, and documentary.  The films explore various social and cultural issues, such as LGBTQ+ rights, family dynamics, and cultural identity.
response.list_F_description: List F presents a mix of genres, including comedy, drama, action, and documentary.  The themes are somewhat less diverse, with several films focusing on personal struggles, relationships, and crime.  There's a mix of lighthearted and serious tones.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists demonstrate varying levels of diversity. Lists A, C, and E stand out for their broader range of genres, themes, and narrative styles. Lists B, D, and F, while containing diverse genres, show less thematic variation, often focusing on similar issues like family relationships, crime, or personal struggles. Overall, there's a good representation of different genres across all lists, but the thematic diversity varies.

response.list_F_description: List F features superhero (Logan), romantic comedy (Bridget Jones's Diary), fantasy (The Butterfly Effect), fantasy (The Magicians), superhero (Avengers: Infinity War), animation (Finding Nemo), action (John Wick), sci-fi (Inception), animation (Ratatouille), and fantasy (The Hobbit). response.diversity_summarization: Overall, the six lists demonstrate a reasonable level of diversity in terms of genres and themes.  While some lists lean slightly towards specific genres (e.g., action or fantasy), the overall collection shows a good spread across animation, action, adventure, sci-fi, drama, comedy, romance, biographical, and fantasy. response.list_E_description: List E includes animation, dark comedy, historical drama, and science fiction. The plots explore diverse themes such as crime, social issues, and technological advancements, but the overall tone is relatively consistent.
response.list_F_description: List F showcases a mix of romance, superhero narratives, action, and historical epics.  The inclusion of stories about same-sex relationships and diverse cultural settings adds to the diversity, although the action-oriented plots are somewhat dominant.
response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a good representation of various genres including crime, action, romance, science fiction, fantasy, historical fiction, comedy, and drama.  Thematic diversity is also present, with explorations of social issues, relationships, personal journeys, and societal struggles. However, some lists lean more heavily towards specific genres or tones than others.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.

List C:
PLOT: Harry, Ron, and Hermione search for Voldemort's remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and themes, including crime thrillers, dramas exploring social issues (racism, class differences), dark comedies, and superhero narratives.  There's a mix of serious and lighthearted plots, and diverse character types.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a blend of action, romance, science fiction, and social commentary.  While some plots are quite fantastical, others deal with realistic relationship issues and social dynamics. The settings vary widely, from futuristic dystopias to contemporary London.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a mix of fantasy, coming-of-age stories, historical dramas, thrillers, and romantic comedies.  The settings and time periods are diverse, spanning from World War II to contemporary times. The themes include war, love, identity, and social change.
response.list_D_description: List D features a variety of genres, including science fiction, biographical dramas, dystopian thrillers, historical dramas, and coming-of-age stories.  The plots explore themes of technology, power, identity, and personal growth. The settings range from virtual worlds to historical Britain.
response.list_E_description: List E showcases a mix of action-adventure, comedies, crime dramas, and romances.  The plots explore themes of love, crime, justice, and personal struggles. The settings vary from the Caribbean to contemporary America.
response.list_F_description: List F includes comedies, action thrillers, dramas exploring existential themes, historical dramas, and superhero narratives.  The plots explore themes of identity, love, fate, and the clash of cultures. The settings range from the White House to the American South.
response.diversity_summarization: Across all six lists, there's a significant variety of genres, themes, and settings.  While some lists lean more heavily towards specific genres (e.g., action, fantasy), the overall collection demonstrates a broad spectrum of cinematic storytelling.  The inclusion of both lighthearted and serious plots, as well as diverse character types and cultural settings, contributes to the overall diversity.

evaluations.prompt:

response.list_A_description: List A shows a mix of science fiction, legal drama, war, action, animation, biographical, and post-apocalyptic genres.  There's a variety in settings and themes, showcasing different tones and styles.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a blend of animation, political thrillers, dystopian fiction, biographical sports drama, fantasy, adventure, romance, legal drama, and character studies. The themes range from political conflict to personal struggles and social issues.

response.diversity_summarization: Across the six lists, there's a significant diversity in genres, themes, and settings.  Lists include science fiction, fantasy, action, drama, comedy, romance, thrillers, biographical pieces, animation, and more.  While some lists lean towards specific genre clusters, the overall collection demonstrates a wide range of cinematic styles and storytelling approaches.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety, covering genres like science fiction, fantasy, action, and crime, but with a noticeable focus on fantasy adventures and superhero narratives.  There's some thematic diversity with plots involving artificial intelligence, magic, and intergalactic conflicts, but the overall tone leans towards high-stakes adventure.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a more balanced mix of genres, including fantasy, science fiction, crime, and action, with a slightly stronger emphasis on fantasy, particularly within the Harry Potter universe.  The inclusion of a futuristic crime thriller and a Western-inspired story adds some diversity, but the overall thematic consistency is still quite high.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a diverse range of genres and themes, encompassing superhero narratives, dystopian futures, animation, drama, and action. The inclusion of stories about mutants, monsters, and post-apocalyptic settings broadens the thematic scope significantly, creating a more varied collection than lists A and B.
response.list_D_description: List D showcases a blend of genres, including drama, animation, adventure, and superhero narratives.  While there's a presence of superhero themes, the inclusion of stories about a mathematical genius, a clownfish, and a journey to Paradise Falls adds a unique flavor. The thematic diversity is moderate, with a balance between personal struggles and larger-scale adventures.
response.list_E_description: List E provides a diverse selection of genres and themes, ranging from superhero adventures and science fiction to thrillers, dramas, and fantasy. The inclusion of stories set in different time periods and locations, along with varied character dynamics, contributes to the overall diversity. The thematic range is broader than in previous lists, encompassing personal struggles, revenge, and intergalactic conflicts.
response.list_F_description: List F offers a mix of genres, including romantic comedy, science fiction, adventure, and thriller. The inclusion of stories about interracial relationships, galactic conflicts, and murder mysteries adds to the thematic diversity. However, the overall tone is less consistent than in some other lists, with a blend of lighthearted and serious themes.
response.diversity_summarization: The six lists exhibit varying degrees of diversity in terms of genre and theme. Lists C and E stand out with their broader range of genres and more varied thematic explorations, while lists A and B show a stronger focus on fantasy and superhero narratives. Lists D and F offer a moderate level of diversity, blending different genres and themes but with some thematic consistency.

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
PLOT: Police inspector Emilien and his taxi-driver pal Daniel are back, this time on the tail of a group of Japanese yakuza.

PLOT: Explores the dangerous human impact of social networking; tech experts sound the alarm on their own creations.

PLOT: A documentary on the rise and stumble of Troy Duffy, the bartender-cum-filmmaker who was swept up by Miramax's Harvey Weinstein to turn his script for The Boondock Saints into a feature film.

PLOT: Maggie Peyton, the new owner of Herbie, Number 53, the free-wheelin' Volkswagen bug with a mind of its own, puts the car through its paces on the road to becoming a NASCAR competitor.

PLOT: When pilot Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger lands his damaged plane on the Hudson River in order to save the flight's passengers and crew, some consider him a hero while others think he was reckless.

PLOT: In 2100, when humanity has abandoned the Earth, a colony of extravagant creatures still thrives in the deepest abyss of the ocean. Deep, an adventurous "dumbo" octopus and the last one of his kind lives there with his two unconditional friends: Evo, a nerdy and clumsy angler fish, and Alice, a neurotic deep-sea shrimp. When an accident destroys their home, the guardian of the abyss, The Kraken, will send Deep and his friends on a perilous journey to find a new home. In their mission, they will be joined by Maura -a voracious moray eel- and together they will travel to amazing places like the submerged city of New York, the Titanic or the Arctic, facing formidable enemies and hilarious situations. Will they be able to bring the oceans back to their former glory?—corrected

PLOT: Following the destruction of the Twelve Colonies of Kobol by the Cylons, a rag-tag fugitive fleet of the last remnants of mankind flees the pursuing Cylons while simultaneously searching for their true home: Earth.

PLOT: Eight candidates for a highly desirable corporate job are locked together in an exam room and given a final test with just one seemingly simple question. However, it doesn't take long for confusion to ensue and tensions to unravel.

PLOT: Daniel, the driver of a very special taxi in Marseille, gets a famous soccer player to the stadium in time and later helps his clumsy police friend Émilien catch the dangerous Belgian after he escaped on Émilien's guard.

PLOT: Policemen from two precincts join forces to fight a criminal band called the "Mokotowska Group".


List B:
PLOT: A devoted husband and father helps two stranded young women who knock on his door, but his kind gesture turns into a dangerous seduction and a deadly game of cat and mouse.

PLOT: Improbable encounters bring tenderness, laughter and compassion to a world of urban alienation.
